Teaser: Japan has approved an intramedullary radius fixation device (MICRONAIL); the EU has approved a miniature retinal cannula (MicroCan) and an implantable pulse generator neurostimulation system (Eon).

Headlines: CT and Ultrasound Both Effective for Diagnosing Acute Pelvic Pain in Women
Teaser: Abdominal/pelvic computed tomography and pelvic ultrasound imaging were helpful in making the correct diagnosis in 80% of cases.

Headlines: 22nd Annual Meeting of the American Academy of Pain Medicine
Teaser: Read key findings on pain and its treatment from the 22nd Annual Meeting of the American Academy of Pain Medicine.

Headlines: NSAIDs Appear to Increase Blood Pressure More Than Celecoxib
Teaser: Although the effect was slight with celecoxib, both NSAIDs and celecoxib increased blood pressure more than did placebo.

Headlines: Persistent Pain and Palliative Care
Teaser: Chronic pain and end-of-life care: a comprehensive review from ACP 2006.

Headlines: Hormonal and Reproductive Factors Associated With  Low Back Pain
Teaser: Factors related to increased estrogen levels like (past) pregnancy, young maternal age at first birth, duration of oral contraceptive use, and use of estrogens during menopause may trigger back pain.

Headlines: Combining Duragesic Patches With Other Pain Medications
Teaser: Is it acceptable to combine transdermal fentanyl (Duragesic patch) with either methadone or oral transmucosal fentanyl citrate (OTFC [Actiq]) for breakthrough pain?

Headlines: Scheuermanns Disease and Melkersson-Rosenthal Syndrome
Teaser: A 47-year-old woman presented to the rheumatology clinic for evaluation of her back pain.

Headlines: NINR: June 2006
Teaser: This month's summaries from NINR highlight nurse staffing in nursing homes, BMD and menopause, dyslipidemia, opioids in men, sleep in preterm infants, and more.

Headlines: Postsurgical Pain: A Viewpoint
Teaser: Commentary on a study on postsurgical pain published May 13, 2006 in The Lancet.

Headlines: Conservative Measures for Low Back Pain
Teaser: Commentary on a review of low back pain published January 26, 2006 in Spine.

Headlines: Comorbid Subjective Health Complaints in Low Back Pain
Teaser: Compared with the normal reference population, patients with low back pain have significantly more low back pain, neck pain, upper back pain, pain in the feet during exercise, and other pain issues.

Headlines: Nurses' Reflections on Pain Management in a Nursing Home Setting
Teaser: Incomplete knowledge, outdated attitudes, myths, and misconceptions about pain and its treatment among staff and residents contribute to unsafe, inadequate, and inappropriate pain management in the nursing home setting.

Headlines: Pain Assessment in Nonverbal Patients: Clinical Recommendations
Teaser: Can you effectively manage pain in the elderly with advanced dementia, infants and preverbal toddlers, and intubated and/or unconscious patients? Learn more here.

Headlines: Lornoxicam Quick-Release Compared With Diclofenac Potassium
Teaser: Quick-release lornoxicam, a potent NSAID, offers faster pain relief and is more effective on most measures than an equivalent formulation of diclofenac potassium.

Headlines: Assessing Pain Intensity in Older Adults
Teaser: Pain assessment can be performed in a reliable fashion in older individuals using a number of validated clinical tools.

Headlines: Postoperative Pain Management for the Aging Patient
Teaser: Older adults may require a customized approach to pain management after surgery.

Headlines: Reforming Primary Care: A Comprehensive Strategy From the American College of Physicians
Teaser: Is the collapse of primary care imminent? A comprehensive plan to prevent this from ACP 2006.

Headlines: FibromyalgiaA Different Type of Pain
Teaser: This Review describes a multimodal approach to treating this central pain syndrome, using neuroactive drugs that modulate sensory processing.

Headlines: Cost-Effectiveness of Two Self-Care Interventions to Reduce Disability
Teaser: An incremental cost-effectiveness analysis of 2 self-care interventions designed to reduce disability and activity limitations associated with back pain in primary care patients....

Headlines: Work Retention and Nonspecific Low Back Pain
Teaser: A cohort study of patients with nonspecific low back pain (LBP) participated in a rehabilitation program to identify factors that predict work retention 24 months after treatment.

Headlines: Validation of the Critical-Care Pain Observation Tool in Adult Patients
Teaser: New data suggests that the Critical-Care Pain Observation Tool may be used to assess the effect of various measures for the management of pain.

Headlines: Oral Modified-Release Opioid Products for Chronic Pain Management
Teaser: This review compares available opioid products in terms of half-life, cost, and formulation, all factors in appropriate pain management.

Headlines: Understanding What People With Arthritis Believe About
Teaser: Study of Perceived Exercise Barriers, Enablers, and Benefits Suggests Ways to Increase the Rates of Regular Exercise Among Arthritis Patients

Headlines: Reduced Levels of Antiinflammatory Cytokines and Chronic  Pain
Teaser: Lower levels of anti-inflammatory proteins may contribute to chronic widespread pain

Headlines: Managing Pain in Primary Care Patients
Teaser: Make a phone call and help your patient manage pain.

Headlines: Anxiety Disorders Association of America 26th Annual Conference
Teaser: Why do those with anxiety not seek treatment? Can a computer help deliver CBT? Does motivational interviewing improve outcomes for children with OCD? All this and more.

Headlines: NINR: July 2006
Teaser: Review the latest research on trauma during vaginal birth, mammography in black women, research and clinical practice, music and pain, CVD in black women, and hypersensitivity in preterm infants.

Headlines: First-Time Generic Approvals: Mobic, Propecia, Zithromax
Teaser: The FDA has approved first-time generic formulations for meloxicam 7.5- and 15-mg tablets (Mobic), finasteride 1-mg tablets (Propecia), and azithromycin 100-mg/5-mL and 200-mg/5-mL oral suspension (Zithromax).

Headlines: Patients in a Specialized Oncology Unit Report Less Pain
Teaser: A new study suggests that cancer patients admitted to a dedicated oncology care facility may experience important benefits compared with those treated in general medical units.

Headlines: Appropriate Use of Nonprescription Analgesics in Pediatric Patients
Teaser: DonÂt miss this very practical article, with tips for professionals and guidance when providing family education.

Headlines: Vertebroplasty and Kyphoplasty Relieve Pain in Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: Assessing the safety and efficacy of the procedures, researchers have found that vertebroplasty and kyphoplasty represent treatments of choice in selected patients with severe refractory pain from pathologic compression fractures.

Headlines: Interrater Reliability of the COMFORT Scale
Teaser: How can you best assess pain in critically ill and sedated children?

Headlines: Using GIS in a First National Mapping of Functional Disability
Teaser: While GIS is mainly used to understand infectious disease and environmental threats, this study examined patterns of disability as an impact of chronic disease in American Indians and Alaska natives.

Headlines: Inappropriate TCA Prescribing Found for Pain in the Elderly
Teaser: Concomitant diseases and advanced age may contraindicate the use of tricyclic antidepressants for neuropathic pain.

Headlines: Patient-Controlled Oral Analgesia: A Low-Tech Solution in a High-Tech World
Teaser: A primary concern of surgical patients is pain. Here is a method that has worked well in the hospital setting.

Headlines: Viewpoint: Unexpected Adverse Effects Seen With Morphine
Teaser: An observational study found less familiar adverse effects, such as myoclonus, with chronic administration of morphine for cancer pain.

Headlines: Diagnosing and Treating Fibromyalgia in a Patient With RA
Teaser: Fibromyalgia is a chronic musculoskeletal pain disorder of unknown etiology. In this expert interview, Daniel Clauw, MD, presents valuable insight into the current state of knowledge on this disease.

Headlines: Viewpoint: Morphine-Ketorolac Combination Superior for Renal Colic
Teaser: The acute, excruciating pain of renal colic was relieved more quickly and effectively with a combination of pain medications than with either drug alone.

Headlines: Revised Faces Pain Scale, Verbal Descriptor Scale, Numeric Rating Scale
Teaser: Learn which pain assessment scales work best with varying groups.

Headlines: Ibuprofen May Reduce Protective Effects of Aspirin
Teaser: According to the FDA, patients should be instructed on the appropriate timing of ibuprofen dosing if they are also taking aspirin for cardioprotective effects.

Headlines: Natural Antiinflammatory Agents for Pain Relief in Athletes
Teaser: The authors of this article discuss the biochemical pathways of nonsteroidal drugs,their potentially serious side effects, and the use of natural supplements.

Headlines: International Approvals: Lyrica and Remicade
Teaser: The EU has approved expanded indications for pregabalin capsules (Lyrica) and infliximab injection (Remicade).

Headlines: Lacosamide Promising in Relief of Painful Diabetic Neuropathy
Teaser: Results of a multicenter randomized trial of a still-investigational anticonvulsant drug, lacosamide, suggests the drug is both most efficacious and well tolerated at a dose of 400 mg/day.

Headlines: International Approvals: Champix, Synvisc, Glivec
Teaser: The EU has approved varenicline tartrate 0.5- and 1-mg tablets (Champix), an expanded indication for hylan G-F 20 injection (Synvisc), and new indications for imatinib mesylate tablets (Glivec).

Headlines: International Approvals: Melody/Ensemble, Organ Care System, Eon
Teaser: The EU has approved a transcatheter pulmonary valve (Melody) with delivery system (Ensemble), and a maintenance system for donor organs (Organ Care System); Australia has approved an implantable pulse generator neurostimulation system (Eon).

Headlines: Off-label Ketamine Use Studied for Pain Management
Teaser: Ketamine offers options for managing pain in patients who do not respond to standard pain therapies, but data are lacking about possible adverse effects.

Headlines: Back and Neck Pain in Triathletes
Teaser: Learn about this epidemiological study designed to establish the lifetime incidence of neck and back pain, gauge the prevalence of discogenic pain, and identify risk factors among triathletes.

Headlines: Impact of Opiate Analgesics in Patients With Acute Abdominal Pain
Teaser: David A. Johnson, MD, provides clinical commentary on a recent article published in JAMA on the impact of opiate use on physicians' assessment of patients with acute abdominal pain.

Headlines: Checklist Helps Identify Inappropriate Opioid Use
Teaser: A new tool can help clinicians identify patients being treated for chronic pain who may be addicted to pain medications.

Headlines: Pregabalin Effective for Neuropathic Pain After Spinal Cord Injury
Teaser: A placebo-controlled trial shows the anticonvulsant pregabalin effectively relieved central neuropathic pain and improved sleep and anxiety as well in patients with spinal cord injury.

Headlines: Pregabalin May Relieve Fibromyalgia Pain
Teaser: In a double-blind study that followed an initial open-label washout period, time to loss of therapeutic response was significantly longer for patients treated with pregabalin compared with those receiving placebo.

Headlines: Methadone-Related Fatalities Underscore Need for Careful Dosing
Teaser: Inadvertent systemic accumulation of methadone (Dolophine) can increase the risk for respiratory depression and cardiac arrhythmias.

Headlines: Opioids for Chronic Nonterminal Pain
Teaser: This article presents current evidence on the benefits and risks of long-term opioid therapy, suggests a structured approach to chronic opioid management for pain, and discusses some of the issues surrounding opioid treatment of chronic pain.

Headlines: Osteoarthritis Patients Treated With Acupuncture Show Improvement
Teaser: A new study show a promise in acupuncture for managing pain associated with osteoarthritis

Headlines: The Treatment of Disc Herniation-Induced Sciatica With Infliximab
Teaser: This is the first report of long-term findings from a randomized controlled trial evaluating the efficacy of an anti-TNF-alpha treatment in disc herniation-induced sciatica.

Headlines: MEDAL: Etoricoxib and Diclofenac Have Same CV Risk
Teaser: Both drugs were similar in effectiveness against arthritis symptoms, but diclofenac was associated with more upper-GI and hepatic events, whereas etoricoxib showed more heart failure and discontinuations due to edema and hypertension. Discussion is focusing on whether diclofenac was the appropriate comparator drug, as it is also believed to carry an increased cardiovascular risk.

Headlines: Prescribing Opioids for Chronic Pain
Teaser: The use of opioids for nonmalignant chronic pain remains controversial. The authors of this Viewpoint discuss the complexities of opioid therapy and present a balanced approach to prescribing opioids.

Headlines: White Cancer Patients' Perception of Gender and Ethnic Differences in Pain
Teaser: Healthcare clinicians need to respect cancer patients' own experiences, attitudes, and meanings related to cancer pain.

Headlines: Patient Controlled Analgesia (PCA)
Teaser: Review the position statement by the American Society of Pain Management Nursing on authorized and unauthorized dosing of analgesic infusion pumps.

Headlines: Acute Nonspecific Abdominal Pain
Teaser: Acute nonspecific abdominal pain is a common cause of emergency surgical hospitalization.  Should early laparoscopy be performed?

Headlines: Fentanyl HCl Patient-Controlled Iontophoretic Transdermal System for Pain
Teaser: IONSYS is successful in controlling acute postoperative pain that circumvents the limitations of intravenous patient-controlled analgesia.

Headlines: Opioid Therapy for Refractory Pain in Children with Juvenile RA
Teaser: In this Viewpoint, Dr Connelly and Dr Schanberg discuss the limited knowledge regarding the widespread occurrence of pain and research into treatment with opioids in children with arthritis.

Headlines: Motor Cortex Stimulation for Intractable Pain
Teaser: Learn about the history, technique, and outcome of motor cortex stimulation for patients with refractory deafferentation pain syndromes.

Headlines: FDA Approvals: Ziana, Kadian, Polyphenon E
Teaser: The FDA has approved clindamycin phosphate 1.2% plus tretinoin 0.025% gel (Ziana), an 80-mg dose strength for morphine sulfate extended-release capsules (Kadian), and an herbal topical ointment (Polyphenon E, 15%).

Headlines: Why, Orthopaedic Surgery?
Teaser: In his second reFLEXIONS and rePERCUSSIONS: Goodley Intentions, Paul Goodley, MD, continues his exploration of the state of the state in orthopaedics by simply asking, "Why orthopaedic surgery?"

Headlines: How Safe Are Opiates for Patients With Acute Abdominal Pain?
Teaser: Commentary on a study published October 11, 2006 in JAMA.

Headlines: Pain Management in Caregivers of Cancer Patients Receiving Homecare
Teaser: Education about pain and the use of analgesics is imperative for caregivers of cancer patients.

Headlines: Tramadol in the Treatment of Neuropathic Cancer Pain
Teaser: Tramadol offers the benefits of both opioids and tricyclic antidepressants, making it a reasonable therapeutic option.

Source: Evidence-based Complementary and Alternative Medicine: eCAM
Headlines: Effectiveness of Massage Therapy for Chronic, Non-malignant Pain: A Review
Teaser: This article provides a broad overview of the effectiveness of massage therapy for a variety of chronic, non-malignant pain complaints to identify gaps in the research.

Headlines: Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (CJD)
Teaser: A 50-year-old female executive presented with a 6-week history of several neurological symptoms, including right facial pain and numbness.

Headlines: Evaluation of herbal cannabis characteristics by medical users
Teaser: Cannabis sativa (marijuana, weed, pot) is being used by patients with chronic debilitating diseases  and chronic non-cancer pain. This article explores  if there is a preferred cannabis preparation?

Headlines: Botulinum To Injections Possible Treatment for Refractory Headache Syndrome
Teaser: A new study suggests that botulinum toxin A may be helpful in treating patients with refractory headache syndrome. A retrospective review showed reduction in the number and duration of headaches in patients with chronic migraines, daily headaches, and cervicalgia headaches who had failed conventional treatment.

Headlines: First-Time Generic Approvals: Inderal LA, Duragesic-12, DuoNeb
Teaser: The FDA has approved first-time generic formulations for propanolol HCl extended-release capsules (Inderal LA); a fentanyl transdermal system (Duragesic-12); and albuterol sulfate plus ipratropium bromide inhalation solution (DuoNeb).

Headlines: MEDAL GI Results Published
Teaser: Detailed gastrointestinal results from the trial, comparing Mercks new COX-2 inhibitor etoricoxib with diclofenac, show significantly fewer uncomplicated upper-gastrointestinal clinical events with etoricoxib, but no difference in complicated GI events, leading to questions about whether this benefit is clinically relevant.

Headlines: Pharmacogenomics and TDM May Decrease Adverse Drug Reactions
Teaser: Genotyping chronic pain patients in addition to use of therapeutic drug management may improve patient outcomes by reducing adverse drug reactions, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Cannabis Effectively Relieves HIV Sensory Neuropathy
Teaser: Cannabis is effective for the treatment of HIV-related sensory neuropathy, a condition that affects up to 30% of AIDS patients over their lifetime.

Headlines: Spinal Cord Stimulation May Treat Axial Low Back Pain
Teaser: Researchers are reporting encouraging preliminary results with spinal cord stimulation to relieve axial back pain associated with failed back surgery syndrome.

Headlines: Limited Success for Lumbar Epidural Steroid Injections in Stenosis
Teaser: A survival and cost analysis shows limited success of lumbar epidural steroid injections in patients with moderate and severe stenosis.

Headlines: ChronicBabe Offers Alternative to "Whining" About Illness
Teaser: Patients with chronic illnesses have a right to feel bad about their diagnoses, but this Web site offers resources and encouragement to help them move on.

Headlines: Hydromorphone in Urine Drug Tests is an Indicator of Morphine Therapy
Teaser: Results of a new study confirm that hydromorphone is a minor metabolite of morphine and appears on urine drug testing, suggesting it may be used to determine whether patients are compliant with therapy.

Headlines: ChronicBabe Weathers Changes in Her Life
Teaser: A blogger compares her recent upheavals to living with chronic illness.

Headlines: Acetaminophen Toxicity
Teaser: Taking too much acetaminophen can cause big problems. This drug should not be used casually.

Headlines: Managing Pain, Managing Ethics
Teaser: Doing the best you can do -- sometimes managing pain is especially difficult in the home hospice situation.

Headlines: Treating Opioid Addiction With Buprenorphine-Naloxone
Teaser: Should greater numbers of patients have access to buprenorphine treatment in nonspecialized settings?

Headlines: Cancer Pain
Teaser: Legal barriers, restricted resources, lack of physician training, and concern about potential opioid addiction can be barriers to effective and rational pain management in patients with cancer pain.

Headlines: Fibromyalgia Treatment Update
Teaser: Fibromyalgia is a common but complex chronic pain disorder with few consistently effective treatments. Treatment options based on published literature  is presented in this review.

Headlines: A Case of Axial Undifferentiated Spondyloarthritis Diagnosis and Management
Teaser: This Case Study describes the diagnosis of axial undifferentiated spondyloarthritis in a young man with inflammatory back pain, and his subsequent management.

Headlines: Occipital-Nerve Stimulation May Effectively Relieve Cluster Headache
Teaser: Two studies show promising results using occipital-nerve stimulation to treat intractable cluster headaches.

Headlines: Depression and Pain in Retired Professional Football Players

Teaser: Arthritis Pain Is Processed in Brain Areas Concerned With Emotions and Fear, Finds Study, Indicating Target for Pain-Relieving Therapies

Headlines: Effectiveness of a Back Pain Prevention Program
Teaser: A randomized controlled trial investigating the effects or costs savings of a multidimensional LBP prevention program combining education and training.

Headlines: Diabetic Neuropathy--A Review

Teaser: In this Review, the authors discuss the clinical presentation, etiology, pathogenesis and treatment of scleritis, an extremely painful condition.

Headlines: Oxycodone Hydrochloride Controlled-Release Tablet for Cancer Pain
Teaser: The first study of OCRT in a Chinese population offers interesting insights on dosing strategies.

Teaser: Sewing machine operators are reported to have more chronic neck/shoulder pain than other workers. Might adjustable height task chairs with curved seat pan reduce posture-related risk factors and pain?

Teaser: Acetaminophen is considered safer than aspirin or NSAIDs as an analgesic in patients taking warfarin, but what about potential interactions between the 2 drugs?

Headlines: Treatments Among Primary Care Consulters with Chronic Musculoskeletal Pain
Teaser: More than four of every five patients interviewed had used at least one CAM treatment--with reports of benefits and some harm.

Headlines: NINR: April 2007
Teaser: Topics this month include management of hypertension, pain management in sickle cell disease, immune effects of stress and depression, hemodialysis patients and sleep, and more.

Headlines: Examining for Pains in the Neck
Teaser: Neck pain is complex and can be frustrating to both patient and clinician. Dr. Goodley provides some practical principles to improve understanding of examination approaches to pain in the neck.

Teaser: According to the FDA, the company's salespeople illegally promoted the drug as less likely to cause addiction, abuse, tolerance, and withdrawal.

Teaser: Advice about dental pain is often sought from pharmacists, but how can you distinguish between benign and serious etiologies?

Teaser: There are many options available to manage pain in older adults, including those with cognitive impairment. Learn how to better assess and manage pain in this population.

Source: Topics in Advanced Practice Nursing eJournal
Headlines: A Complementary Approach to Pain Management
Teaser: Clinicians face multiple challenges when patients ask for their input about CAM therapies. While some forms of CAM can be effective for relief of pain, the evidence is often not compelling.

Headlines: International Approvals: Aerius, Sebivo, Rapydan
Teaser: Europe has approved desloratadine orodispersible tablets and oral solution (Aerius) and telbivudine 600-mg tablets (Sebivo); Sweden has approved a lidocaine/tetracaine 70-mg/70-mg local anesthetic patch (Rapydan)

Headlines: Morphine Dosing in Acute Pain: How Much Is Enough?
Teaser: Underdosing of opioid analgesia is a significant problem in emergency medicine. Does administering a standard incremental dose of morphine offer a clinically significant benefit?

Teaser: The FDA has approved pregabalin (Lyrica, Pfizer) as the first treatment for fibromyalgia.

Teaser: Results from a phase 2 clinical study indicate that MK-0974, an investigational oral calcitonin gene-related peptide-receptor antagonist, treats migraines in a majority of people.

Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration has granted premarket approval for a neurostimulation lead, 510(k) clearance for power injectable ports and safety needles, and an automated blood testing instrument.

Teaser: Patients like PCA and find the therapy easy to use, but do you know how to deliver PCA safely?

Teaser: To reduce disability from chronic low back pain, is usual outpatient physiotherapy, spinal stabilization training, or physiotherapist-led pain management the most effective and/or cost-effective?

Headlines: Perceptions of Pain Control by Patients With Cancer and Their Caregivers
Teaser: Perceiving a lack of control over pain affects daily life in the home setting. How can we help?

Source: Topics in Advanced Practice Nursing eJournal

Teaser: Mrs. Tandy's pain was described as a severe burning (10/10 in intensity) that had been constant for 6 years, gradually worsening over time. It bothered her most at night.

Headlines: RN Management and Monitoring of Analgesia by Catheter Techniques
Teaser: The American Society for Pain Management Nursing offers recommendations to RNs and healthcare institutions to ensure the safe and effective administration of analgesia by catheter techniques.

Teaser: Anesthetic choice for surgical abortions is a suggested determinant of mental health outcome. Post-termination psychological effects and pain from local anesthesia vs. intravenous sedation is unclear.

Teaser: Learn about assessment and treatment that can make managing pain in opioid abusers more effective.

Teaser: Some physicians, especially surgeons, continue to use meperidine as a first-line agent for pain management, despite its documented dangers.

Headlines: Pulmonary Embolism in an Adolescent Soccer Player: A Case Report
Teaser: Pulmonary emboli, potentially life threatening, are rare in young healthy athletes. A case is presented of a previously healthy pediatric athlete who developed acute pulmonary emboli of unknown origin

Teaser: The Prescription Opioid Addiction Treatment Study has enrolled and treated about 200 of 648 planned participants at the study's 11 sites.

Teaser: What are the risk factors for MRI-detected bone stress injuries in the pelvis, hip, thigh, and knee? Do the risk factors differ between different anatomic sites?

Teaser: New research looks at staffing and patient outcomes, giving bad news in the ICU, kids and pain meds, and supporting caregivers of hospice patients.

Teaser: Neurologic complications are infrequently reported after percutaneous vertebral stabilization. How often do neurologic deficits occur, what is their pattern, and how might these injuries be avoided?

Headlines: Pain Management Competency Evidenced By a Survey of Pediatric Nurses
Teaser: Self-assessment can help determine if your pain management practice is based upon the best evidence available.

Teaser: Learn more about the physiology underlying opioid tolerance and opioid-induced hyperalgesia.

Teaser: Although efficacious in treating neuropathic pain and postherpetic neuralgia, this drug is most appropriate for certain patients in certain circumstances.

Teaser: Percutaneous vertebroplasty has safely and successfully treated osteoporotic compression fractures. Might percutaneous sacroplasty work as well in treating osteoporotic sacral insufficiency fractures?

Teaser: Switzerland has approved nilotinib (Tasigna), Canada has approved a once-daily formulation of tramadol HCl, and Italy has granted marketing authorization for a hexaminolevulinate product (Hexvix).

Teaser: A Cochrane Review Abstract: Evidence Based Medicine reviews based primarily on meta-analysis of controlled clinical trials.

Headlines: Is Stereotactic Radiosurgery the Best Treatment Option for Patients
Teaser: Single-fraction stereotactic radiosurgery is an effective treatment for patients with brain tumors and brain metastases. How about for patients with spinal metastases?

Teaser: How does autologous conditioned serum compare with triamcinolone in the treatment of pain and other inflammatory symptoms of lumbar radicular compression?

Teaser: Is the Chronic Care Model as an appropriate framework for nonmalignant pain management?

Headlines: Underutilization of Headache Medications in a University Hosptial ED
Teaser: Migraine guideline criteria are underused, and patients are undertreated in the emergency department, conclude the authors of this study. Many patients leave without a discharge diagnosis, outpatient medications, or instructions.

Headlines: A Systematic Review of Oral Triptans in Treatment of Migraine
Teaser: This analysis updates the comparative data available for the 7 currently marketed oral triptans vs placebo in the acute treatment of migraine attacks.

Headlines: Optimizing Pain Management in Long-Term Care Residents
Teaser: Pain is common among long-term care residents and is often undertreated.  This study presents an overview of assessment and treatment of pain in residents, and gives recommendations for improvements.

Source: Journal of Hospice and Palliative Nursing
Headlines: Regulations and Implications for Effective Pain Management at End-of-Life
Teaser: The restrictions placed on APN prescribing of controlled substances suggest a potentially negative impact on the management of pain and other symptoms in patients at the end-of-life.

Headlines: Prevalence of Pain in Patients With Cancer
Teaser: Despite the increase in opioid utilization, the prevalence of pain in cancer patients remains a major problem.

Headlines: Hip-Spine Syndrome: Total Hip Replacement Surgery's Effect on Low Back Pain
Teaser: Severe hip osteoarthritis, associated with low back pain, causes abnormal gait and spinal symptoms. Might relief of hip symptoms from total hip replacement alleviate back pain of hip-spine syndrome?

Headlines: Nurse Case Management of Chronic Pain Patients Treated with Methadone
Teaser: A nurse-led case management program for patients using methadone for chronic pain can improve patient care in an ambulatory setting.

Headlines: Opioids or Epidural Analgesia after Surgery
Teaser: Commentary on a study epidural versus parenteral opioid analgesia published June 2007 in the British Journal of Surgery

Headlines: International Approvals: NovoRapid, Fentanyl, Atriance
Teaser: Europe has approved an expanded indication for insulin aspart subcutaneous injection (NovoRapid), Japan has approved an expanded indication for fentanyl citrate 0.1 and 0.25 mg injections, and Europe has approved nelarabine intravenous injection (Atriance).

Headlines: International Approvals: Ralivia, Rasilez, Avastin
Teaser: Canada has approved a once-daily, extended-release formulation of tramadol HCl tablets (Ralivia); Europe has approved aliskirin tablets (Rasilez) and a new indication for bevacizumab infusion (Avastin).

Headlines: FDA Issues Public Health Advisory for Fentora
Teaser: The agency emphasizes that fentanyl buccal tablets should be used only for approved indications, and physicians should ensure appropriate dosing/titration to reduce the risk for respiratory depression.

Headlines: Injection Therapies -- Revelations and Reflections
Teaser: From cortisone injections to prolotherapy and nerve blocks, Dr. Goodley contends with the orthopod's role in this area of pain treatment.

Headlines: Absorption of Fentanyl from Fentanyl Buccal Tablet in Cancer Patients
Teaser: Cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy or radiotherapy may develop painful oral mucositis. How does the absorption profile of fentanyl buccal tablet compare in patients with and without mucositis?

Headlines: Pain Study Shows a "Window of Efficacy" for Smoked Cannabis
Teaser: A new study shows that while mid-range doses of smoked cannabis resulted in "modest" pain relief, high doses actually increased pain levels.

Headlines: Hypolipidemic Drug Effective for Adult Myopathic CPT2 Deficiency
Teaser: Bezafibrate is the first therapy to relieve muscle pain and improve quality of life for patients with a mitochondrial fatty acid oxidation disorder.

Headlines: New Peel-Away Topical Anesthetic Reduces Pain of Laser Resurfacing
Teaser: Lidocaine-tetracaine combination was more effective than lidocaine-prilocaine cream when applied 30 minutes before the procedure.

Headlines: Management of Chronic Noncancer Pain in the Primary Care Setting
Teaser: These patients should not be denied access to opioid therapy, but they do require focused monitoring and case management.

Headlines: Mirror Therapy Also Effective Against Lower-Limb Phantom Pain
Teaser: Results of a randomized sham-controlled study suggest that mirror therapy, already shown to help reduce phantom limb pain for those with upper-limb amputations, can also help lower-limb amputees.

Headlines: What's the Best Pain Management Strategy for Neonates?
Teaser: What types of analgesics are recommended for use in neonates postoperatively? What routes of administration can be used?

Headlines: Higher Death Rates in Kidney Patients with Newly Recognized Disease
Teaser: Nephrogenic systemic fibrosis is a debilitating and painful condition that affects patients with kidney failure. Risk factors for NSF is investigated in this study.

Headlines: First-Time Generic Approvals: Trileptal, Vicoprofen, Exelon
Teaser: The FDA has approved first-time generic formulations for oxcarbazepine tablets in 150-, 300-, and 600-mg strengths; hydrocodone bitartrate and ibuprofen tablets in a 2.5-mg/200-mg strength; and rivastigmine tartrate capsules in 1.5-, 3-, 4.5-, and 6-mg (base) strengths.

Headlines: International Approvals: Oral-lyn, Abraxane, DepoDur
Teaser: India has approved a regular insulin oral spray (Oral-lyn) and albumin-bound paclitaxel particles for injectable suspension (Abraxane); Australia has approved a sustained-release liposome formulation of morphine sulfate injection (DepoDur).

Headlines: Intervention Programme to Reduce Whole-Body Vibration Exposure at Work
Teaser: Whole body vibration (WBV) exposure at work might cause low back pain. An intervention program to reduce WBV exposure in a population of drivers with an emphasis on behavioral change is described.

Headlines: Epidemiology of Adolescent Spinal Pain: Systematic Overview of the Research
Teaser: Idiopathic adolescent spinal pain (IASP) has been suggested to be related to the incidence of adult spinal pain. What is currently known about IASP prevalence, incidence, impact, and potential causes?

Headlines: Antidepressant Agents for the Treatment of Chronic Pain and Depression
Teaser: Chronic pain and depression often go hand in hand; which antidepressants are most effective at treating both?

Headlines: Trial of a New Pain Assessment Tool in Patients With Low Education
Teaser: The measurement of pain needs simple tools, especially in patients with low education.  What is the most effective way to help assess these patients?

Headlines: Anticonvulsant Use for Prophylaxis of the Pediatric Migraine
Teaser: Migraines are common in pediatrics and many children require prophylactic therapy.

Headlines: Family-Centered Care Within an Infant-Toddler Unit
Teaser: A survey of parents and staff offered guidance for staff education and unit changes.

Headlines: Neuropathic Pain: Multiple Mechanisms at Multiple Sites
Teaser: Damage to nerves at various levels of the peripheral and CNS will lead to sensory loss, but in a significant number of patients this is accompanied by a series of distressing painful signs and symptoms.

Headlines: Patient-Controlled Transdermal Fentanyl vs IV Morphine
Teaser: Patient-controlled anesthesia with IV morphine is commonly used to treat postoperative pain. Recently, transdermal iontophoretic fentanyl was approved for the same use. Which is better?

Headlines: Acute Lower Back Pain: Keep Things Simple
Teaser: Most acute lower back pain episodes resolve spontaneously but many patients and healthcare providers seek additional interventions to help with recovery. How effective are NSAIDs and physical therapy?

Headlines: How Do We Select the Right Patient-Controlled Analgesia (PCA) Device?
Teaser: A comprehensive and interdisciplinary process for making PCA product choices may hold the key.

Headlines: Coping with Winter Injuries
Teaser: Winter carries its own risks for injury. Snow-shoveling, icy conditions leading to falls, and sports such as ice-skating, skiing, and snowboarding all can produce musculoskeletal and tendon injury.

Headlines: Deaths Related to Fentanyl Patch Misuse Spark Second Public Health Advisory
Teaser: FDA highlights important information to decrease the risk for fentanyl overdose.

Headlines: FDA Warns of Genetic Link to Carbamazepine Skin Reactions
Teaser: Patients of Asian ancestry should be screened for human leukocyte antigen allele before initiation of therapy.

Headlines: First-Time Generic Approvals: Combunox, Dilantin, Antizol
Teaser: The FDA has approved first-time generic formulations for oxycodone hydrochloride and ibuprofen tablets in 5 mg/400 mg strength, extended phenytoin sodium capsules in 30-mg strength, and fomepizole injectable in 1 g/mL strength.

Headlines: Continuous Epidural Analgesia Program for Postoperative Pain in Children
Teaser: Can these pediatric patients be cared for safely outside of the critical care setting?

Headlines: Stereotactic Radiosurgery for Functional Disorders
Teaser: Although stereotactic radiosurgery is the only noninvasive form of treatment for functional disorders, such as movement disorders or intractable pain, it also has some limitations.

Headlines: Comparisons of Clinical Examination, Transvaginal Sonography and MRI
Teaser: What's the capacity of digital vaginal examination, transvaginal sonography, and MRI to diagnose rectosigmoid and retrocervical involvement in patients with endometriosis?

Headlines: Identifying Patients at High Risk for Total Hip Replacement
Teaser: This study examined patients with hip pain to determine their disease  progression and how many subsequently underwent total hip replacement

Headlines: Meniscal Damage and the Development of Persistent Knee Pain
Teaser: Study indicates meniscal damage as a feature of knee osteoarthritis, independent of knee pain, aching, and stiffness

Headlines: Efficacy and Safety of Pregabalin in Treatment Treating Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: What's the best approach to ensure compliance when treating neuropathic pain?

Headlines: Analgesics Use And ESRD In Younger Age: A Case-control Study
Teaser: An ad hoc peer-review committee was jointly appointed by Drug Authorities and Industry in 1999/2000 to review the evidence for a causal relation between phenacetin-free analgesics and nephropathy.

Headlines: Edema in a Patient Receiving Methadone for Chronic Low Back Pain
Teaser: A week after starting a regimen of etodolac, gabapentin, and methadone, a 45-year-old woman with chronic low back pain said she felt "drunk" and had swelling in her lower extremities.

Headlines: Muscle Vibration May Retrain Abnormal SMO in Focal Hand Dystonia
Teaser: Muscle vibration applied to small hand muscles of patients with focal hand dystonia may help regain hand motor control, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Pain in Spanish Speaking Children With Cancer
Teaser: To minimize the risk of under-treatment of pain, children and parents may be taught to use the Spanish version of the Adolescent Pediatric Pain Tool.

Headlines: The Health Status Burden of People With Fibromyalgia
Teaser: How does the burden of pain in FM patients compare with that in patients with other chronic pain conditions?

Headlines: Bisphosphonate Therapy Linked to Risk for Severe Musculoskeletal Pain
Teaser: Pain requiring interruption or discontinuation of therapy may occur after months or years of therapy.

Headlines: Emerging Viral Infections and Arthritis
Teaser: The rheumatologist of this millennium will likely be called on increasingly to participate in the health care of afflicted travelers with new and emerging viral infections.

Headlines: Unusual Presentation of Meckel Diverticulum as Strangulated Femoral Hernia
Teaser: A 65-year-old woman presented with a nonradiating, constant pain in the right groin with associated nausea and anorexia.

Headlines: What Your Patients Are Reading
Teaser: Recent news stories have examined the link between moderate caffeine intake and risk for miscarriage, the prevention of urinary tract infections with cranberries, use of NSAIDs for low back pain, the link between fitness levels and all-cause mortality, and use of prednisone for rheumatoid arthritis.

Headlines: International Approvals: Januvia, Synvisc-One, Eloxatin
Teaser: Europe has approved 2 new indications for sitagliptin tablets (Januvia) and a new formulation of hylan G-F 20 (Synvisc-One); Canada has approved oxaliplatin intravenous infusion (Eloxatin).

Headlines: Can Fentanyl Patches Be Replaced Sooner to Improve Pain Control?
Teaser: The approved dosing interval for transdermal fentanyl is 72 hours, but some pain specialists are shortening that period to provide adequate pain relief.

Headlines: The Use of Ultrasonography in the Diagnosis of Ectopic Pregnancy
Teaser: Yasser Madani a final-year medical student from Barts and The London, Queen Mary's School of Medicine and Dentistry, University of London, discusses the use of ultrasonography for ectopic pregnancies.

Headlines: Patient-Controlled Analgesia Safe, Effective in Postcraniotomy Pain
Teaser: Intravenous, patient-controlled analgesia after a craniotomy has been shown to be both safe and effective compared with conventional as-needed therapy.

Headlines: FDA Takes Action to Stop Marketing of Unapproved Colchicine Injection
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration has received 50 reports of adverse events with colchicine injection, including 23 deaths, related to product use.

Headlines: What Your Patients Are Reading
Teaser: Men who live well may live longer; the risk for schizophrenia may be increased for children whose mothers endured extreme stress during pregnancy; nicotine withdrawal may cause smokers to lose sleep; heparin may be in short supply; and although the cost of treating neck and back pain has risen, no increase in relief has been seen.

Headlines: Spinal Cord Stimulation Givess Long-Term Relief in FBSS
Teaser: Randomized trial results show that spinal cord stimulation improves pain relief, health-related quality of life, and functionality in predominantly neuropathic pain patients with failed-back-surgery syndrome.

Headlines: Fentanyl Gel Patches Recalled Due to Manufacturing Defect
Teaser: A cut edge in the drug reservoir may lead to direct exposure to fentanyl gel (Duragesic) resulting in potentially fatal adverse events.

Headlines: Fentanyl Buccal Tablets Safe, Well Tolerated in Cancer Patients
Teaser: A drug at the center of a recent FDA health warning is found to be safe and well tolerated for treatment of breakthrough pain in opioid-tolerant cancer patients, a new study shows.

Headlines: Neuropathic Pain and Smoking
Teaser: A new study finds that the incidence of smoking is twice as high in those diagnosed with neuropathic pain as in those diagnosed with nociceptive pain.

Headlines: NINR: January 2008
Teaser: Summaries from NINR focus on suicide in young people, nurses working in LTC, discussing end of life with critically ill patients, and pain management in patients with cancer.

Headlines: Duloxetine Reduces Pain Severity in Fibromyalgia Patients
Teaser: Randomized trial results suggest that duloxetine hydrochloride treats fibromyalgia safely and effectively.

Headlines: Marijuana-Based Drug May Ease Fibromyalgia Pain
Teaser: In a placebo-controlled 1-month trial, the marijuana-based synthetic drug nabilone showed promise for temporary pain relief for fibromyalgia patients.

Headlines: Modest Exercise Helps Chronic Pain Patients
Teaser: Exercise improves mood and physical condition of chronic pain patients while also reducing their anxiety and depression.

Headlines: What Is the Maximum Safe Dose of Opioids?
Teaser: Clinicians must consider a number of patient characteristics when dosing opioid pain medications.

Headlines: Nurses Journal Scan, January 2008
Teaser: Summary topics include school-based health centers, reducing pain in IM injections, NPs and oral cancer detection, and macular degeneration.

Headlines: Goodley Intentions: Resurrecting Traction
Teaser: As I stated in a previous issue, pain must be seen as a liar. In every case, its location must never be casually accepted as the site of its origin.

Headlines: Back Pain, a Communicable Disease?
Teaser: Can back pain be considered a communicable disease?

Source: Journal of Perinatology : Official Journal of the California Perinatal Association
Headlines: Procedural Pain Guidelines for the Newborn in the United Kingdom
Teaser: A study assesses the use of analgesia guidelines for newborn infants in the United Kingdom.

Headlines: Two-Year Outcome After Lumbar Microdiscectomy vs Microscopic Sequestrectomy
Teaser: How does microdiscectomy compare to microscopic sequestrectomy two years later in terms of reherniation rates, clinical investigation, and self-rated parameters in lumbar disc herniation patients?

Headlines: Fold-Over Defect Causes Another Recall of Fentanyl Pain Patches
Teaser: This time from Actavis, which has initiated a recall of 14 lots; direct exposure to fentanyl gel may lead to potentially fatal adverse events.

Headlines: Chronic Pain May Harm the Brain
Teaser: A new study indicates chronic pain has a widespread impact on overall brain function, a finding that may offer a possible explanation for many of the common cognitive and behavioral comorbidities seen in such patients.

Headlines: Understanding the Fibromyalgia Syndrome
Teaser: The fibromyalgia syndrome is presented, along with current drug therapies and the pain pathways of these patients.

Headlines: Medication Errors Involving Patient-controlled Analgesia
Teaser: What factors are most commonly associated with these types of errors?

Headlines: US Midwives' Knowledge and Use of Sterile Water Injections for Labor Pain
Teaser: Sterile water injections effectively relieve low back pain during labor, but it is unclear whether U.S. midwives are aware of or use this therapy. What is their knowledge and use of these injections?

Headlines: Recall of Medtronic's Intrathecal Infusion Pumps
Teaser: Guidelines issued by the FDA advise that use of the lowest effective dose and concentration of opioids may reduce the risk for granuloma formation.

Headlines: Long-Term Data Confirm Benefit of Vertebroplasty for Back Pain Relief
Teaser: One of the largest and longest case series to date suggests percutaneous vertebroplasty provides significant relief of back pain, increased mobility, and quality of life, without any signal of increased fracture rates or major complications.

Headlines: Effects of Epidural Anesthesia on Labor Progress
Teaser: Learn more about the reasons, effects, and risks associated with epidural analgesia for pain relief.

Headlines: Temperament and Pain Response: A Review of the Literature
Teaser: The relationship between individual temperament and pain response (and pain perception) are discussed.

Headlines: Acupuncture for Pain Management
Teaser: Review this alternative procedure and learn why it appears to have a sound physiologic basis.

Headlines: Chinese Culture and the Cancer Pain Experience
Teaser: What are the fundamental beliefs that influence the pain experience for Chinese cancer patients?

Headlines: Cannabis Smoking Associated With Impaired Cognition in MS
Teaser: A case-control study suggests cannabis use is associated with impaired cognition and psychological disturbance in patients with multiple sclerosis.

Headlines: Postoperative Pain in Children
Teaser: What is the preferred method of treating pediatric pain following minor surgery, such as an appendectomy?

Headlines: Repeat Vertebroplasty for Unrelieved Pain at Previously Treated Vertebrae
Teaser: Percutaneous vertebroplasty (PV) relieves pain for many patients with osteoporotic vertebral compression fractures, but some have no improvement. Could repeat PV at the same vertebrae alleviate pain?

Headlines: Cutpoints for Mild, Moderate and Severe Pain in Osteoarthritis Patients
Teaser: In joint replacement candidates with hip or knee osteoarthritis, what are the optimal cutpoints for mild, moderate, and severe pain? Are specific pain severity categories related to poorer outcomes?

Headlines: Beliefs About Causes and Consequences of Pain in Chronic Low Back Pain
Teaser: Are pain beliefs held by chronic low back pain patients mainly related to diagnosis or other aspects of pain? Do demographics, pain intensity, disability and psychological distress affect pain beliefs

Headlines: Minimum Detectable and Clinically Relevant Change for Nonspecific Neck Pain
Teaser: Minimal detectable and clinically important changes for pain severity have been evaluated for nonspecific low back pain but not for neck pain. Do these values differ depending on referred pain status?

Headlines: Management of Pain in Chronic Pancreatitis
Teaser: The management of pain in chronic pancreatitis ranges from oral enzyme supplementation to neurosurgery; the approach depends on the pathophysiology of the pain.

Headlines: Managing Pain at the End-of-Life
Teaser: My Magnet Story Essay Series: Nurses can learn from patients by listening to their wishes.

Headlines: Pain Management for Pediatric Patients Undergoing Nonurgent Procedures
Teaser: Inadequate pain relief can lead to even stronger pain responses in subsequent procedures, yet many clinicians still fail to use available analgesics of psychological coping methods.

Headlines: Non-Narcotic Options for Pain Relief with Chronic Neuropathic Conditions
Teaser: Learn about the types, mechanisms, diagnosis, and treatment of neuropathic pain.

Headlines: 4-Item Assessment Provides Good Bedside Diagnosis of Delirium
Teaser: A new delirium assessment tool may help hospital healthcare providers more easily identify delirium in their patients.

Headlines: New Guidelines From AAN on Botulinum Neurotoxin Issued
Teaser: Three new guidelines from the American Academy of Neurology review the use of botulinum neurotoxin in spasticity, movement disorders, and autonomic disorders and pain.

Headlines: FDA Panel Nixes 'Abuse-Proof' OxyContin
Teaser: Experts say special coating may not stop abuse of pain relief drug.

Headlines: Low Back Pain Guidelines Expanded to Include Interventional Procedures
Teaser: The American Pain Society presented draft revised guidelines on the management of chronic low back pain to include interventional procedures, underlining the lack of evidence for many of these commonly used approaches.

Headlines: NINR: March 2008
Teaser: Research highlights include topics such as high blood pressure, gender differences in the perception of MI symptoms, pain, palliative care, and premature birth.

Headlines: Can Opiates Be Administered by Nebulizer?
Teaser: Some clinicians are using nebulized morphine to treat pain and breathlessness in patients with COPD and CHF, but is there evidence to back that up?

Headlines: Peripheral Opioid Antagonist for Opioid-Induced Constipation
Teaser: Chronic opioid use commonly causes constipation. Could the peripheral opioid antagonist methylnaltrexone alleviate opioid-induced constipation in terminally ill patients?

Headlines: Percutaneous Lumbar Zygapophysial Joint Neurotomy Using Radiofrequency
Teaser: In chronic low back pain patients whose pain is relieved by diagnostic blocks, radiofrequency medial branch neurotomy may be considered. How do outcomes from this procedure compare to sham surgery?

Headlines: Are Low Vitamin D Levels Associated with Nonspecific Pain?
Teaser: Could vitamin D deficiency be a common cause of otherwise unexplained musculoskeletal pain? Researchers investigate this association in two new studies.

Source: Topics in Advanced Practice Nursing eJournal
Headlines: Pain in the Cognitively Impaired Elderly
Teaser: What do you do when your patients can't tell you they are in pain?  Can you rely on self-report of pain in patients with dementia? Learn how to ask about pain, behaviors to watch for, and other tips.

Headlines: Effects of Local Anesthetics on Pain with Intravenous Catheter Insertion
Teaser: Do nurses routinely offer lidocaine (or other anesthetics) before inserting an IV?

Headlines: Exploring the Genetic Susceptibility of Chronic Widespread Pain
Teaser: Chronic widespread pain is a prevalent disorder associated with a low pain threshold and increased levels of psychological distress. Evidence indicates that there is a genetic component to CWP syndromes and pain sensitivity. The authors review the current literature.

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Associations Between Vitamin D Status and Pain in Older Adults
Teaser: Is it worthwhile to query older adults about their pain and screen older women with significant back pain for vitamin D deficiency?

Headlines: Obesity and the Prevalence of Low Back Pain in Young Adults
Teaser: Does abdominal obesity increase the risk of low back pain in women?

Headlines: Nurses Journal Scan, March 2008
Teaser: Highlights include APN prescribing, the management of pain, identifying mild cognitive impairment, insomnia, and the differences of NPs and PAs providing diabetes care.

Headlines: Sedatives, Opioids, and NMBAs in Acute Lung Injury and ARDS
Teaser: Which are most dangerous in this setting--sedatives, opioids, or NMBAs?

Headlines: Perioperative Celebrex  for Pain Management After Total Knee Arthroplasty
Teaser: Knee arthroplasty pain management is vital for achieving desirable results. Does celebrex administered before surgery improve clinical outcomes?

Source: Medicine and Science in Sports and Exercise
Headlines: A Randomized Controlled Trial to Relieve and Prevent Neck/Shoulder Pain
Teaser: Find out which workplace interventions help to reduce pain, increase strength, and foster compliance among office workers.

Headlines: Sciatica and Low Back Pain After Lumbar Macrodiscectomy in HIV Carriers
Teaser: Does HIV status affect pain outcomes for lumbar macrodiscectomy? This prospective longitudinal clinical study answers this burning question.

Headlines: Chronic Nonmalignant Pain Managemen and Nonsteroidal Antiinflammatory Drugs
Teaser: These guidelines can help you select the appropriate NSAID for managing the chronic pain of osteoarthritis, low back pain, fibromyalgia, and other conditions.

Headlines: Common and Distinct Neural Systems Supporting The Perception Of Pain
Teaser: A number of studies have found that perceiving others in pain and experiencing pain oneself recruit overlapping neural systems.

Headlines: Kangaroo Care (Skin Contact) Reduces Crying Response to Pain in Neonates
Teaser: Did kangaroo care reduce crying, in response to heel stick, in medically stable preterm infants?

Headlines: NINR: May 2008
Teaser: The National Institute of Nursing Research summarizes research on educational programs and pain management and teens and metabolic syndrome.

Headlines: Analgesic Effect of Pain Medications
Teaser: Dr. Sergey Motov explores the ceiling effects of analgesics commonly used in the ED: acetaminophen, ibuprofen, and opioids.

Headlines: State Opioid Prescribing Policy: Florida
Teaser: A summary of opioid prescribing policies for the state of Florida.

Headlines: State Opioid Prescribing Policy: Texas
Teaser: A summary of opioid prescribing policies for the state of Texas.

Headlines: State Opioid Prescribing Policy: Illinois
Teaser: A summary of opioid prescribing policies for the state of Illinois.

Headlines: State Opioid Prescribing Policy: Ohio
Teaser: A summary of opioid prescribing policies for the state of Ohio.

Headlines: Sterile Water Is Better Than Acupuncture in Relieving the Pain of Labor
Teaser: Dr. George Lundberg talks about the benefits of sterile water injections for pain relief during labor.

Headlines: The Changing Paradigm of Pain Policy: Effects on Clinical Care
Teaser: Physicians are in conflict about aggressively treating their patients in pain while following federal and state opioid prescribing policies.

Headlines: Cannabis Cigarettes May Reduce Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: Results of a double-blind crossover trial suggest that smoked cannabis relieved neuropathic pain and may be an alternative for those who cannot take other analgesics.

Headlines: Aging and Delirium: Too Much or Too Little Pain Medication?
Teaser: What is the association of pain and delirium in medical and surgical patients; specifically patients with hip fractures?

Headlines: Does Your Facility Have a Pediatric Sedation Team?
Teaser: Children's hospitals across the country should consider the formation of pediatric sedation teams; this article explains why.

Headlines: Neonates in Intensive Care Endure Many Painful Procedures Without Analgesia
Teaser: During 2-week period, neonates in intensive care underwent a median of 10 painful procedures per day, 79% without analgesia, in a study from Paris.

Headlines: FDA Advisory Members Agree AEDs Pose Suicidality Risk, Nix Black Box
Teaser: Antiepileptic drugs pose an increased risk of suicidality, but the data do not warrant a black-box warning, advisory committee members told the FDA.

Headlines: Use of Hydromorphone in Children and Adolescents
Teaser: Although hydromorphone is not used as frequently in young children as morphine, it is a valuable alternative for patient controlled analgesia in older children and adolescents.

Headlines: Nonsteroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drugs for Low Back Pain
Teaser: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs have been widely used for treatment of low back pain, but what does the scientific evidence tell us? This review provides specific details about effectiveness.

Headlines: Nonpharmaceutical Fentanyl-Related Deaths--Multiple States, 04/2005-03/2007
Teaser: Increases in overdoses were reported among illicit drug users in 6 states in 2006. Nonpharmaceutical fentanyl (NPF) was the source of some overdoses. How many NPF-related deaths occurred from 2005-07?

Headlines: Unmet Symptom Management Needs of Nursing Home Residents With Cancer
Teaser: This article provides an overview of previous symptom research for residents with cancer and explores clinical and organizational factors that impede effective symptom management.

Headlines: Sensory Deficit In Parkinson's Disease
Teaser: This study demonstrates for the first time a peripheral deafferentation in Parkinson's disease that could account (at least in part) for the impairment in sensory function.

Headlines: What Are the Long-Term Effects After Major Trauma?
Teaser: Commentary on 2 studies of the long-term effects on pain and general health after major trauma, published March 2008 in the Archives of Surgery and April 2008 in The Journal of Trauma.

Headlines: Optimizing Pain Control With Fentanyl Patches
Teaser: This column answers common questions about the appropriate use of fentanyl transdermal patches.

Headlines: Reader Reply to "Sterile Water Is Better Than Acupuncture for Labor Pain"
Teaser: A reader further discusses the use of sterile water as an alternative to acupuncture to relieve labor pain.

Headlines: Pain Management Pharmacy Service in a Community Hospital
Teaser: Pain management affects patient satisfaction, quality of life and health care costs. What are the results of adding a full-time pain management pharmacist and a pain physician at a community hospital?

Headlines: Chronic Widespread Pain in Patients With Occupational Spinal Disorders
Teaser: Occupational spinal disorders are often associated with pain and may include psychiatric components. Study authors evaluate how these factors affect rehabilitation and return to work outcomes.

Headlines: Patient Assessment of a Novel Therapeutic Approach for the Treatment of Sev
Teaser: Will this combination improve the constipation problem in pain management?

Headlines: New Guideline on Diagnosis and Treatment of Trigeminal Neuralgia
Teaser: The American Academy of Neurology has published a new practice parameter on treatment of trigeminal neuralgia. The guideline recommends carbamazepine as first-line treatment but suggests surgery be considered for refractory cases.

Headlines: Laws and Regulations Governing Pain Relief With Opioids
Teaser: Healthcare practitioners are concerned about prescribing opioids for pain management. This concern has led to a public health problem of uncontrolled pain.

Headlines: Low Vitamin D Levels Linked to Chronic Pain in Women
Teaser: A new study is questioning the possible influence of endocrine or immunological factors in the etiology of chronic pain.

Headlines: Smoking Cannabis May Reduce Neuropathic Pain in HIV
Teaser: A small study suggests that smoking marijuana while taking analgesic medications may help reduce pain.

Headlines: New Approaches to the Pharmacotherapy of Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: What hope is there for neuropathic pain syndrome sufferers, when evidence-based treatment results in only a 40% reduction of symptoms in approximately half of patients?

Headlines: Recognition of Inflammatory Back Pain and Ankylosing Spondylitis
Teaser: The diagnosis of ankylosing spondylitis is often delayed in primary care. This may partly be due to inability to differentiate inflammatory back pain (IBP) from mechanical. This study assesses the current practice of general practitioners in using clinical, radiological, and laboratory investigations to assess patients with IBP.

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Validity of Pain Behaviors in Persons With Cognitive Impairment
Teaser: This study evaluated the utility of facial grimacing in assessing pain in patients with mild to moderate cognitive impairment.

Headlines: Psychological Interventions for Needle-Related Procedural Pain in Children
Teaser: Examine a variety of cognitive-behavioral psychological interventions for managing procedural pain and distress in children and adolescents between 2 and 19 years of age.

Headlines: Administration of PRN Range Opioid Analgesic Orders for Acute Pain
Teaser: "As needed" range opioid orders have recently come under scrutiny. Learn the nursing perspective from this survey.

Headlines: Walking the Tightrope: Chronic Pain and Substance Abuse
Teaser: Making  decisions about when to prescribe opiates for chronic nonmalignant pain can be difficult. This article reviews 2 models that can assist you with your decision.

Headlines: Hypnosis as a Treatment of Chronic Widespread Pain in General Practice
Teaser: Chronic widespread pain treatments include physiotherapy, analgesics, exercise and antidepressants. Could standardized hypnosis therapy effectively treat chronic widespread pain in general practice?

Headlines: Methadone Dosages Correlate Poorly with Serum Levels
Teaser: A new study shows a poor correlation between dosages of methadone given to chronic pain patients and resulting serum levels. The findings, researchers say, complicate any cause-and-effect conclusions in the rising number of deaths associated with methadone use.

Headlines: Organizations Offer Roads to Improve Pain Management Care in ED
Teaser: Al Rothstein of the Israeli Medical Association discusses future goals of improving pain management in the ED, the chief complaint of 70% of all US patient visits.

Headlines: What Makes an "Ideal" Healthcare Provider?
Teaser: A patient with rare, chronic diseases has collected stories from other patients to provide valuable insights for the healthcare professions.

Headlines: Prednisolone and Naproxen Both Work for Pain Relief in Acute Gout
Teaser: Dr. George Lundberg discusses prescribing prednisolone and naproxen for pain relief in acute gout.

Headlines: An Expert Interview With James A. Inciardi, PhD
Teaser: Diversion of opioids, defined as the transfer of prescription drugs from a lawful to an unlawful channel of distribution, is discussed.

Headlines: Chronic Knee Pain Management: Survey of Patient Preferences and Treatment
Teaser: Chronic knee pain can be managed with medication, physiotherapy, or surgery, but what would patients prefer for treatment? What are patients' treatment preferences and rationale for these preferences?

Headlines: Effect of Therapeutic Exercise for Hip Osteoarthritis Pain
Teaser: Exercise useful in treating hip osteoarthritis

Headlines: Phase 3 Results Show Efficacy for Opioid Combined With Abuse Deterrent
Teaser: A phase 3 trial of ALO-01, an investigational formulation that combines extended-release morphine sulfate pellets with a core of naltrexone to deter abuse, showed that the drug was effective and safe for relief of chronic osteoarthritic pain.

Headlines: Surgery for Intervertebral Disk Herniation Cost-Effective
Teaser: Standard open diskectomy is moderately cost-effective compared to nonsurgical treatment, a new study shows.

Headlines: State Policies in Pain Medicine and Legal Standards for Patient Care
Teaser: State policies on pain vary from state to state; therefore, the outcome of legal action could vary between states.

Headlines: Conservative Treatment and Surgery for Sciatica From Lumbar Disk Herniation
Teaser: Dr. George Lundberg discusses how conservative treatments and surgery for sciatica from lumbar disk herniation are unsatisfactory.

Headlines: Pediatric Pain Assessment
Teaser: This review examines the research and characteristics of some of the commonly used pain tools

Headlines: Efficacy and Tolerability of Almotriptan in Adolescents
Teaser: This trial assesses the efficacy and safety of almotriptan 6.25 mg, 12.5 mg, and 25 mg vs placebo for acute migraine treatment in adolescents.

Headlines: Pain in Women With Relapsing-remitting Multiple Sclerosis
Teaser: Learn why women with relapsing remitting multiple sclerosis could benefit from a comprehensive pain assessment and management strategy.

Headlines: Bioequivalence Study of Three Ibuprofen Formulations After Single Dose
Teaser: Read this clinical update to find out if three ibuprofen formulations have equivalent systemic exposure.

Headlines: Blind Technique Fails in Lumbar Epidural Steroid Injection
Teaser: Researchers report the loss-of-resistance technique along with an image intensifier and lopamidol injection should be the gold standard for patients with radiculopathy.

Headlines: Reform of Opioid Policy
Teaser: State pain policies are outdated in a number of areas, influencing clinical decision-making and threatening to impede patient care.

Headlines: Pain Relief in Moderate to Severe Osteoarthritis
Teaser: A phase 2 trial of tanezumab showed improvements in pain, but adverse effects include paresthesia.

Headlines: Systematic Review of Dexketoprofen in Acute and Chronic Pain
Teaser: While licensed in several countries, Dexketoprofen has not yet been subject to a systemic review. How did it perform in pain management?

Headlines: Postoperative Ketamine Can Reduce Morphine Consumption and Nausea
Teaser: Dr. George Lundberg talks about using ketamine after major surgery.

Headlines: Does Warm Humidified Insufflation Affect Pain After Laparoscopy?
Teaser: Commentary on a study on the effect of warm humidified CO2 insufflation on pain after laparoscopic surgery, published August 2008 in the British Journal of Surgery.

Headlines: Patients in Minimally Conscious State May Feel Pain, Need Analgesia
Teaser: Functional PET imaging results suggest that patients in minimally conscious states may feel pain and therefore require analgesics.

Headlines: IV Propacetamol on Blood Pressure in Febrile Critically Ill Patients
Teaser: What is the prevalence of blood pressure lowering by propacetamol administered intravenously in ICU patients with fever? What is the clinical significance of this effect of intravenous propacetamol?

Headlines: Sedation and Pain Management in Acute Neurological Disease
Teaser: The optimum provision of pharmacological sedation of the critically ill neurological patient requires defining the underlying etiology.

Headlines: Endotherapy for Pain in Chronic Pancreatitis
Teaser: Pain is the most distressing symptom of chronic pancreatitis. Although the pathogenesis of pain is still poorly understood, an increase in intraductal pressure may be the dominant factor.

Headlines: Understanding Pain and QOL for Patients With Chronic Venous Ulcers
Teaser: How does pain related to chronic venous ulcers impact quality of life?  This cross-sectional study was performed on 40 outpatients with chronic venous ulcers and explores QOL and pain relationships.

Headlines: Evaluation of GW406381 for Treatment of Osteoarthritis of the Knee
Teaser: Studies of a new cox-2 inhibitor report mixed results for patients with pain related to osteoarthritis.

Headlines: A Case Study in the Postoperative Care of the Child With Bladder Exstrophy
Teaser: Review the role of the nurse practitioner in effective pain management for children. This pediatric case offers an excellent example.

Headlines: MRI Shows Relationship Between Depression and Pain Processing
Teaser: Functional magnetic resonance imaging shows a difference in both the processing and anticipation of pain in patients with major depressive disorder compared with nondepressed subjects.

Headlines: Five Generic Ethex Products Recalled Because of Overdose Risk
Teaser: Oversize tablets may contain up to double the amounts of the active ingredient.

Headlines: Long-Term Study Shows Neurostimulation Relieves Leg Pain
Teaser: New 24-month results suggest that spinal-cord stimulation provides sustained leg pain relief, improved quality of life, and functional capacity in patients with failed-back-surgery syndrome.

Headlines: FDA Approves Tapentadol for Moderate to Severe Acute Pain
Teaser: The FDA has approved tapentadol, an immediate-release oral tablet, for the treatment of moderate to severe acute pain.

Headlines: Regional Differences in Lumbar Spinal Posture and the Influence of LBP
Teaser: Spinal posture is a common focus in the assessment and clinical management of low back pain patients. Are there regional differences within the lumbar spine during common postures and movements?

Headlines: Transvaginal 'Tenderness-Guided' Ultrasound to Detect Deep Endometriosis
Teaser: Could transvaginal 'tenderness-guided' ultrasonography identify different locations of deep endometriosis? What is the diagnostic accuracy of this modality in detecting deep endometriotic implants?

Headlines: The Art of Procedural Sedation and Analgesia
Teaser: Children who undergo painful procedures need to have adequate sedation and analgesia. Constant vigilance and collaboration are required, particularly for a child who may need repeated procedures.

Headlines: Effectiveness of Acupuncture for Low Back Pain: A Systematic Review
Teaser: Is acupuncture an effective treatment for chronic low back pain (LBP)? This study explores the evidence in a systematic review of randomized controlled trials.

Headlines: An Expert Interview With Doug Zatzick, MD
Teaser: Doug Zatzick, MD, gives an overview of PTSD, from the epidemiology to the clinical challenges of identifying and treating patients.

Headlines: Pregabalin in the Treatment of Pain
Teaser: This article finds that combining pregabalin with other agents that are effective in diabetic peripheral neuropathy is a clinically safe option and should result in improved pain control.

Headlines: Negative Beliefs About Low Back Pain in Community-based Women
Teaser: This study highlights that although women living in the community were generally positive about back pain, those with high pain intensity and high level disability had more pessimistic views.

Headlines: NINR: July 2008
Teaser: Topics for this month include family caregivers; the nursing shortage; "Kangaroo Care" in the NICU; and aging, sleep, and functional decline.

Headlines: "You Just Have to Make the Pain go Away" -- Children's Experiences of Pain
Teaser: Learn why the complexity of pain as a physiologic, psychologic, social, and cultural phenomenon must not be overlooked in children.

Headlines: Vertebral Body Reconstruction: Review/Update on Vertebroplasty, Kyphoplasty
Teaser: What is the clinical utility of vertebral body reconstruction? What's the clinical experience with vertebroplasty and kyphoplasty? How should radiologists manage patients with vertebrogenic back pain?

Headlines: Prevalence of Undertreatment in Cancer Pain. A Review of Literature
Teaser: Cancer pain management is a major health care problem, but just how widepsread and severe is it? Pain Management Indexes are used to evaluate congruence between pain level and prescribed analgesics.

Headlines: Opioid Requirements and Analgesic Response  After Total Knee Arthroplasty
Teaser: After total knee arthroplasty, did patients tolerant to opioids require more opioids than did opioid-naive patients?

Headlines: Older Adult Pain Communication and the Brief Pain Inventory Short Form
Teaser: What can this research teach us about better pain management in older patients?

Source: Evidence-based Complementary and Alternative Medicine: eCAM
Headlines: A Review of CAM for Procedural Pain in Infancy
Teaser: Is there empirical evidence for complementary and alternative medicine approaches for the management of pain in infants up to 6 weeks of age?

Headlines: Update on the Pathobiology of Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: We need to develop novel and more effective drugs to treat neuropathic pain. Proteomic research should provide a great deal of information to enhance this research.

Headlines: New Guidelines on Evaluation of Distal Symmetric Polyneuropathy
Teaser: New practice parameters aim to give evidence-based guidance on the role of laboratory and genetic testing, autonomic testing, and nerve and skin biopsy in the evaluation of distal symmetric polyneuropathy.

Headlines: FDA Requires Warnings About Suicidality Risk With Antiepileptic Drugs
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration will require the manufacturers of antiepileptic drugs to add a warning to their labeling that use of the drugs increases risk for suicidal thoughts and behaviors.

Headlines: Spinal Surgery Superior to Exercise, Medical Therapy at 4 Years
Teaser: A new analysis from SPORT at 4-year follow-up shows that spine surgery provides more rapid and greater relief of symptoms and improvement in function than nonsurgical options for lumbar disk herniation.

Headlines: The Association Between Diabetes Mellitus, Glucose, and Chronic MSCs
Teaser: This study investigated the association between diabetes mellitus, non-fasting glucose, and chronic musculoskeletal complaints defined as pain and stiffness in the general adult population.

Headlines: Evaluation of State Pain Policy
Teaser: The Pain and Policies Study Group currently evaluates each state's pain policy on the basis of the principle of balance.

Headlines: Overuse of the ED for Pain Medications
Teaser: Hospital-specific guidelines influence pain medication use in the ED.

Headlines: Opioid Use and Medicaid
Teaser: Medicaid has systems in place to detect fraud or abuse of medications by people who should not have them.

Headlines: Monthly Summaries of Nursing Research: October 2008
Teaser: Recent nursing research focused on medication adherence in heart failure, pain in children, advanced planning in people with dementia, and postoperative complications and the role of nurses.

Headlines: Monthly Summaries of Nursing Research: November, 2008
Teaser: Don't miss research summaries on medication adherence, women and diabetes, pain assessment in the cognitively impaired, sleep disturbance in AIDS, and COPD and depression.

Headlines: Overuse of Opioids
Teaser: How do you manage a patient who has obvious opioid overuse and dependency yet he or she does not want to stop taking opioids?

Headlines: Neurology & Neurosurgery Journal Scan, December 2008
Teaser: December 2008 Neurology Journal Scan reviews studies of statin use to prevent cardiovascular events, rituximab to treat neuromyelitis optica, young-onset dementia, and virtual-reality analgesia.

Headlines: Lowering Serum Urate in Patients With Hyperuricemia and Gout
Teaser: How does febuxostat's mechanism of action differ from allopurinol's? Is febuxostat superior to allopurinol for reducing uric acid levels and preventing gouty flares?

Headlines: How Do Couples Cope When One Partner Has a Chronic Illness?
Teaser: Illness can be an unwanted third party in a relationship, introducing personal stresses on top of medical challenges.

Headlines: Are Patients in the Emergency Department Adequately Treated for Pain?
Teaser: Inadequate analgesia is a common problem. How often do patients with pain in the emergency department desire and receive analgesics?

Headlines: Living With Chronic Illness, Not Suffering From It
Teaser: A popular blog authored by women with chronic diseases empowers patients to live life to the fullest.

Headlines: Commentary on NSAIDs and Manipulation Ineffective for Acute Low Back Pain
Teaser: Carlo DiMarco, DO, President, American Osteopathic Association, comments on a Best Evidence Review of spinal manipulation and low back pain.

Headlines: FDA Approves Tramadol Extended-Release Formulation for Chronic Pain
Teaser: Labopharm, Inc announced the FDA has approved a once-daily extended release formulation of tramadol (Ryzolt) for the management of moderate to moderately severe chronic pain.

Headlines: Safety Guidelines Issued for Prescribing Methadone
Teaser: Safety recommendations regarding arrhythmia risk and QTc interval monitoring for clinicians prescribing methadone have been issued.

Headlines: Migraines, Tension-Type Headaches Respond to Acupuncture
Teaser: Acupuncture is at least as effective as prophylactic drugs for migraine and may also benefit some patients with frequent tension-type headache, 2 large reviews conclude.

Headlines: FDA MedWatch Issues Alert on Safety of Topical Anesthetics
Teaser: The FDA today released a public-health advisory to underline the potential risks associated with overuse of topical anesthetics. In particular, women undergoing mammography or others using the agents over large areas of the body may be at risk.

Headlines: FDA Approves Milnacipran for Fibromyalgia
Teaser: Forest Laboratories and Cypress Bioscience announced that the FDA has approved milnacipran, a dual serotonin- and norepinephrine-reuptake inhibitor, for the management of fibromyalgia.

Headlines: Antidepressants May Ease Fibromyalgia Symptoms
Teaser: Evidence from a meta-analysis of 18 trials of antidepressants in the treatment of fibromyalgia syndrome shows that these drugs can improve FMS-associated symptoms of pain, sleep disturbance, depressed mood, and health-related quality of life. However, effect sizes vary significantly between classes of antidepressants.

Headlines: Does Responsible Care Include Helping a Patient to Die?
Teaser: Should doctors be allowed to help terminally ill patients die? This question is provoking heated debate in the Medscape Physician Connect discussion boards.

Headlines: Antioxidants Reduce Pain, Oxidative Stress in Chronic Pancreatitis
Teaser: In a randomized controlled trial, antioxidant supplementation was effective in relieving pain and reducing levels of oxidative stress in patients with chronic pancreatitis.

Headlines: Laws to Protect Physicians Who Refuse to Treat Pain
Teaser: With emphasis on customer satisfaction in healthcare, providers may worry about not issuing or honoring a controlled substance prescription when they question the patient's need for the drugs.

Headlines: Federal Laws on Prescribing Controlled Substances
Teaser: Federal law prohibits prescribers from pre-signing prescriptions. Here's what the nurse practitioner needs to know.

Headlines: Does Calcitonin Help Relieve Neuropathic Pain?
