Headlines: Glucosamine for Back Pain?
Teaser: A recent study examines the efficacy of using glucosamine in the treatment of chronic low back pain.

Headlines: Trial Shows Safety, Efficacy of 7-Day Buprenorphine Patch in Opioid-Naive Patients
Teaser: A double-blind, 12-week, phase 3 study demonstrated the analgesic efficacy and safety of buprenorphine for the relief of moderate to severe chronic lower back pain in opioid-naive patients.

Headlines: Pregabalin Not Effective in Chronic Prostatitis/Chronic Pelvic Pain Syndrome
Teaser: Pregabalin shows no benefit in the primary outcome of pain reduction, as measured by a 6-point decline in score, in chronic prostatitis/chronic pelvic pain syndrome.

Headlines: Ultrasound-Guided Corticosteroid Injections Relieve Chronic Lateral Hip Pain
Teaser: A peritendinous ultrasound-guided corticosteroid injection may be an effective treatment for gluteus medius tendinopathy.

Headlines: FDA Panel Recommends Naltrexone Extended-Release Injectable Suspension for Opioid Addiction
Teaser: An FDA committee supports the use of naltrexone for extended-release injectable suspension for the treatment of opioid dependence.

Headlines: Long-Term Opioid Use Linked to Increased ED Visits, Drug and Alcohol Problems
Teaser: Long-term use of opioids with a high potential for dependence and abuse may increase the risk for emergency department visits and drug and alcohol problems.

Headlines: FDA Approves Sublingual Film Formulation of Buprenorphine/Naloxone
Teaser: Previously only available in sublingual tablet form, buprenorphine/naloxone in the form of a sublingual film will become available in starting in October 2010.

Headlines: Oral Sucrose May Not Provide Effective Analgesia in Neonates
Teaser: A randomized trial suggests that the ability of sucrose to reduce clinical observational scores after noxious events in newborns may not reflect pain relief, but editorialists say it may be premature to draw that conclusion.

Teaser: A palliative care program for seriously ill patients presents hospitals with a business opportunity and a chance to stand apart.

Headlines: Opioids Help Stabilize Depression, Anxiety in Patients With Chronic Low Back Pain
Teaser: Patients receiving opioid therapy for lower back pain or osteoarthritis had stable or slightly improved depression, anxiety, and positive outlook symptoms during 6 months to 1 year of observation.

Headlines: Lidoderm Patch Helps Reduce Oral Opioid Treatment in Knee Replacement Patients
Teaser: A transdermal lidocaine 5% patch appears to result in a decrease in overall pain after unilateral knee replacement, which is important for a successful recovery.

Headlines: Is There a Genetic Contribution to Cultural Differences?
Teaser: Genes and culture are often thought of as opposite ends of the spectrum, but genetic variation may influence many psychocultural differences.

Headlines: Intervention to Improve School Functioning in Adolescents With Chronic Pain
Teaser: Can a cognitive behavioral intervention improve school attendance and functioning in adolescents with chronic pain and depressive symptoms?

Headlines: A Treatment Applying a Biomechanical Device to the Feet
Teaser: A novel biomechanical device may offer a new avenue of treatment for patients with knee osteoarthritis.

Headlines: Pathology of Chikungunya Virus Infection: Emergence and Clinical Insights
Teaser: What is the Chikungunya virus, how does it present, and how is it treated?

Headlines: Revisiting the Role of Ergots in the Treatment of Migraine and Headache
Teaser: Ergots for the treatment of migraine have fallen out of favor with the advent of triptans, but they still may have a place.

Headlines: Combined Prolonged-Release Oxycodone and Naloxone for Management of Pain
Teaser: This combination may decrease opioid-induced constipation without compromising pain control.

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Opioid Use in the Treatment of Chronic Noncancer Pain in Older Adults
Teaser: Chronic pain is a highly prevalent, costly, and often disabling disorder in later life. Can opioids provide safe relief?

Headlines: Low Back Pain and Work Absenteeism Among Soldiers on Active Service
Teaser: Which factors hasten a return to active duty among soldiers who suffer from low-back pain?

Headlines: Intranasal Use of Drugs in the Emergency Room and Pre-Hospital Arenas
Teaser: This brief, but  important review assesses the current state of IN drug administration, with an emphasis on analgesia, in the pre-hospital and emergency settings.

Headlines: How Effective Is Continued Education in Pain Management?
Teaser: Dr. Charles Argoff discusses a new study evaluating the effectiveness and durability of continuing education in pain management.

Headlines: Fibromyalgia: New Diagnostic Criteria
Teaser: Dr. Charles Argoff explores the evolving understanding and classification of fibromyalgia and the resulting clinical implications.

Headlines: Efficacy and Tolerability of Levetiracetam in Trigeminal Neuralgia
Teaser: Might the antiepileptic drug levetiracetam provide safe and effective relief for the excruciating pain of trigeminal neuralgia?

Headlines: Treating Pain and Improving Function in Patients With Arthritis
Teaser: Dr. Kevin Deane explores optimal strategies for treating pain and improving functionality in patients with arthritis.

Headlines: Pharmacist's Activities on a Trauma Team in the Emergency Department
Teaser: Pharmacists can provide special medication requirements for trauma patients.

Headlines: Adnexal Torsion: a Predictive Score for Pre-operative Diagnosis
Teaser: Read this study to learn about the most effective way to diagnose adnexal torsion, and the best approach to treatment.

Headlines: Pain After Surgery for Intramedullary Spinal Cord Cavernous Malformations
Teaser: Does surgery for intramedullary spinal cord cavernous malformations effectively eliminate or significantly reduce pain?

Headlines: Opiate Replacement Treatment Reduces Mortality in Addicted Patients
Teaser: New research from Britain finds that opiate replacement treatment for at least a year by drug misusers can lead to a decrease in overall mortality of more than 85%.

Headlines: Agents for Reducing the Shivering Response to Therapeutic Hypothermia
Teaser: Which medications can modify thermoregulation?

Headlines: The Role of Back Injury or Trauma in Lumbar Disc Degeneration

Headlines: Optimal Pain Management In Older Patients
Teaser: Dr. Charles Argoff discusses treatment guidelines and optimal management strategies for pain conditions in the elderly.

Headlines: Predictors of Stable Return-to-Work in Non-Acute, Non-Specific Spinal Pain

Teaser: Conditions that cause chronic pelvic pain -- such as irritable bowel syndrome and overactive bladder -- often occur together, and now new research may have uncovered more information on why.

Headlines: Nursing Care, Delirium, and Pain Management for Older Adults
Teaser: Is delirium prevention possible for the elderly? Practical tools for helping hospitalized older patients stay pain free and oriented are discussed.

Source: Health and Quality of Life Outcomes
Headlines: Neck Strength Training and Quality of Life in Chronic Neck Pain
Teaser: Can neck and upper body strength training improve the quality of life for women with chronic neck pain?

Headlines: Fentanyl Transdermal System Lots Recalled
Teaser: Eighteen lots of fentanyl transdermal 25 mcg/hour patches are subject to voluntary recall because of the accelerated release of fentanyl in 1 patch.

Headlines: Long-Term Use of Corticosteroid Injections for Tendinopathy May Be Harmful
Teaser: A meta-analysis of randomized trials suggests that corticosteroid injections only help tendinopathy in the short term and that they may cause harm if used longer.

Headlines: Tylenol Recalled Again Due to Musty Odor
Teaser: A musty odor spurs another recall of the J&J/McNeil Product.

Headlines: Once-Monthly Naltrexone Approved for Treatment of Opioid Addiction
Teaser: Naltrexone for extended-release injectable suspension (Vivitrol), already approved for alcohol dependence, now approved for opioid addiction.

Headlines: Anger Linked to Pain in Women With and Without Fibromyalgia
Teaser: A study indicates that anger amplifies clinical pain in women with and without fibromyalgia, and another study shows that cognitive therapy is effective in the treatment of fibromyalgia.

Headlines: Serum Alanine Aminotransferase Elevation With 10 Days of Acetaminophen
Teaser: The maximum daily amount of acetaminophen can increase serum ALT appreciably.

Headlines: Buprenorphine Implants May Be Effective for Opioid Dependence, Phase 3 Study Suggests
Teaser: A large randomized controlled trial suggests a subdermal implant may be effective in treating opioid dependence.

Headlines: Sublingual Buprenorphine Relieves Symptoms of Neonatal Opioid Abstinence Syndrome
Teaser: A new phase 1 study suggests that sublingual buprenorphine is safe and more effective than oral morphine in treating infants with neonatal opioid syndrome.

Headlines: Pain of Herpes Zoster Significantly Affects Health-Related Quality of Life
Teaser: A prospective study supports the need for preventive strategies and other early interventions to reduce the burden of herpes zoster and postherpetic neuralgia.

Headlines: Study Reviews Faces Scales for Reporting Pain in Kids
Teaser: A new study systematically reviews faces scales for the self-report of pain intensity in children.

Headlines: Negative Social Encounters May Reduce Sensitivity to Physical Pain
Teaser: Mildly negative social encounters, of the kind that are often experienced in everyday living, are able to decrease sensitivity to physical pain.

Headlines: Rilonacept Prophylactic Against Gout Flares
Teaser: Rilonacept prevents gout flares during urate-lowering therapy but it is ineffective for relieving pain during flares, new research has found.

Headlines: Opioid Use Increases Seniors' Risk for Falls
Teaser: Seniors are more likely to experience falls during the first few weeks of opioid use than later on, and short-acting drugs appear to carry a greater initial risk than longer-acting ones.

Headlines: Subpleural Infusion of Local Anesthetic Controls Pain After Lung Surgery
Teaser: A continuous infusion of local anesthetic just over the intercostal nerve substantially reduces pain and gets patients back to normal faster after thoracic surgery, according to a presentation yesterday afternoon in Vancouver at CHEST 2010, the annual international scientific assembly of the American College of Chest Physicians.

Headlines: Nurse-Practitioner-Led Spinal Clinic May Be Effective, Feasible
Teaser: A pilot study showed that a nurse-practitioner-led spinal clinic produced 100% concurrence with surgeon diagnoses, 95% concurrence with management plans, and shorter waiting times.

Headlines: Propoxyphene Withdrawn From US Market
Teaser: The move will include all propoxyphene-containing products, both brand-name and generic.

Headlines: FDA Approves First Intravenous Formulation of Acetaminophen
Teaser: The FDA has approved the first and only intravenous formulation of acetaminophen for the management of pain, the management of pain with adjunctive opioid analgesics, and the reduction of fever.

Headlines: Pharmacotherapy for Fibromyalgia, Pain, and Depression
Teaser: Two recent presentations covered pharmacotherapy of fibromyalgia and the often overlapping conditions of pain and depression.

Headlines: Ibuprofen/Famotidine Reduces Gastric Ulcer Incidence
Teaser: HZT-501, an ibuprofen-famotidine combination, is associated with a reduction in upper gastrointestinal ulcer incidence and in increased compliance relative to ibuprofen alone.

Headlines: FDA Approves Duloxetine for Chronic Musculoskeletal Pain
Teaser: The FDA has approved duloxetine for the once-daily treatment of chronic low back pain and osteoarthritis.

Headlines: Pain at the End of Life Is Common and Strongly Linked to Arthritis
Teaser: Pain is present in more than one quarter of elderly persons during the last 2 years of life; arthritis is strongly associated with pain at the end of life.

Headlines: Diagnostic Testing and Treatment of Low Back Pain in EDs
Teaser: Low-back pain is a frequent complaint of patients seen in the emergency department, accounting for 2.7 million visits annually. How do ED doctors diagnose and treat these patients?

Headlines: Is Vicodin the Right Choice for This Patient?
Teaser: With combination medications, clinicians need to consider both of the active agents.

Headlines: The Best Fibromyalgia Therapies
Teaser: Clinicians may not agree on what fibromyalgia actually is, but one thing's for sure -- it's treatable. Dr. Charles Argoff reviews the efficacy of approved and investigational fibromyalgia therapies.

Headlines: Treatment of Acute Migraine in the Emergency Department
Teaser: In this Medscape Neurology Minute, Dr. Alan Jacobs reports results of a trial comparing IV prochlorperazine and SQ sumatriptan for acute migraine in emergency department patients.

Headlines: How to Not Miss Fibromyalgia
Teaser: Dr. Charles Argoff discusses evolving diagnostic criteria for fibromyalgia: it's not all about tender points.

Headlines: Minimizing Needle Pain in Kids: A New Device May Help
Teaser: A case of a boy who fears needles with a review of methods to help reduce pain, including a video of a new device.

Headlines: Pain Management at the End of Life
Teaser: The landscape of pain near the end of life can change rapidly. Review these evidence-based principles to manage this challenging clinical issue.

Headlines: Pregabalin Safety and Efficacy in Older Patients With Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: Pregabalin has been shown to be safe and effective for management of chronic neuropathic pain younger patients, but what about in those over 65 years of age?

Headlines: Vertebroplasty: New Trial, Conflicting Results
Teaser: Does vertebroplasty relieve pain if performed soon after vertebral fractures occur?

Headlines: 'Doctor, Are You Telling Me the Truth?' Exclusive Ethics Survey Results
Teaser: How much to tell very ill patients; quandaries about pain treatment, and decisions over giving "placebo" treatments are ethical issues that physicians wrestle with.

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: Intimate Partner Violence, Health, PTSD, and Quality of Life in Latinas
Teaser: Pain and sleep disorders may be associated with intimate partner violence in women.

Headlines: Treatment of Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: A summary of the many and varied therapies available for treatment of disabling neuropathic pain.

Headlines: Spinal Cord Compression From Foreign Body Reaction to Stimulation
Teaser: Spinal cord stimulation (SCS) to treat chronic, refractory pain is a common procedure. Although life-threatening complications with SCS are very rare, the authors describe other adverse occurrences.

Headlines: Methadone Exposure Tied to Poor Perinatal Outcome
Teaser: Women on methadone are at risk for a variety of perinatal problems, Irish researchers report. Moreover, neonatal abstinence syndrome was related to methadone intake in their study.

Headlines: Can Ketorolac Be Administered Intermittently?
Teaser: Some wonder if this injectable NSAID can be used for chronic, painful conditions.

Headlines: Adult Cancer Pain: Part 2 -- The Latest Guidelines for Pain Management
Teaser: Changes to the NCCN adult cancer pain guidelines are designed to help oncology clinicians manage pain more effectively.

Headlines: Top 10 Most Read Articles by Public Health Professionals
Teaser: What articles did public health & prevention professionals find most interesting on Medscape in 2010?

Headlines: Medscape Rheumatology's Top 10 for 2010
Teaser: What did rheumatologists read on Medscape this year? We've rounded up the most popular issues and articles among neurologist readers in 2010.

Headlines: New Arthritis Therapies: Beyond Anti-inflammatory Meds
Teaser: Dr. Charles Argoff discusses new and emerging musculoskeletal pain therapies resulting from a more profound etiologic understanding of conditions such as osteoarthritis and lower back pain.

Headlines: Opioids Linked to More Adverse Events in Older Adults With Arthritis
Teaser: The comparative safety of nonselective NSAIDs, coxibs, and opioids varies depending on the safety event studied, with opioids showing increased mortality.

Headlines: Buprenorphine for Addiction in Pregnancy Reduces Symptoms of Neonatal Abstinence Syndrome
Teaser: Infants of opioid-dependent women who take buprenorphine during pregnancy have fewer symptoms of neonatal abstinence syndrome.

Headlines: Intrathecal Ziconotide May Increase Risk for Suicide
Teaser: A recent suicide has raised the suspicion that ziconotide can pose a psychiatric threat to patients.

Headlines: Surgery Riskier for Redheads? Evidence Slim
Teaser: People with red hair may feel more pain, but there's little evidence of excessive bleeding.

Headlines: Smoking May Worsen Pain for Cancer Patients
Teaser: Patients with cancer who continue to smoke despite their diagnosis experience greater pain severity than those who quit or who have never smoked.

Headlines: Sucrose Analgesia for Infants: State of the Science
Teaser: Two important studies highlight what we know -- and don't know -- about the use of sweet solutions for procedural analgesia in infants.

Headlines: What Did Nurses Read on Medscape in 2010?
Teaser: Don't miss our top 10 most-read articles by nurses this year. Is your personal favorite on the list?

Headlines: Codeine Linked to Increased CVD Events, Mortality
Teaser: A large observational study links codeine and oxycodone to an increased risk for cardiovascular events and all-cause mortality after only 30 days among older adults treated for noncancer pain.

Headlines: Treatment of Ovarian Hyperstimulation Syndrome
Teaser: A severe case of ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome can be particularly dangerous. How is it best treated?

Headlines: Pain Among Older Residents of Nursing Homes
Teaser: How much pain are elderly nursing home residents enduring, and what's being done about it?

Headlines: Lumbar and Cervical Pain Management Procedures
Teaser: A review of minimally invasive techniques for treatment of degenerative back and neck pain, with a focus on epidural injections, nerve blocks and facet injections.

Headlines: Etoricoxib vs Celecoxib as Preemptive Analgesia for Postoperative Pain
Teaser: Two novel selective COX-2 inhibitors were compared for efficacy in treating post-operative pain in ACL surgery.

Headlines: Adult Cancer Pain: Part 1 -- The Latest Guidelines for Assessment
Teaser: Changes to the NCCN adult cancer pain guidelines are designed to help oncology clinicians assess pain more effectively.

Headlines: FDA Approves Fentanyl Transmucosal Tablets for Cancer Pain
Teaser: The FDA has approved an immediate-release transmucosal tablet formulation of fentanyl for the management of breakthrough cancer pain in patients who receive around-the-clock opioid therapy.

Headlines: What Is Causing Suprapubic Pain in a Prepubescent Girl?
Teaser: A 9-year-old girl presents with suprapubic abdominal pain and no fever.

Headlines: Is Fibromyalgia Real?
Teaser: Is fibromyalgia a distinct condition or a symptom complex with multiple possible etiologies? Drs. Jonathan Kay and Charles Argoff debate this controversial issue.

Headlines: Muscle Atrophy and Changes in Spinal Morphology
Teaser: It has been suggested that bed-rest, as short as overnight, can result in an increased risk of low back injury on rising.

Headlines: Cancer Patients With Pain: Partner Relationship
Teaser: Does the perceived quality of a spouse/partner relationship affect reports of cancer pain?

Headlines: Prevalence of Pain During the Last 24 Months of Life
Teaser: This study documents the high prevalence of pain in the last 2 years of life, particularly within the last month. Is pain in the dying being under-treated?

Headlines: Are Opioids Safe?
Teaser: In light of the rise in unintentional poisoning deaths due to opioid analgesics, Dr. Charles Argoff discusses the appropriate selection and use of pain therapies.

Source: Topics in Advanced Practice Nursing eJournal
Headlines: Acute Pain: Assessment and Treatment
Teaser: If you are looking for a comprehensive, A to Z review of assessment and management of acute pain, this is it.

Headlines: New Treatments for Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: New research on transient receptor potential channel and cannabinoid receptor agonists brings hope for promising neuropathic pain treatments.

Headlines: All Nonsteroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drugs Have Cardiovascular Risks
Teaser: A new study has put the well-known pain relievers back in the headlines, with data showing all NSAIDs increase the risk for cardiovascular events.

Headlines: Parents' Assessment of Earache Pain in Children May Be Unreliable
Teaser: Socioeconomic status might affect the interpretation of symptoms in preverbal children, so investigators question the utility of an overall pain score from a 1-item parent scale.

Headlines: FDA Limits Acetaminophen in Prescription Analgesics
Teaser: The agency decision, which does not affect over-the-counter pain relievers, seeks to reduce the number of acetaminophen overdoses that result in severe liver injury.

Headlines: Do Psychiatrists Need Pain Training?
Teaser: A Perspectives article published in the January issue of Archives of General Psychiatry argues that pain education should be included in the core curriculum of psychiatric residency training.

Headlines: Chronic Pain Common in Cancer Survivors Needs to Be Addressed
Teaser: Cancer-related chronic pain is prevalent among survivors, and the pain experience is worse in female and black survivors.

Headlines: ACP Issues Guidelines for Diagnostic Imaging for Low Back Pain
Teaser: The American College of Physicians found strong evidence that routine imaging for low back pain with radiography or advanced imaging methods does not improve patient health.

Headlines: Clinical Efficacy of Telcagepant in Migraine
Teaser: The calcitonin gene-related peptide antagonist telcagepant may be a breakthrough in migraine therapy because of its novel approach--but is it as effective as more traditional drugs?

Headlines: What Is Fibromyalgia?
Teaser: In response to a recent Medscape debate on the etiology of fibromyalgia, readers weigh in with their thoughts on what causes this controversial condition.

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: Ultrasound-Guided Three-In-One Nerve Block for Femur Fractures
Teaser: Ultrasound-guided three-in-one femoral nerve block is an efficient pain management option for elderly patients with hip fractures.

Headlines: Percutaneous Vertebroplasty for Osteoporotic Vertebral Compression Fractures in the Nonagenarians
Teaser: Is vertebroplasty safe and effective in the very elderly suffering from spinal fractures?

Headlines: Opioid-Induced Bowel Dysfunction in Advanced Cancer
Teaser: Failure to identify risk and begin prophylaxis for opioid induced bowel dysfunction can result in serious consequences for your patients with advanced cancer.

Headlines: Physicians Say Good Riddance to 'Worst Drug in History'
Teaser: The opioid first approved by the US Food and Drug Administration in 1957 has been pulled from the market and many are happy to see it go.

Headlines: Hydrocodone Bitartrate/Acetaminophen and Phenobarbital Tablets Recalled
Teaser: Mislabeled bottles may result in patients unintentionally taking one product instead of the other, with potentially serious harm.

Headlines: Deep-Brain Stimulation May Relieve Refractory Hypertension
Teaser: In a case report, researchers found a patient's treatment-resistant hypertension responded to a deep-brain stimulation device implanted for chronic pain.

Headlines: Leg Pain as Predictor of Spinal Surgery Outcome
Teaser: This study lends quantitative evidence to the idea that patients with degenerative spondylolisthesis and spinal stenosis improve more with surgical intervention than those with primarily back pain.

Headlines: Warming Anesthetics Reduces Pain of Injections
Teaser: Warming injections to body temperature eases the pain of getting a shot, a study finds.

Headlines: Dr. Neal Slatkin Named One of America's Top Doctors for Cancer Pain
Teaser: Cancer pain specialist and palliative care physician Neal Slatkin, MD, has been voted one of America's top doctors in pain medicine by his fellow physicians.

Headlines: Using Botulinum Toxin for Headache and Pain
Teaser: Dr. Charles Argoff discusses the emerging uses of botulinum toxin in managing headache and other pain conditions.

Headlines: Sagittal Spinal Balance After Lumbar Spinal Fusion
Teaser: The effect of anterior support on radiographic measurements of sagittal balance is examined in this study of patients with severe, chronic low-back pain.

Headlines: Improving Patient Choice in Treating Low Back Pain
Teaser: How can patients become better informed about low-back pain therapies?

Headlines: Which Medications to Avoid in People at Risk of Delirium
Teaser: Many drugs have been associated with the development of delirium, but which are most problematic? This systematic review can help identify which to avoid in those at risk.

Headlines: CBT and Exercise Therapy Safe, Effective for Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
Teaser: Cognitive behavioral therapy and graded exercise are safe and moderately effective in patients with chronic fatigue syndrome, a large randomized trial suggests.

Headlines: Managing Relentless Pain in Cancer Survivors
Teaser: For many cancer survivors, treatment-related pain prevents a return to a normal life. A cancer pain expert discusses the options available to manage pain syndromes.

Headlines: Postoperative Pain Control: More Opioids?
Teaser: Is more or less opioid indicated for this woman who is having significant postoperative pain?

Headlines: A Proven Approach to Reduce Post-Cesarean Pain
Teaser: This commentary reports on a "must-read" study comparing wound instillation methods for post-cesarean analgesia.

Headlines: Should Psychiatrists Manage Pain?
Teaser: Given that mental illness is often comorbid with chronic pain conditions, should psychiatrists participate and receive training in pain management? Dr. Charles Argoff weighs in.

Headlines: Surgery and Low Back Pain -- Is the Choice Clear?
Teaser: Charles P. Vega, MD, reviews a recent study suggesting that intensive back rehabilitation works just as well as surgery for back pain but issues remain.

Headlines: Local Infusion of Ropivacaine After Donor Nephrectomy
Teaser: A continuous infusion of local ropivacaine may reduce both pain and morbidity related to opiate analgesics in patients undergoing live donor nephrectomy.

Headlines: Arthritis, Foot Pain and Shoe Wear
Teaser: This article looks at the importance of proper footwear for patients with different forms of arthritis.

Headlines: Propoxyphene Withdrawn: What Could Be Next?
Teaser: Dr. Charles Argoff discusses the implications of propoxyphene's recent removal from the US market on pain management.

Headlines: Weather and Arthritis Pain: A Real Connection?
Teaser: The pain in rain is mainly in the brain.

Headlines: Cannabinoids for the Treatment of Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: Neuropathic pain can be unremitting and challenging to treat. Might cannabinoids be the answer?

Headlines: A 12-Item Symptom Rating Scale for Cervical Spine Dysfunction
Teaser: Neck pain is a common and sometimes disabling condition. The authors test the Symptom Intensity Rating Scale to indentify cervical spine dysfunction in these patients.

Headlines: Pain in Malignant Hematology
Teaser: Pain management in hematology requires a multidisciplinary approach, integrating analgesics and causal interventions.

Headlines: Virtual Pain Coach and Older Adults' Pain Communication
Teaser: Virtual pain coaching may be on the sidelines now, but it could be part of an all-star clinical team in the future.

Headlines: Selecting a Safe Opioid
Teaser: Dr. Charles Argoff discusses the metabolic and safety profiles of opioid therapies and offers advice on how to choose wisely.

Headlines: E-Prescribing for Controlled Substances: Will It Work?
Teaser: The elaborate process of e-prescribing controlled substances has uncertain appeal for practitioners.

Headlines: Opioids for Chronic Noncancer Pain in Children and Youth
Teaser: Kids with chronic noncancer pain deserve appropriate management, and this case-based activity describes how to use both pharmacologic and nonpharmacologic strategies.

Headlines: Zeroing in on 'Artery of Adamkiewicz' for Safer Injections
Teaser: Lumbar epidural steroid injections are relatively safe, but serious adverse neurologic outcomes have occurred. Some of these injuries are thought to have been the result of trauma to the AKA.

Headlines: Can Rheumatoid Arthritis Be Prevented?
Teaser: Dr. Kevin Deane explores the possibility of predicting and preventing rheumatoid arthritis. How close are we?

Headlines: What's New in Pain Management?
Teaser: What's new in pain management? Dr. Charles Argoff discusses highlights from the American Academy of Pain Medicine's annual meeting.

Headlines: What Can Go Wrong With the Spine
Teaser: Douglas Chang, MD, from UCSD talks about spine pain and provides a visual demonstration on how the spine works.

Headlines: Evidence to Link Fibromyalgia and Chronic Pain Disorders
Teaser: Emerging data from a wide array of clinical specialties shed light on pathophysiologic similarities in pain syndromes.

Headlines: Cluster Headache--Acute and Prophylactic Therapy
Teaser: A comprehensive overview of both pharmacologic and non-pharmacologic options for treatment and prophylaxis of disabling cluster headache.

Headlines: Can Neuroimaging Studies Identify Pain Endophenotypes?
Teaser: Could neuroimaging studies help define functional, structural or biochemical endophenotypes for pain that might help us understand the relationship between genetics and pain conditions?

Headlines: Weight Change With Long-Term Duloxetine Use in Chronic Pain
Teaser: Previous studies have shown that duloxetine may cause weight changes when used to treat depression. Is the effect the same when used long-term for chronic pain?

Headlines: Risk Indicators for Severe Upper or Mid Back Pain in Men
Teaser: MRI results, and environmental and job-related factors, are used to diagnose and treat back pain in male patients.

Headlines: Analgesic Prescribing Errors
Teaser: The "who, what, when, where, and why" of analgesic errors are explored in this hospital-based study.

Headlines: Treating Pain From Disc Herniation: Clonidine vs Corticosteroid
Teaser: For patients prone to adverse events from epidural corticosteroid, epidural clonidine may be an acceptable pain management alternative.

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: Chronic or Recurrent Pain in the Emergency Department
Teaser: Patients were polled about their experiences at the ED for chronic pain treatment.

Headlines: Pain Management in the Addicted Patient: A Problem in the ED
Teaser: Patients addicted to narcotics pose a problem to emergency department personnel.

Headlines: Morphine/Naltrexone Combo Temporarily Withdrawn
Teaser: King Pharmaceuticals notes that Embeda, a combination of morphine and naltrexone, has been voluntarily withdrawn because "a prespecified stability requirement was not met during routine testing."

Headlines: Ultrasound Survey May Help Athletes Prevent Tendon Damage
Teaser: Monitoring the Achilles and patellar tendons of elite athletes with ultrasonography might help predict and prevent damage progression.

Headlines: Ibuprofen Use Linked to Lower Parkinson's Risk
Teaser: A new analysis from the Nurses' Health Study and Health Professionals Follow-up Study show a lower risk with ibuprofen but not other analgesics.

Headlines: Nitric Oxide Ineffective Against Sickle Cell Pain Episodes
Teaser: Inhaled gas no better than placebo in resolving vaso-occlusive pain crisis in patients with sickle cell disease.

Headlines: Opioid Use in Pregnancy Linked to Birth Defects
Teaser: Opioid use just before conception or in early pregnancy is associated with a modest but nonetheless potentially serious risk for birth defects.

Headlines: Palliative Sedation Therapy
Teaser: Palliative sedation can relieve intolerable suffering.

Headlines: Sucrose Better Than Lidocaine for Venipuncture Pain in Newborns
Teaser: Sucrose was more effective than liposomal lidocaine for reducing pain during venipuncture in newborns; there was no evidence of harm from either treatment.

Headlines: Effective Peri-operative Dose Pregabalin as Analgesic Adjunct
Teaser: The correct dosage of pregabalin given pre-surgery has the potential to reduce pain and opioid use post-surgery.

Headlines: Marijuana or Synthetic Cannabinoids for Headache
Teaser: Novel compounds with cannabinoid-like mechanisms of action may hold promise for patients with headaches that are refractory to currently available treatment options.

Headlines: Percutaneous Spinal Surgery Gets High Marks at 1 Year
Teaser: A minimally invasive spine surgery technique has shown sustained improvements in pain and mobility at 1 year postoperatively, with no serious adverse events.

Headlines: Ziconotide May Be Effective Against Central Pain in MS
Teaser: Results from a case series study of 7 patients suggest that treatment with ziconotide may be an effective and safe way to manage MS-related central pain.

Headlines: Quantifying Intervertebral Disc Mechanics
Teaser: A more precise, objective definition of the neutral zone -- the range over which a spinal motion segment moves with minimal resistance -- is sought by the authors of this study.

Headlines: Patients With Intractable Pain Report Relief Using HCG
Teaser: A small study of patients with intractable pain reported reductions in symptoms after a year of treatment with human chorionic gonadotropin.

Headlines: Cannabis Use May Harm Cognitive Function in MS Patients
Teaser: A cross-sectional study suggests long-term heavy use of street cannabis may impair cognitive function in patients with MS.

Headlines: Buprenorphine, Collaborative Care Key to Success in Treating Opioid Addiction
Teaser: Study provides more evidence that office-based treatment of opioid addiction with buprenorphine is feasible and often successful in the primary care setting.

Headlines: Pretonsillectomy Local Anesthetic May Not Lower Post-Op Pain
Teaser: Pretonsillectomy injection of local anesthetics is not recommended to reduce pain after a tonsillectomy.

Headlines: Naltrexone Effective for Opioid Addiction, but Concerns Linger
Teaser: A randomized controlled trial shows that once-monthly injectable extended-release naltrexone significantly increases abstinence and decreases cravings for those with opioid dependence.

Headlines: Military Drug Abuse Linked to Prescription of Pain Meds
Teaser: A history of pain medication prescriptions strongly predicts subsequent drug misuse, new research suggests.

Headlines: Feds Launch Plan to Fight Prescription Drug Epidemic
Teaser: A new collaborative action plan for prescription drug abuse urges prescriber education on opioid risks and benefits, recommends expanded monitoring programs, and calls for new laws.

Headlines: Trial of Gene Therapy for Pain Finds Dose-Related Response
Teaser: Transfer of vector that contains preproenkephalin gene to dorsal root ganglion produces dose-dependent pain relief in patients with intractable cancer pain.

Headlines: Paracetamol Use in Pregnancy Linked to Childhood Asthma
Teaser: A meta-analysis of studies shows a 21% increase in the risk for childhood asthma associated with use of paracetamol at any time during pregnancy.

Headlines: Higher Opioid Dose for Nonmalignant Pain Linked to Mortality
Teaser: In patients given opioids for nonmalignant pain, the daily dose is strongly associated with opioid-related mortality, particularly at doses over thresholds recommended in recent clinical guidelines.

Headlines: Better for Infants When Addicted Moms Use Buprenorphine in Pregnancy
Teaser: A new analysis suggests buprenorphine for the treatment of opioid dependence during pregnancy produces more favorable neonatal outcomes.

Headlines: Age Predicts Outcome With Naltrexone for Opioid Dependence
Teaser: A new secondary analysis suggests patients younger than 30 years do best with injectable naltrexone for opioid dependence, but comparisons to existing treatments are lacking.

Headlines: Gabapentin May Help Prevent Postherpetic Neuralgia
Teaser: A study suggests that adding gabapentin to antiviral therapy in patients with acute herpes zoster reduces the incidence of postherpetic neuralgia.

Headlines: Cancer Pain in Spain: One Third Is Neuropathic
Teaser: The news comes from a screening of more than 8500 cancer patients.

Headlines: Muscle Tendon Injections for Persistent Back Pain?
Teaser: Results of a retrospective review showed that muscle tendon injections can provide long-term relief from pain in patients with failed epidurals, facet blocks, and spinal surgery.

Headlines: Patient Attitude Predicts Outcome of Neck Surgery for Pain
Teaser: Patients who preoperatively expected no arm or neck pain after cervical discectomy reported less pain and more satisfaction with the results compared with patients who expected some residual pain.

Headlines: Novel Spinal Neuromodulation Device Eases Low Back Pain
Teaser: A new implantable spinal neuromodulation device delivers significant relief from low back pain without paresthesia.

Headlines: More to Poststernotomy Pain Than Intercostal Nerve Damage?
Teaser: Results from a study of poststernotomy patients showed that those who reported more sternal pain also reported more pain in the head, neck, back, and upper extremities.

Headlines: High-Dose Opioid Prescribing Directly Boosts Death Risk
Teaser: As overdose deaths in the United States continue to increase, a large national study shows that part of this increase may be directly related to high-dose prescribing.

Headlines: Topical Benzocaine Associated With Methemoglobinemia
Teaser: Benzocaine sprays, gels, and liquids may cause methemoglobinemia, a rare but serious and potentially fatal condition.

Headlines: Does Early Anesthesia for Combat Injuries Ease Pain Later?
Teaser: Ongoing study of combat-injured soldiers is expected to shed new light on the role of early regional anesthesia in reducing pain over time.

Headlines: Pain Relief Often Lacking in Inpatient Pediatric Procedures
Teaser: A Canadian study shows that less than one third of painful procedures for hospitalized children are associated with documented pain relief.

Headlines: Federal Crack Down on Prescription Drug Abuse Gets Thumbs Up
Teaser: National psychiatry and addiction organizations are coming together to applaud and promote the federal government's new plan to stop abuse of prescription drugs.

Headlines: FDA's Long-Awaited Opioid Plan Calls for Education
Teaser: The new regulations will have implications for the close to 700,000 prescribers of long-acting and extended-release opioids.

Headlines: Good Results Using Sympathetic Block for Phantom Pain
Teaser: Results from a case study of a patient with refractory phantom pain related to chronic preamputation pain showed that sympathetic block provided safe and effective relief.

Headlines: Efficacy, Safety of Topical Diclofenac Similar to Oral Form
Teaser: A pooled analysis of patients with arthritis showed that topical diclofenac produced comparable efficacy to the oral form and was associated with fewer adverse events.

Headlines: New AAN Guidelines on Painful Diabetic Neuropathy
Teaser: AAN has released new guidelines on best management of painful diabetic neuropathy.

Headlines: Prescription for Opioids Often Precedes Teen Addiction
Teaser: A single-center study shows teen addicts received a mean of 5 prescriptions for opiates during a 2-year period.

Headlines: High-Dose Ketorolac Affects Adult Spinal Fusion
Teaser: Too much ketorolac may result in disunion in patients post surgery for spinal fusion.

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Nonsurgical Treatment of Lumbar Disk Herniation
Teaser: Spinal surgery for disc herniation in the elderly is on the rise. Might older adults respond equally as well to non-surgical treatment options as younger adults do?

Headlines: Controlled-Substance Diversion in Hospitals
Teaser: How does your hospital prevent drug diversion?

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: Buprenorphine Treatment of Opioid-Dependent Pregnant Women
Teaser: Is buprenorphine a safe alternative to methadone as maintenance therapy for opioid-dependent women during pregnancy?

Headlines: Intravenous Acetaminophen Use in Infants and Children
Teaser: An injectable form of acetaminophen has recently been approved for use in children 2 years of age and older.  Learn about the appropriate use of this new product in this review.

Headlines: MAP0004, Orally Inhaled DHE for Acute Treatment of Migraine
Teaser: This RCT looks at the efficacy of MAP0004, an orally inhaled formulation of dihydroergotamine for the treatment of acute migraine. How did it fare against placebo?

Headlines: Work-life Conflict and Musculoskeletal Disorders
Teaser: Work-life conflict is a common stressor and possible contributor to musculoskeletal disorders.

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Opioids and Risk of Fractures in Older Adults With Arthritis
Teaser: This study compares fracture rates in arthritic adults taking NSAIDs with those using opioids. Does opioid use increase the risk of fractures?

Headlines: Recovery of Brachial Plexus Lesions Resulting From Heavy Backpack Use

Teaser: Dr. Andrew Wilner sits down with Jose G. Merino, MD, and Albert Gordon Smith, MD, from AAN.com to discuss some of the most interesting data to come out of AAN 2011.

Teaser: New research may facilitate drug development for neuropathic pain.

Headlines: After Propoxyphene: Alternate Pain Medications

Teaser: Three states have Death with Dignity Act legislation.

Headlines: New Tylenol Recall Due to Musty Odor

Headlines: The Bachelor's Belly Pain

Headlines: Institute of Medicine Issues Blueprint for Pain in America
Teaser: The institute is calling for coordinated national efforts to reduce risks while ensuring access to pain relief for those who need it.

Teaser: Nurses working in palliative care need to become familiar with common pain syndromes seen in survivors.

Teaser: Charles F. Von Gunten, MD, PhD, offers practical advice on dealing with a pain crisis. Learn how to deal with severe pain quickly.

Teaser: Lost, stolen, or forgotten... Are any of these good reasons to refill a hydrocodone prescription early?

Teaser: Are epidural steroid injections for radicular low back pain any more effective than placebo? The results of this study were disappointing.

Teaser: Chronic low back pain is a leading cause of lost work time and disability. What factors might influence the patient's return to work?

Teaser: Does buprenorphine have a cognitive advantage as compared with methadone?

Headlines: Disparities in Pain Treatment Dividing Europe

Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration has advised healthcare providers to visually inspect Hospira Carpuject prefilled cartridges to check for overfill.

Headlines: Once-Daily Gabapentin Effective in Postherpetic Pain
Teaser: A once-daily formulation of gabapentin G-GR will relieve postherpetic neuralgia within 4 days -- or will not work at all, researchers say.

Headlines: Providers Underestimate Patients' Pain During IUD Insertion
Teaser: ACOG 2012: A study of 200 women finds that clinicians misjudge the pain of undergoing intrauterine device (IUD) insertion.

Headlines: Massage and Swaddling Reduce Pain in Infants
Teaser: Massaging infants and swaddling them can both significantly reduce pain associated with  needle sticks, 2 separate studies show.

Headlines: Low Back Pain: STarT With the Stress
Teaser: This practice-changing study reports on the effectiveness of a screening tool that PCPs can use in patients with low back pain.

Headlines: Two New Resources to Curb Prescription Drug Abuse
Teaser: Prescription drug abuse, misuse, and overdose are running rampant. Two initiatives aim to help clinicians address the problem.

Headlines: Acetaminophen and Asthma: A Bad Marriage
Teaser: A new review clarifies recent reports linking acetaminophen and asthma symptoms. How should practice change in light of these data?

Headlines: Cancer Patients Fare Well on High-Dose Sublingual Fentanyl
Teaser: A study to assess the titration of sublingual fentanyl for breakthrough cancer pain showed patients satisfied on high doses.

Headlines: Telephone Advice Provides Long-Term Back Pain Relief
Teaser: APS 2012: Patients can get long-term back pain relief by getting instructions on the phone for managing their condition.

Headlines: Scientists Unlock Gene Secrets of Opium Poppy Drug
Teaser: Scientists have unraveled exactly how opium poppies produce a non-addictive compound that can both suppress coughs and kill tumor cells, paving the way for improved production of the medicine.

Headlines: What's in a Number?
Teaser: Caring for patients with pain can be difficult for clinicians, as they attempt to understand pain levels and decide on the best pain remedies for each individual case.

Headlines: Tolerability of Rizatriptan in Pediatric Migraineurs
Teaser: While migraine has been reported to occur frequently in children and adolescents, approved treatment options are limited. This study examines the safety of off-label use of rizatriptan in children.

Headlines: Sumatriptan-Naproxen and Butalbital
Teaser: Despite the lack of FDA approval, butalbital-containing medications are still widely used for acute migraine treatments in the United States. How does it compare to an approved migraine treatment?

Headlines: Six Years in the Making: New Episodic Migraine Guidelines
Teaser: What herb has level A evidence for migraine relief? What drug is commonly underdosed? Find out as Dr. Andrew Wilner interviews Dr. David Dodick about the AAN's new migraine clinical guidelines.

Headlines: Early Imaging of Low Back Pain Unnecessary, Harmful
Teaser: A literature review and cost analysis justifies recent initiatives to limit early imaging of acute back pain unless red flags are present.

Headlines: NSAIDs Curb Uteric Stent Removal Pain
Teaser: A single dose of a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) is effective in preventing pain after ureteric stent removal, Oregon-based researchers reported last month.

Headlines: Duloxetine Useful in Chemo Neuropathy, But Avoid ALC
Teaser: The antidepressant alleviated chemotherapy-induced neuropathy in what is described at a practice-changing trial, but patients with breast cancer should avoid acetyl-L-carnitine (ALC) supplements.

Headlines: Low Back Pain and Vertebral Bone Mineral Measures
Teaser: Is there a link between chronic low-back pain and vertebral BMD measures in middle-aged adults?

Headlines: Nonmedical Use of Prescription Pain Relievers Increasing
Teaser: The number of people who regularly use prescription pain relievers for nonmedical purposes has  significantly increased during the last several years in, especially among men.

Headlines: NSAIDs for Pain and Immobility-associated Osteoarthritis
Teaser: The authors present an evidence-based consensus statement and algorithm to provide specific guidance for treatment of osteoarthritis in primary care.

Headlines: Acute Abdominal Pain Presenting as Appendiceal Duplication
Teaser: Read about a very unusual case of a young girl with two appendices. Was her abdominal pain appendicitis?

Source: Cancer Control: Journal of the Moffitt Cancer Center
Headlines: Radionuclides for Patients With Painful Skeletal Metastases
Teaser: Pain from skeletal metastases represents a major burden of advanced disease from solid tumors. A variety of medications and external beam radiotherapy are all effective treatments.

Headlines: Intracranial Subdural Hemorrhage After Spinal Anesthesia
Teaser: This case highlights the need to pay attention to acute intracranial subdural hemorrhage as a complication after spinal anesthesia.

Headlines: Self-treatment of Pain Among Urban Adolescents
Teaser: What are kids using to keep pain at bay, and why is it more relevant than ever?

Headlines: Mental Illness in Teens Linked to Long-term Opioid Use
Teaser: Among adolescents and young adults with chronic pain, the presence of mental health disorders appears to increase the risk for long-term opioid use.

Headlines: College Kids May Abuse Painkillers to Ease Distress
Teaser: College students who use painkillers and other prescription drugs may be depressed and/or suicidal, new research shows.

Headlines: Pregabalin Approved for Neuropathic Pain in Spinal Injury
Teaser: This FDA approval for management of neuropathic pain associated with spinal cord injury brings to 5 the approved indications for pregabalin in the United States.

Headlines: No Increase in Miscarriage Risk With Nonprescription NSAIDs
Teaser: A prospective trial of more than 2700 pregnancies suggests that use of over-the-counter nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs during early pregnancy posed no increased risk for spontaneous abortion.

Headlines: FDA Approves Gabapentin Enacarbil for Postherpetic Neuralgia
Teaser: Already approved for restless legs syndrome, gabapentin enacarbil extended-release tablets are now approved to manage postherpetic neuralgia in adults.

Headlines: Chronic Abuse of Prescription Pain Meds Up Sharply
Teaser: A new study finds a 75% increase since 2002 in the number of Americans engaging in the long-term use of prescription pain medications for nonmedical reasons.

Headlines: A European Look at the New AAN Migraine Guidelines
Teaser: German neurologist Dr. Hans-Christoph Diener takes issue with (some of) the AAN's new episodic migraine recommendations.

Headlines: Identifying Overuse and Misuse: Interview With ACP CEO Steven Weinberger
Teaser: Medscape interviewed ACP CEO Steven E. Weinberger, MD, about participation in Choosing Wisely, a multisociety initiative to educate physicians and patients on recommendations against certain questionable practices.

Headlines: Say Guten Tag to 8 Important Rheumatoid Arthritis Studies
Teaser: Dr. Jon Kay interviews Dr. Ronald van Vollenhoven on important rheumatoid arthritis data presented at EULAR 2012.

Headlines: Teens, Pain, and Pill-Popping: The Disturbing Truth
Teaser: Findings from a survey of pain and pain medication use among high-schoolers are chilling and have important implications for healthcare professionals.

Headlines: Chronic Tumor-Related Pain
Teaser: Do nonopioid analgesics have a place in cancer pain management?

Headlines: Opiate Education: Key Points for the Pharmacist
Teaser: Who is at risk for opioid addiction?

Headlines: Cluster Headache With Ptosis Responds to Intranasal Lidocaine
Teaser: Can a topical administration of lidocaine applied nasally provide relief from cluster headache?

Headlines: The Role of State Anxiety in Children's Memories for Pain
Teaser: Children's memories for pain can effect their health throughout life. This lab-based study investigated the impact of experimentally manipulated state anxiety on children's memories for pain.

Headlines: Breaking the Cycle of Breakthrough Pain
Teaser: A woman with cancer is experiencing increasing episodes of breakthrough pain. What are the management options?

Headlines: Opioids for Shortness of Breath?
Teaser: Is it safe to use opioids when a seriously ill patient has dyspnea? What is the right dose? Gary T. Buckholz, MD, explains.

Headlines: Optimal Opioid Therapy and Redefining Cancer-Related Pain
Teaser: Dr. Charles Argoff discusses 2 important concerns to consider when managing chronic pain.

Headlines: How to Screen for Axial Spondyloarthritis in Primary Care?
Teaser: What referral strategies can be used for earlier diagnosis of axial spondyloarthritis?

Headlines: FDA Declines New Indication for Methylnaltrexone
Teaser: The FDA has issued a complete response letter for Relistor in the treatment of opioid-induced constipation in chronic, noncancer pain.

Headlines: Regional Pain Block Fails After Laparoscopic Hysterectomy
Teaser: A transversus abdominis plane (TAP) block did not reduce pain after laparoscopic hysterectomy in a study from MetroHealth Medical Center in Cleveland.

Headlines: Tighten Opioid Label Restrictions, Physicians Tell FDA
Teaser: The group's goal is to prevent drug companies from marketing opioids as safe and effective for long-term treatment of moderate, noncancer pain.

Headlines: Older Patients' Pain Care Lags in Emergency Departments
Teaser: Patients aged 75 years and older receive less pain medication in EDs than all other adults.

Headlines: Depressive Symptoms Raise Risk for Opioid Misuse
Teaser: Depressed patients on chronic opioid therapy may use opioids for non-pain symptoms and use more than prescribed, new research shows.

Headlines: Oxycodone Formula Change Blamed for Rise in Heroin Use
Teaser: A change in a formula of the prescription opioid oxycodone to prevent abuse has had the unintended consequence of doubling heroin use among addicts.

Headlines: Gene Therapy Fails in Cancer Pain Trial
Teaser: A novel gene therapy did not reduce cancer pain any more than the placebo in a phase 2 randomized controlled trial.

Headlines: FDA Approves REMS for Extended-Release, Long-Acting Opioids
Teaser: The FDA has approved a new Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy for extended-release and long-acting opioid analgesics; education is still voluntary for physicians, but that may change.

Headlines: PCA for Pain Relief After Vaginal Reconstructive Surgery
Teaser: Women having vaginal reconstructive surgery have less pain the day afterward if they receive patient-controlled analgesia (PCA).

Headlines: Anesthesia Systems Recalled Over Software Glitch
Teaser: The manufacturer began upgrading the unit's software in February to fix a problem with the switch for manual vs automatic ventilation.

Headlines: FDA Calls for Halt to Unapproved Drugs Containing Oxycodone
Teaser: Companies that continue to market these products will be subject to enforcement action, including seizure, injunction, or other judicial proceedings.

Headlines: Methadone Accounts for One Third of Pain Med Overdose Deaths
Teaser: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reports methadone now contributes to almost 1 in 3 prescription painkiller deaths.

Headlines: Between HIPAA and a Hard Place
Teaser: Dr. Kathy Miller reports on an ethical dilemma: Should she violate HIPAA or let a terminally ill nurse return to work where his weakened capacity endangers himself and the patients under his care?

Headlines: CYP2D6*4 Polymorphism and Tramadol in Patients With PHN
Teaser: Do patients with this polymorphism have increased adverse effects to tramadol?

Headlines: Opioids for Chronic Pain
Teaser: Opioids are effective in treating chronic, noncancer-related pain -- but do the benefits outweigh the risks?

Source: ISMP Medication Safety Alert!® Acute Care Edition
Headlines: Harm Associated With Drug Shortages
Teaser: Are your patients being severely affected by drug shortages? A survey finds that patient harm is not uncommon.

Headlines: Role of IV Acetaminophen in Acute Pain Management
Teaser: Intravenous acetaminophen has been available since 2001 outside the US. Why are we slow to adopt it?

Headlines: S. aureus Infections and Reuse of Single-Dose Vials
Teaser: What are some of the potentially serious health problems that can arise when single-dose vials of medications are used in more than one patient? This new report looks specifically at recent cases of staphylococcal infections.

Source: Cancer Control: Journal of the Moffitt Cancer Center
Headlines: The Management of Pain in Metastatic Bone Disease
Teaser: In metastatic bone disease a multidisciplinary approach to treatment is often necessary because simplified analgesic regimens may fail in the face of complex pain generators.

Headlines: Unexpected Benefits of tDCS in Depressed Patients
Teaser: The benefits of tDCS in depressed patients may extend beyond simply mood regulation, potentially facilitating cognitive enhancement and pain relief.

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Persistence of Musculoskeletal Pain in Older Adults
Teaser: Is musculoskeletal pain an inevitable consequence of aging?

Headlines: Does This Woman Have Adnexal Torsion?
Teaser: How is adnexal torsion diagnosed? This new study walks us through some of the diagnostic procedures.

Headlines: Depression and Opioid Misuse in Opioid Therapy Recipients
Teaser: Depression may be associated with an increased risk of opioid misuse -- even in patients with no substance abuse history.

Headlines: Low Back Pain in 17 Year Olds: Public Health Disorder
Teaser: How prevalent is low back pain in the adolescent population in the US? Is it a significant public health problem?

Headlines: Risk for Overdose From Methadone Used for Pain Relief
Teaser: Under what circumstances should methadone be prescribed, and what are the overdose risks in certain patients? This new study explains.

Headlines: 'My Parrot Ate My Pain Pills'
Teaser: Sometimes it's hard to distinguish between tall tales and legitimate complaints of uncontrolled pain. Here's how to tell the difference.

Headlines: Opioid Range Orders: Essential to Safe Pain Management
Teaser: What are opioid range orders, and how should they be used in best pain management practice?

Headlines: Pain and Other Symptoms Common in Patients With Diabetes
Teaser: Many patients with type 2 diabetes, especially those with the shortest survival, experience pain and other symptoms, including depression, fatigue, insomnia, and neuropathy.

Headlines: FDA Warns of Codeine Overdose Risk After Pediatric Surgery
Teaser: A small percentage of children convert appropriate doses of codeine into potentially lethal levels of morphine in their bloodstream.

Headlines: Two Physicians Charged in 9 Pain-Med Deaths
Teaser: Attorneys of 2 physicians charged in 9 pain-med deaths claim that federal prosecutors are piling on new charges to punish them for not pleading guilty to lesser ones.

Headlines: Carpuject Hydromorphone Prefilled Syringes Recalled
Teaser: The FDA is reporting a recall of one lot of Hospira hydromorphone injection for use with Carpuject cartridges.

Headlines: Fentanyl Shows Benefits During Painful Pediatric Procedures
Teaser: Adding fentanyl to propofol during painful procedures in children with cancer won't affect the child's pain afterward but can have other benefits, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Deficits Seen After Single Childhood Anesthesia Exposure
Teaser: Long-term deficits in language and reasoning were observed even after just one early childhood anesthesia exposure in a new study; however, debate surrounds the role of potential confounders.

Headlines: FDA Approves Higher Dose of Hydromorphone
Teaser: The FDA has approved a 32-mg tablet strength of hydromorphone HCI extended-release tablets (Exalgo, Mallinckrodt) for moderate to severe chronic pain.

Headlines: Risk for Substance Abuse in Patients With Cancer Pain
Teaser: Longer life expectancy, the result of more successful treatment, means that risk for addiction is back on the table as a concern for cancer patients.

Headlines: Reumofan Recalled Because of Undeclared Ingredients
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration has reported that the manufacturer of Reumofan Plus Tablets is voluntarily recalling the product because of findings of undeclared drug ingredients.

Headlines: Crude Tools Show Low Abuse Risk for Prescription Cannabinoids
Teaser: Abuse screening tools adapted from validated tools used to screen for opioid abuse suggest low abuse potential for oral prescription cannabinoids.

Headlines: FDA Approves Tapentadol ER for Diabetic Neuropathy
Teaser: Extended-release opioid drug is first to receive FDA approval for the management of neuropathic pain associated with diabetic peripheral neuropathy.

Headlines: Vulvodynia Ups Chances of Other Chronic Pain Conditions
Teaser: Women with vulvodynia are 2 to 3 times more likely than their peers to be affected by other chronic pain conditions, such as interstitial cystitis, irritable bowel syndrome, or fibromyalgia.

Headlines: Pain Diagrams in Rheumatic Disease: Are They Helpful?
Teaser: Are patient-completed pain charts helpful in triaging referrals for rheumatic disease?

Headlines: 'Perils Outweigh Promise' in Chronic Opioid Experience?
Teaser: As the leader in worldwide opioid use, the United States is "an experiment for worldwide consumption," one expert says.

Headlines: FDA REMS for Opioids: A 'Flawed' Plan?
Teaser: The FDA's plan to curb opioid abuse is a reasonable first step, but it's not perfect and challenges await, particularly for psychiatrists, experts say.

Headlines: DEA Shuts Down Shipments From Florida Walgreen Facility
Teaser: The US DEA has shut down shipments of controlled substances from Walgreen's Florida distribution facility on suspicion that highly addictive painkillers were being diverted to the black market.

Headlines: Ibuprofen-Famotidine Combination Reduces Ulcer Risk
Teaser: Combining ibuprofen and famotidine into 1 pill can control pain while lowering the risk for ulcers posed by ibuprofen alone.

Headlines: One Third of Prescribed Opioids Missing in Urine
Teaser: Tests show 35% of urine samples are lacking evidence that prescribed medications were actually taken.

Headlines: FDA Warns of Burns From Topical Pain Relievers
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration warns of the potential for burns with over-the-counter topical joint and muscle pain relievers.

Headlines: No Overall Dip in Opioid Abuse With Reformulated Oxycodone
Teaser: The introduction of a tamper-resistant oxycodone (OxyContin) formulation apparently led to a switch to other prescription opioids, researchers report.

Headlines: Standardized Pain Assessment Protocol Improves Postop Pain
Teaser: Frequent nursing assessment and personalized treatment decreased pain scores and increased the number of pain-free cardiac surgery patients.

Headlines: Opioid Misuse Screening Underused by GPs
Teaser: A new study shows 1 in 5 primary care physicians never screen before prescribing opioids.

Headlines: Centralized System Reduces Inappropriate Opioid Prescribing
Teaser: A centralized network offering real-time access to information on patients' filled prescriptions reduces inappropriate prescriptions for opioids and benzodiazepines.

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: Care for Patients With Chronic Nonmalignant Pain
Teaser: This study sought to characterize the primary care management of patients with chronic non-malignant pain, especially the differences between those prescribed opioids and those who were not.

Headlines: Epidural Steroid Injections for Chronic Lower Back Pain
Teaser: Chronic lower back pain has been managed by epidural steroid injections for decades. How cost effective is this practice?

Headlines: Using Music Interventions in Perioperative Care
Teaser: Music therapy-based interventions may be a safe and cost effective nonpharmacological approach to alleviating pain and anxiety surrounding surgical treatment.

Headlines: Where the United States Spends Its Spine Dollars
Teaser: What accounts for the recent increase in ambulatory medical costs for managing spine conditions -- and how can these costs be controlled?

Headlines: Topical NSAIDs May Be a Better Choice for Elderly With OA
Teaser: Topical NSAIDs are as effective as oral NSAIDs for many patients with hand or knee osteoarthritis and may be safer for elderly patients with arthritis.

Headlines: Meta-Analysis Shows Most Effective Anti-Shivering Meds
Teaser: Meperidine, tramadol, and nefopam appear to be the most effective medications for post-anesthesia shivering, according to a new meta-analysis of 61 randomized trials.

Headlines: Acetaminophen: Intravenous Dosing for Postoperative Pain
Teaser: This brief review details what you need to know about an IV formulation of acetaminophen (OFIRMEV) for the management of postoperative pain.

Headlines: Skiers, Rowers May Not Have More Back Pain
Teaser: Despite constant stress on their backs, rowers and cross-country skiers may not have any more chronic lower back pain than the rest of us, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Lubiprostone Effective for Opioid-Induced Constipation
Teaser: Phase 3 study shows the drug was well tolerated, improved constipation without compromising analgesic response.

Headlines: Need for High Opioid Dose Linked to CYP450
Teaser: Cytochrome P450 traits are similar in pain patients who do not respond to lower opioid doses.

Headlines: Inhaled Analgesia Seems Effective for Early Labor
Teaser: Nitrous oxide alleviates the pain of early labor but has more adverse effects than fluranes.

Headlines: Acupuncture Superior to Placebo, Usual Care for Chronic Pain
Teaser: Meta-analysis shows that acupuncture is better than usual care and sham acupuncture for patients with chronic pain.

Headlines: Submicron NSAID Data Mixed
Teaser: Lower-dose submicron particle diclofenac and naproxen produced good pain relief in a clinical trial, but not better than similar doses of standard formulations of naproxen.

Headlines: Smoking Linked to More Pain, Depression in Pain Patients
Teaser: In addition to greater pain intensity and severity, smokers have higher rates of depression and anxiety.

Headlines: Cognitive Deficits With Chronic Opioid Therapy Can Normalize
Teaser: Low back pain patients who stopped opioid pain therapy showed improved visual scanning ability and working memory.

Headlines: Gaps in Opioid Noncancer Pain Care Pose Risk for Abuse
Teaser: Selection of patients for opioid therapy must be based on careful assessment of history and opioid risk tools, which may not be happening in primary care, researchers say.

Headlines: I-Flow Infusion Pumps Recalled
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration is notifying healthcare professionals of a class 1 recall of the I-Flow ON-Q Pump with ONDEMAND Bolus Button because of an inaccurate infusion rate.

Headlines: SNRIs Show Inferiority to TCAs for Chronic Pain
Teaser: The antidepressants are commonly used for fibromyalgia and neuropathic pain; however reduction in average pain score is lower with SNRIs.

Headlines: Prescription Cannabinoid Reduces Need for Other Pain Meds
Teaser: The oral cannabinoid nabilone may be a useful adjunct to current medical management of noncancer pain, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Physician Suspended After 15 Deaths Linked to Pain Meds
Teaser: The Kentucky medical board said Gary Shearer, MD, kept prescribing oxycodone and other pain meds to patients who failed urine tests.

Headlines: Chronic Pancreatitis
Teaser: How does chronic pancreatitis develop and what are optimal ways to treat the disease and the pain that is often associated with it?

Headlines: Trauma Linked to Chronic Pain Severity
Teaser: Traumatic accidents, assault among key factors common with chronic pain that interferes with daily activity.

Headlines: In Defense of Butalbital
Teaser: Do butalbital-containing products still have a role in the management of migraine? In this commentary, the author makes a case for its continued use.

Headlines: Pain Interventions in Premature Infants
Teaser: What's the best evidence for safe and effective pain management in the NICU?

Headlines: Hydrocodone/Acetaminophen Tablets Recalled
Teaser: Watson Laboratories is recalling about 4800 bottles of hydrocodone bitartrate and acetaminophen tablets because of the potential for oversized and superpotent tablets.

Headlines: EU Approval for Neurostimulator in Chronic Migraine
Teaser: The Eon Mini neurostimulator has received European Union Certification to manage the pain and disability associated with intractable chronic migraine.

Headlines: FDA to Expedite Review of Constipation Drug Lubiprostone
Teaser: Pharmaceutical company Sucampo said U.S. health regulators will review the company's application for wider use of its constipation drug Amitiza (lubiprostone) sooner than usual.

Headlines: Biobehavioral Measures for Pain in the Pediatric Patient
Teaser: Assessment of pain in the noncommunicative pediatric population provides many challenges, can biomarkers help?

Headlines: Phase 3 Studies Support Stand-Alone Hydrocodone Formulation
Teaser: The extended-release formulation would allow for improved management of moderate-to-severe chronic pain without acetaminophen-related side effects.

Headlines: Inspection Distractions: Don't Sweat Them
Teaser: Just as pilots have 'sterile cockpit' periods, anesthesiologists need time away from distractions caused by meeting inspection requirements.

Headlines: US Experts Cautious About Good Data on PRP Therapy
Teaser: After 20 years of use of a half-dozen PRP therapeutic applications, outcomes are described as promising but inconsistent.

Headlines: The New Opioid REMS: The FDA View
Teaser: Why a new REMS for extended-release and long-acting opioid analgesics?

Headlines: Best Strategy for Subacromial Bursa Injections?
Teaser: Everyone has their own strategy for subacromial bursa injections. What does the science say?

Headlines: Why the FDA Should Revise Labels on Opioid Analgesics
Teaser: Four pain and addiction specialists argue in support of the Physicians for Responsible Opioid Prescribing (PROP) petition, urging the FDA to revise labels on opioid analgesics

Headlines: Pfizer Says Crush-Proof Pain Drug as Safe as Rival Pills
Teaser: Pfizer Inc said a late-stage trial of its experimental pain drug ALO-02 showed that the drug's long-term safety profile was comparable to those of similar formulations.

Headlines: Drugs Recalled as Deadly Meningitis Outbreak Worsens
Teaser: Federal health officials urge health providers to immediately stop using any product from the New England Compounding Center (NECC).

Headlines: Opioid Patients Often Also Prescribed Psychotropic Drugs
Teaser: With chronic pain linked to a diversity of disorders, polypharmacy is common -- and a concern.

Headlines: Neuroendocrine Levels May Offer Insight on Pain Severity
Teaser: Serum concentrations of cortisol, ACTH, shown to be abnormal in patients with severe pain.

Headlines: Low Back Pain Guidelines Aid in Management
Teaser: Evidence-based guidelines and order set templates should help clinicians avoid inappropriate use of imaging, laboratory tests, steroids or narcotics, and invasive procedures.

Headlines: Online Training Tools Aim to Curb Prescription Drug Epidemic
Teaser: New online tools funded by NIDA and ONDCP, offer guidance on how to manage pain patients and prescribe painkillers properly while reducing the likelihood of addiction.

Headlines: Electrostimulation Device Shown to Improve Fibromyalgia
Teaser: Cortical stimulation treatment resulted in long-term improvement, a new trial shows.

Headlines: FDA Approves Loteprednol Gel for Eye Surgery Pain
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration has approved the new drug application for loteprednol etabonate ophthalmic gel, 0.5% for eye pain after ocular surgery.

Headlines: Physicians Who Use Marijuana are 'Unsafe to Practice'
Teaser: The Colorado policy is the first to limit physicians' rights to use medical marijuana for their own debilitating conditions.

Headlines: 'New Standard of Care' for Oral Mucositis
Teaser: A new treatment is effective for patients with head and neck cancer who receive radiation.

Headlines: Pediatric Pain and Distress in the ED: New Management Tips
Teaser: A comprehensive report offers clinicians who work in emergency settings up-to-date information on the most effective ways to manage pain and anxiety in pediatric patients.

Headlines: Neonatal Anesthesia Linked to Childhood Neurotoxicity?
Teaser: Mounting preclinical and observational studies suggest that multiple anesthetic exposures increase the risk for some neurodevelopmental disorders later.

Headlines: Anesthesiologists, CRNAs Spar Over Chronic Pain Reimbursement
Teaser: A CMS proposal would establish consistent national Medicare reimbursement of pain management.

Headlines: FDA Approves New Lidocaine Formulation for Topical Pain Relief
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has approved for lidocaine/tetracaine 7%/7% cream (Pliaglis, Nuvo Research Inc and Galderma) for topical pain relief.

Headlines: Chronic Pain Patients Carry Unique Challenges and Rewards
Teaser: Caring for patients with chronic pain can be challenging and time-consuming, but it can be rewarding as well.

Headlines: Neuraxial Analgesia Safe and Effective for Cancer Pain
Teaser: Neuraxial analgesia is a safe and effective alternative for the palliative care of cancer patients with refractory pain or opioid toxicity.

Headlines: Fungal Infection Outbreak: What Should Physicians Be Doing?
Teaser: CDC provides practical guidance on how to follow and treat patients who received contaminated steroid injections.

Headlines: Abuse of Pain Med Linked to Life-Threatening Blood Disorder
Teaser: The FDA warns that individuals who abuse the pain medication Opana by intravenous injection are at risk for thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura, a life-threatening blood disorder.

Headlines: Ultrasound Guidance May Make Peripheral Nerve Blockade Safer
Teaser: Ultrasound guidance is associated with a significantly reduced risk of local anesthetic systemic toxicity in patients undergoing peripheral nerve blockade

Headlines: Submicron Particle Diclofenac Shows Fast Pain Control
Teaser: The submicron particle formulation showed acute pain improvement within 30 minutes.

Headlines: Study Shows Risk and No Benefit With Ketamine in Cancer Pain
Teaser: Research fails to support the current widespread use of subcutaneous ketamine as an adjuvant to opioids in refractory advanced cancer pain.

Headlines: New Report Details Where Opioid Prescribing Is Highest
Teaser: Appalachia is the nation's painkiller belt, with higher rates for opioid prescriptions also found in southern and western states.

Headlines: Sit-Stand Workstations Cut Health Risks of Sedentary Jobs
Teaser: A new study has found that sit-stand desks installed in office environments may help cut health risks associated with sedentary jobs.

Headlines: Millions Worldwide Suffer Unbearable Cancer Pain
Teaser: Legal and bureaucratic restrictions on opioid drugs, introduced to stop abuse and drug trafficking, are preventing cancer patients from obtaining pain relief.

Headlines: Nonprescription and Prescription Drugs Cause Poisonings
Teaser: A new study evaluating data from the Toxicology Investigators Consortium registry has found that nonprescription and prescription drugs are equally responsible for drug poisonings in the United States.

Headlines: Fungal Meningitis Outbreak Widening

Headlines: Physicians Often Don't Follow Guidelines for Opioid Therapy
Teaser: One in 12 injured workers prescribed opioid analgesics were still taking them 7 to 12 months later, usually without follow-up urine tests, a new study says.

Headlines: No Added Benefit of Duloxetine-Pregabalin Combo in DPNP
Teaser: In the largest trial for diabetic neuropathic pain, analgesia was better with duloxetine than with pregabalin. Combining the 2 drugs was as effective as raising the doses for resistant patients.

Headlines: Why Haven't Ultrasound-Guided Nerve Blocks Been Embraced?
Teaser: How can anesthesiologists who didn't learn ultrasonography in training obtain the skills they need to use it for placing nerve blocks?

Headlines: Pain Pumps, Anesthetics Linked to Poor Results in Knees
Teaser: Once hoped by the orthopedic community to be an opioid alternative, intra-articular pain pumps and anesthetics are now feared to be a source of chondrolysis.

Headlines: Toxicology-Krokodil: The New Necrosing Street Drug
Teaser: Here is an example of a street drug with a very strong bite.

Headlines: Treatment Outcomes for Work-Related Low Back Pain
Teaser: Does a referral to a pain treatment or spine center affect the functional outcome of patients with work-related chronic low back pain?

Headlines: Effect of Initial Anesthetic With ISB for Shoulder Surgery
Teaser: Do lower initial boluses of local anesthetic result in fewer adverse effects for postop surgery patients with continuous interscalene analgesia?

Headlines: Anesthesiologists Address Fungal Meningitis Scare
Teaser: The fungal meningitis outbreak strikes fear in the hearts of many anesthesiologists, who depend on compounding pharmacies to meet many of their needs.

Headlines: Perceived vs Actual Sedation Practices in Adult ICU Patients
Teaser: How can targeted sedation goals be achieved?

Headlines: A Sumatriptan Transdermal System for Acute Migraine
Teaser: Migraine is often accompanied by nausea, and oral medications may be difficult to stomach. A transdermal sumatriptan patch, currently undergoing clinical trials, may be the answer.

Headlines: Analgesic Use and the Risk of Hearing Loss in Women
Teaser: Use of analgesics has been associated with increased risk of hearing loss in men. Does the same risk apply to women?

Headlines: Back Pain Outcomes Using Longitudinal Data (BOLD) Registry
Teaser: How will the BOLD registry benefit clinicians and elderly patients with back pain?

Headlines: Pain Management in Patients with Substance Use Disorders
Teaser: Stigmatization, misconceptions, and limited access to providers make pain management especially challenging for this population.

Source: JAIDS: Journal of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndromes
Headlines: Problematic Prescription Opioid Use in HIV-Infected Persons
Teaser: Problematic prescription opioid use is very common in HIV-infected individuals. What can healthcare providers do to predict which individuals are at risk?

Teaser: New guidelines for dentists review what drugs are safe -- and what drugs should be avoided -- in pregnant patients.

Headlines: Osteoarthritis: Weight Loss Takes a Load Off Knee Cartilage

Headlines: FDA Clears the First Drug for Rare Morquio A Syndrome
Teaser: Elosulfase alfa (Vimizim) treats Morquio A syndrome by correcting a deficiency in an enzyme important for metabolism.

Headlines: Bugs in the Back: Is Lumbago an Infectious Disease?
Teaser: Paul G. Auwaerter, MD, discusses the prospect of managing sciatica with an antibiotic instead of surgery

Headlines: Aspirin, NSAIDs, and Acetaminophen and Ovarian Cancer Risk
Teaser: Does a low-dose aspirin-a-day keep ovarian cancer at bay?

Headlines: Operative Sperm Retrieval Effective for Fertility Preservation
Teaser: Operative sperm retrieval can be used to preserve fertility in men scheduled to undergo cancer treatment, researchers say.

Teaser: Patients with anterior trunk pain tend to have worse pain and disability from their chronic low back pain, according to a database study.

Headlines: Comparative Outcomes of Extraction of Defibrillator Leads
Teaser: Which ICD has the best outcomes -- for lead extraction?

Headlines: Invasive Procedures in Preterm Infants and Lower IQ in Childhood

Headlines: Flu Vaccine More Effective Than Last Year's, CDC Says
