Teaser: Survey data reveal the increasing size and scope of the nonmedical use of opioids, and its effect on healthcare resources.

Headlines: Hydroxyurea Underused in Sickle Cell Pain Crises
Teaser: At least 75% of adults with sickle cell anemia do not use hydroxyurea, despite recommendations to do so to reduce the frequency of pain crises.

Headlines: First Study of Neural Cells for Stroke Shows Promise
Teaser: The first study of human neural stem cells delivered directly to the brain of stroke patients shows no major harmful effects for up to 4 years, with some suggestion of improved function.

Headlines: FDA Approves Raplixa to Help Control Bleeding During Surgery
Teaser: Raplixa is the first spray-dried fibrin sealant approved for use in adult surgery patients when standard hemostatic measures are ineffective or impractical.

Headlines: Let Patients Know Flurbiprofen Cream May Be Deadly for Pets
Teaser: Tendon injuries are common in sports, and there are many schools of thought on how to avoid them. But a new analysis of past research finds that stretching doesn't help and might even raise the risk of injury for some.

Headlines: National Drop in Opioid Prescriptions, Overdose
Teaser: Patients should be aware that pets can become sick or die after inadvertent exposure to topical pain medications containing the nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug flurbiprofen, the FDA warns.

Headlines: CT Radiation Doses Still Too High in Most US Centers
Teaser: After the introduction of abuse-deterrent formulations of oxycodone and the withdrawal of propoxyphene from the market, there has been a drop in opioid prescriptions and prescription opioid overdose.

Headlines: Imaging Detects Treatment Response in Epicondylosis
Teaser: CT scans are not accurate enough on their own to direct treatment decisions for patients with acute cholecystitis, researchers warn.

Headlines: Adult Sinusitis Guidelines Updated
Teaser: The American Academy of Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery Foundation has updated a clinical practice guideline on adult sinusitis, with a greater focus on patient education and patient preference.

Headlines: Surgeons Say 'We Can Fix It,' Patients May Misunderstand Risks
Teaser: When surgeons prepare patients for an operation by describing how it can fix a problem, patients may agree to procedures without fully understanding the risks, a small study suggests.

Headlines: FDA to Investigate Bayer's Essure Contraceptive Device
Teaser: Petitioners allege that Bayer falsified medical records from clinical trials, failed to report adverse events, misled the public and the FDA about the device, and used defective materials in the device.

Headlines: Rectal Cancer: Outcomes Similar for Laparoscopic vs Open Surgery
Teaser: Three-year results from the COLOR II trial suggest recurrence and survival rates are similar for laparoscopic compared with open surgery.

Headlines: Keeping RA in Check May Lower CV Risk Over Time
Teaser: Each 10-point drop in rheumatoid arthritis disease activity was reducing disease activity associated with a 21% relative drop in cardiovascular risk, independent of the type of treatment used, a new study has found.

Headlines: Acetaminophen Ineffective for Back Pain, Knee/Hip OA
Teaser: Experts were of a mixed opinion on whether treatment guidelines recommending acetaminophen as first-line therapy for back pain and osteoarthritis pain should be reconsidered.

Headlines: FDA Finalizes Roadmap for Development of Abuse-Deterrent Opioids
Teaser: The FDA pledges to work with industry to support the development of new opioid formulations that are difficult to abuse but effective and available when needed.

Headlines: Lower Pitch Counts in Best Little Leaguers to Spare Injury
Teaser: Young baseball players who are tall, pitch fast, or play for more than one team run an increased risk for injury, a new study has shown.

Headlines: Abiraterone Before Chemo Improves Survival: Label Update
Teaser: The FDA has updated the labeling on abiraterone acetate to reflect its expanded indication, and clinical trials results on which the indication was based have now been published.

Headlines: Six Subgroups of Obesity Invite Targeted Management
Teaser: Obese patients can be divided into six groups based on health, behavioral, and demographic characteristics, suggesting the need for a more targeted     approach to management, says a new study.

Headlines: Physician Charged With Conspiring to Murder Ex-Colleague
Teaser: They practiced together for 20 years in Great Neck, New York. Then came a split-up, an arson attempt, and a murder-for-hire plot that was never pulled off.

Headlines: What's Hot at AAN 2015?
Teaser: A rundown of changes to the program and expected highlights of the American Academy of Neurology 67th Annual Meeting, beginning this weekend in Washington, DC.

Headlines: Pay-for-Delay Drug Deals: Do They Hurt or Help Patients?
Teaser: Do pay-for-delay deals increase costs and delay generic drug entry into the market, or do they actually lower costs and make generics available sooner?

Headlines: Ebola Vaccine Safe, Immunogenic in Phase I Trials
Teaser: A genetically engineered Ebola vaccine was safe and induced a significant immune response in multiple phase 1 trials, researchers reported.

Headlines: Precision Medicine Needs 'Precision Genomics'
Teaser: In half of all cancer patients, tumor-only gene sequencing is not enough to guide therapeutic decisions on the use of precision cancer agents.

Headlines: Increased CV Risk With High-Dose Ibuprofen: EMA
Teaser: The increased risk is observed in doses at or exceeding 2400 mg/day. Given the risk, the European reviewers recommend assessing a patient's CVD risk     factors before starting high-dose ibuprofen.

Headlines: Hot Yoga Cools Anxiety, Relieves Depression
Teaser: Women with high stress levels who were randomly assigned to receive Bikram yoga showed significant decreases in anxiety, depression, and stress after 8 weeks.

Headlines: Pregnant Women Pass on Opioid Addiction to Infants
Teaser: Almost 30% of women have filled an opioid pain reliever prescription during pregnancy, significantly increasing the risk for infant withdrawal syndrome.

Headlines: Long-Term Pain Outcomes With DBS in Parkinson's
Teaser: Overall, pain improved in patients with Parkinson's 8 years after having deep brain stimulation, but new pain, mostly musculoskeletal, developed.

Headlines: Drug Overdose Sending More Americans to the ED
Teaser: Intentional and unintentional drug overdoses of analgesics, antipyretics, and antirheumatics, as well as sedatives, hypnotics, tranquilizers, and other psychotropic agents are behind a substantial portion of ED visits.

Headlines: Genital Involvement Worsens Sexual Health, QoL in Psoriasis
Teaser: More than one-third of psoriasis patients have current genital involvement, which severely affects their quality of life and sexual health, according to new findings from two referral centers.

Headlines: Shift From IV to Oral Sedation for Pain Procedures?
Teaser: One pain center reports benefits from a policy shifting from intravenous sedation to oral anxiolysis, but some argue IV sedation is often important.

Headlines: Government Payments for Medicare Advantage Plans to Rise in 2016
Teaser: Payments to health insurers operating Medicare Advantage plans for the elderly and disabled will increase by 1.25 percent in 2016, the U.S. government said, in response to expected growth in health spending.

Headlines: Spinal Stenosis: Similar Results With PT and Surgery
Teaser: Physical therapy or surgery provided similar improvements over the course of 2 years, a new study suggests; first-line treatment should start with a standardized PT regimen, an expert suggests.

Headlines: Point-of-Care H. Pylori Testing Feasible
Teaser: Testing for Helicobacter pylori in patients who present to the emergency department with abdominal pain, and treating those who test positive, is feasible and may improve patient outcomes.

Headlines: Marijuana Compound May Reduce Seizures in Severe Epilepsy
Teaser: The largest open-label study of its kind to date shows seizures were reduced by more than 50% in patients with Dravet or Lennox-Gastaut syndromes.

Headlines: Displaced Bony Fragment Signals Tendon Tear
Teaser: Patients with acute pain and a displaced enthesophyte probably have an underlying tendon tear that requires clinical attention, report researchers.

Headlines: The International Traveler With Neurological Symptoms
Teaser: Returning international travelers may present with a myriad of neurologic symptoms, including confusion, headache, weakness and sensory symptoms. What should be your diagnostic approach?

Headlines: Hospital Violence Hits Home
Teaser: Are you safe in your hospital? Recent incidents of violence against physicians and hospital staff leave some worried, but there are steps to be taken which can increase security.

Headlines: Diagnosis and Management of Acute Concussion
Teaser: This primer outlines what you need to know regarding accurate diagnosis and appropriate management of acute concussion, highlighting head injury sustained by athletes and military personnel.

Headlines: Drinkers Using Prescription Drugs: Risking Their Health?
Teaser: A recent study shows that a large proportion of Americans who drink use prescription medications that could lead to serious consequences if mixed with alcohol--especially problematic in the elderly.

Headlines: Reliably Detecting Cognitive Impairment in HIV Infection
Teaser: Is multivariate normative comparison a reliable way to detect cognitive impairment in HIV patients?

Headlines: Timely Pain Management in the Emergency Department
Teaser: How effective was this new approach in improving the timeliness of pain relief in the ED?

Headlines: Female Genital Cutting: Cultural Challenges and Complications
Teaser: How can clinicians properly care for women who have experienced female genital cutting, and what particular health problems could these women present with?

Headlines: Abuse of Medications Theoretically Without Abuse Potential
Teaser: Are you aware that many noncontrolled prescription drugs and OTC medications can be abused? Learn which are most likely to be used inappropriately in this article.

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Anticholinergics and Risk of Pneumonia in Elderly Adults
Teaser: Does acute or chronic use of anticholinergic medications in older adults increase the risk of community-acquired pneumonia?

Headlines: Child Witness to Domestic Abuse: 7-Year Prospective Study
Teaser: Should mothers be routinely screened for abuse during well-child visits, to protect children?

Headlines: The Sympathetic Nervous Response in Inflammation
Teaser: What role does the sympathetic nervous system play in the development of autoimmune arthritis?

Headlines: New Drugs for Children in the FDA Pipeline
Teaser: These new drugs, suitable for pediatric patients, may play a significant role in the management of diseases.

Headlines: The Effect of Preop Suggestions on Perioperative Dreams
Teaser: Preoperative suggestions may influence perioperative dreaming.

Headlines: Responding to Diabetes: National Diabetes Education Program
Teaser: Which strategies improve the patient experience in primary care diabetes management?

Headlines: Airport Malaria: Report of Four Cases in Tunisia
Teaser: This report refers to four local airport malaria cases in Tunisian citizens who had never been to endemic areas.

Source: Current Opinion in Allergy and Clinical Immunology
Headlines: Immunological Mechanisms in Allergic Contact Dermatitis
Teaser: Learn about new details in the complex orchestration of cellular and molecular immune response to contact allergens.

Headlines: An Update on Civilian Spinal Gunshot Wounds
Teaser: Can patients who sustained spinal gunshot wounds be effectively treated conservatively? What are the indications for surgical treatment?

Headlines: Recommendations for Laparoscopic Liver Resection
Teaser: Read about the status of laparoscopic liver surgery and recommendations to aid its future development.

Headlines: Neuropathic Ocular Pain as a Feature of Dry Eye
Teaser: Gain a better understanding of neuropathic ocular pain associated with dry eye, and how these findings could have implications for the diagnosis and treatment of dry eye symptoms.

Headlines: Diet and Irritable Bowel Syndrome
Teaser: Do certain foods exacerbate symptoms in IBS patients?

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: Complications of New Medications
Teaser: This case of jaw osteonecrosis highlights a potential adverse effect of zoledronic acid, commonly prescribed for osteoporosis.

Source: OJIN: The Online Journal of Issues in Nursing
Headlines: Nurses With Undiagnosed Hearing Loss: Practice Implications
Teaser: What role does hearing play in nursing practice and what do hearing impaired nurses need to function in the hospital setting?

Headlines: Adequacy of Powered vs Manual Bone Marrow Biopsy Specimens
Teaser: This study compares the the quality and quantity of the bone marrow aspirates obtained from a powered system vs. the standard manual method.

Headlines: A Case of Splenic Rupture After Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy
Teaser: Splenic rupture is an unusual but life-threatening complication of laparoscopic cholecystectomy. What went wrong for this patient?

Headlines: Bioavailability of Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitors
Teaser: The growing prominence of tyrosine kinase inhibitors (TKIs) as treatment for malignancies prompts oncology nurses to expand the scope of their patient assessment.

Headlines: Risk of Upper GI Bleeding From Different Drug Combinations
Teaser: Could the use of multiple drugs concurrently be a risk factor for upper GI bleeding, and how can clinicians help tailor therapy to prevent it, especially in elderly patients?

Headlines: Gait Assessment as a Functional Outcome Measure in TKA
Teaser: What role could routine gait assessments play in the post-operative rehabilitation of TKA patients?

Headlines: Outpatient Treatment for Cutaneous Leishmaniasis in Children
Teaser: Conventional treatments for cutaneous leishmaniasis can be painful and difficult to implement, especially in young children. Is there an effective alternative?

Headlines: Migraine and Epilepsy: Review of the Literature
Teaser: While migraine and epilepsy are clearly different diseases, there are some overlaps in clinical symptoms--and even in treatments. This review examines their underlying commonalities and differences.

Headlines: Outcomes in RA Patients Undergoing Total Joint Arthroplasty
Teaser: This article compares arthroplasty outcomes in rheumatoid arthritis patients vs. osteoarthritis patients.

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: The Decision to Hospitalize ED Patients With an SSTI
Teaser: Which ED patients with SSTI are more likely to be hospitalized? A new study looks at the factors associated with the hospital admission of these patients.

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Oral Health Care for Older Adults With Serious Illness
Teaser: In this commentary, the author proposes a new model of oral health care for the seriously ill elderly, which promotes enhanced collaboration between physicians, nurses, and dentists.

Headlines: Scapular Fractures: Diagnosis and Treatment Plan
Teaser: 3D computed tomography can play a pivotal role in the diagnosis and treatment planning of scapula fractures.

Headlines: Repurposing Drugs in Your Medicine Cabinet
Teaser: Learn about situations where medicine-cabinet-mining and off-label drug use may be the right choice.

Headlines: Top 10 Tips in Caring for a Hospitalized Child With Autism
Teaser: Learn more about the symptoms of autism and how that impacts the care that this special population requires.

Headlines: Pharmacogenetics and Analgesia of Antidepressants in Pain
Teaser: Are antidepressants getting us one step closer to individualized pain management?

Headlines: Opioid and Benzodiazepine Withdrawal in Pediatric Patients
Teaser: What are the most salient risk factors associated with iatrogenic withdrawal syndrome in critically ill pediatric patients?

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: Use of and Interests in CAM by Hispanic Patients
Teaser: This study evaluated complementary and alternative medicine use among a medically underserved, predominately Hispanic community. How prevalent is it, and what are they using?

Headlines: Outcomes in Lumbar Decompression Surgery for Spinal Stenosis
Teaser: How do elderly patients fare after undergoing lumbar decompression for degenerative lumbar spinal stenosis?

Headlines: Migraine Mimics
Teaser: The symptoms of migraine are non-specific and can be present in many other headache disorders. Learn some diagnostic tips and review other migraine mimics with these challenging case presentations.

Headlines: Dialysis Modality Choice in Diabetic Patients With ESRD
Teaser: Is one particular dialysis modality considered to be the most effective to treat patients with diabetes and ESRD?

Headlines: Exercise Type, Elbow Angle Effects During the Push-up Plus
Teaser: How do the effects of the traditional and the modified push-up plus exercise compare?

Headlines: Opioid Endocrinopathy
Teaser: Are opioids adverse effects more of a "pain" than you realized? Learn how opioids may be associated with hypogonadism, adrenal insufficiency, and other endocrine disorders.

Headlines: FibroScan: Where Does It Stand in US Practice
Teaser: As a non-invasive way of detecting and staging liver disease, how effective and reliable is FibroScan, and are US clinicians using it regularly in their practices?

Headlines: Factors, Medications Associated With Depression Risk in MS
Teaser: Depression is a common co-morbidity for people with multiple sclerosis, and challenging to treat pharmacologically in this group. Are there modifiable lifestyle factors that could ameliorate the risk?

Headlines: Intervention for Pain Assessment in Preverbal Children
Teaser: What's the best way to guage pain in kids who can't talk?

Headlines: Metastatic Castration-resistant Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Learn more about molecular mechanisms underlying castration resistance along with insights into identifying the best sequence of new drugs.

Headlines: Intestinal Microbiota and Diet in IBS
Teaser: Do diet, microbiota composition, and microbial fermentation products play an essential role in the etiology of IBS? This new study investigates.

Headlines: Reversing the Slide
Teaser: Are hospitalists lacking fundamental skills in common bedside procedures?

Headlines: Microscopic Colitis -- Clinical and Pathologic Perspectives
Teaser: How common is microscopic colitis, how does it develop, how does it differ histologically from other forms of colitis?

Headlines: A Dental Myth Bites the Dust
Teaser: Many patients--and even some dentists--believe that occurrence of toothaches and abscesses can be influenced by the weather or the moon. This study examines the evidence.

Headlines: Updated Recommendations for the Use of Typhoid Vaccine
Teaser: Who should receive typhoid vaccine, and which version is appropriate for your patient? This report presents the latest ACIP recommendations.

Headlines: Imaging Sports-Related Elbow Injuries
Teaser: The elbow is one of the more commonly injured joints in sports. This article summarizes the various elbow injuries commonly encountered and the optimal radiographic tools for diagnosis.

Headlines: What Is It Like to Be a Child With Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus?
Teaser: Examine thoughts, feelings, and daily experiences with the management of diabetes in kids.

Headlines: Clinical Nurse Specialists and NPs as Change Champions in LTC
Teaser: Find out how NPs and CNSs may help change pain practices in long-term care.

Headlines: Gastroenterologists' Assessment of EoE in Adults
Teaser: Do histologic and endoscopic findings give gastroenterologists a full picture of the activity of eosinophilic esophagitis in their adult patients?

Headlines: Advancing Research and Practice in HIV And Rehabilitation
Teaser: The role for rehabilitation in the context of HIV, aging and comorbidities is emerging.

Headlines: Computerised Quality Documentation During Anaesthesia
Teaser: What difficulties act as barriers to quality reporting in anesthesia?

Headlines: Behavioral Urotherapy for Bowel and Bladder Dysfunction
Teaser: What's the right dose of urotherapy for bowel and bladder dysfunction?

Headlines: Unplanned Hospital Readmission After Lumbar Surgery
Teaser: How often are patients re-admitted to the hospital after undergoing lumbar surgical procedures, and for what reasons? This article provides some insight.

Headlines: DBS for Psychiatric and Headache Disorders
Teaser: Deep brain stimulation is proving to be a promising treatment option for neuropsychiatric and headache disorders that do not respond to conventional treatments. What's the latest research?

Headlines: Diagnosis and Treatment of Lymphedema in Breast Cancer
Teaser: Learn more about managing this common problem for breast cancer survivors.

Headlines: Cocaine-Induced Cardiomyopathy
Teaser: Is the patient's cardiomyopathy a result of cocaine use? How should the initial presentation be managed?

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: Gastric Outlet Obstruction From Bouveret Syndrome
Teaser: This rare condition presents with symptoms similar to small bowel obstruction. How was this case diagnosed?

Headlines: Educational Technology to Improve Patient Care in Pharmacy
Teaser: Is computer-aided instruction an effective method for teaching patient care skills?

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: Pre-Hospital Ketamine for Agitated Delirious Patients
Teaser: Is the use of ketamine for severely agitated patients a safe and effective means of sedation in the field? This new article examines the issues.

Headlines: Patient Returns to Hospital With Continuing Vision Loss
Teaser: Originally diagnosed with and treated for optic neuritis, a woman returns nearly a week later when her symptoms worsen. What's causing the return of her vision impairment?

Headlines: 'Someone to Oversee How Things Move Around Here'
Teaser: Amid the chaos of a busy hospital, sometimes a few small extra steps can go a very long way.

Headlines: Advances to Know in Alzheimer's, Migraine, and Stroke
Teaser: Three new studies presented at this year's American Academy of Neurology meeting could have significant clinical implications.

Headlines: No Return Trips: Hospitals Under Pressure to Lower Readmissions
Teaser: The pressure is on to slow down the revolving door and prevent patients from bouncing right back in after discharge.

Headlines: Drug Testing: Could Innocent Doctors Be Wrongly Accused?
Teaser: Doctors' opinions are divided on whether or not testing should take place. One worry is what happens if someone is falsely accused.

Headlines: Temporary Truce Between Docs and Lawyers?
Teaser: A truce between doctors and lawyers; when in doubt, scan; protecting sports medicine doctors; delay in care leads to lawsuit.

Headlines: A Death Well Lived
Teaser: The loss of a patient after 16 years of caring helps Dr Melissa Walton-Shirley realize why she still practices medicine despite frequent thoughts of     quitting.

Headlines: New Standard of Care for Prescribing Opioids
Teaser: A plethora of new guidelines are establishing a new standard of care for pain management and opioid prescribing.

Headlines: Fighting With Families Over Patient Care
Teaser: Sometimes family members disagree with docs about treatment and may even want to stop it. What to do if the patient can't weigh in and you're caught in the middle?

Headlines: A Caution When Diagnosing Disease
Teaser: Dr Kay describes a case that illustrates the pitfalls of focusing on one set of symptoms in a patient with a very complex history.

Headlines: Indignity of Cancer Therapy (and What to Do About It)
Teaser: How does surviving cancer change an oncologist's view of cancer care? Dr Laura Liberman shares her insights with Dr Lidia Schapira on making personalized medicine more personal for the patient.

Headlines: Top News From AAPM 2015: Slideshow
Teaser: Highlights of this year's conference include studies on postdural headache, chronic migraine, and low back pain, plus a look at the complexities of opioid-induced hyperalgesia.

Headlines: Sexuality at End of Life
Teaser: Taking care of the 'whole person' means also addressing sexuality concerns, which are common in patients with serious illness, those with cancer, and those facing the end of life.

Headlines: Commentary: Arizona Law Forces Ob/Gyns to Lie to Patients
Teaser: Doctors are now required to tell women about 'abortion reversal.'

Headlines: Atrial Fibrillation Care: Put the Catheter (and Rx Pad) Down
Teaser: Electrophysiology's watershed moment is the growing acceptance that AF is not fixable with ablation and drugs as long as the underlying causes are left     untreated.

Headlines: Should Younger Patients Ever Have Knee Replacement Surgery?
Teaser: An expert argues that high tibial osteotomy is always preferred over a knee replacement procedure for younger patients who have unicompartmental articular cartilage damage.

Headlines: Rein It In, Dr Oz
Teaser: Art Caplan says, 'Keep your job, Dr Oz, but make your message less about hype and more about health.'

Headlines: Abraham Verghese: Hope for Hands-on Medicine in the EMR Era
Teaser: Dr John Mandrola discusses getting back to the heart of medicine in the EMR era with Dr Abraham Verghese.

Headlines: Arthritic in Arizona: A Case
Teaser: Dr John Kay discusses an interesting case of a patient with rheumatoid arthritis and flu-like symptoms.

Headlines: 9 Devices That Are Changing Medicine
Teaser: Advances in wireless and implantable devices are improving the management of numerous conditions, from diabetes to heart disease and chronic pain.

Headlines: Two Congressmen Turn Up Heat on Power Morcellators
Teaser: A physician couple waging an often lonely campaign to ban power morcellators and toughen safety standards for all medical devices has gained some influential allies.

Headlines: Ebola Virus Persists in Eyes Months After Clearing Blood
Teaser: Survivors need ophthalmological follow-up for eye disease, but the incidence of ocular complications is unknown.

Headlines: Substance Abuse Fuels Rise in HCV in Four Eastern States
Teaser: Acute HCV infections increased from 2006 to 2012 among young people in Kentucky, Tennessee, Virginia, and West Virginia and were strongly correlated with opioid abuse and injection drug use.

Headlines: Cannabis Use Linked to Memory Dysfunction
Teaser: Long-term cannabis use increases the likelihood of false memories, with accompanying alterations in brain activity, that persist even after abstaining.

Headlines: Lyme Disease and Other Tickborne Diseases in New Hampshire
Teaser: New Hampshire continues to have one of the highest rates of Lyme disease in the nation; the state's Department of Health and Human Services provides four things clinicians should know about Lyme and other tickborne diseases.

Headlines: SWOG Study: 2 Effective Pills for AI-Related Pain Relief
Teaser: Investigators can't account for the strong showing of a soybean and corn oil capsule in a randomized trial of omega-3 fatty acids for aromatase-inhibitor-linked joint aches.

Headlines: Buprenorphine Buccal Film Reduces Chronic Low Back Pain
Teaser: A new study has shown that buprenorphine delivered through a buccal film can reduce chronic low back pain with few adverse effects.

Headlines: How to Treat Side Effects of New Cancer Immunotherapies
Teaser: A new review article details the major side effects of immunotherapies for cancer and provides advice on how to treat them.

Headlines: Primary Care at Apex of Deliberations Over Vaccines
Teaser: Physicians are the guardians of public health, but recent measles outbreaks have shown that renewed vigilance is needed.

Headlines: Lariat for LAA Closure in AF Needs Lassoing, Say Experts
Teaser: The device, cleared for use without clinical-trial scrutiny, needs more rigorous testing if its use in left-atrial-appendage closure is to continue in AF, say researchers based on their analysis.

Headlines: ED-Initiated Buprenorphine Helps Opioid Addicts Recover
Teaser: Opioid-dependent patients who start buprenorphine in the emergency department with referral to primary care are more likely to still be engaged in addiction treatment 30 days later.

Headlines: Opioids Gateway Drug for Many High-Risk Patients
Teaser: Safer opioid prescribing requires screening patients for drug or alcohol abuse risk, informed consent, and compliance monitoring of those receiving ongoing therapy.

Headlines: FDA OKs First Patient-Controlled Patch for Postop Pain
Teaser: Ionsys is the first needle-free, patient-controlled, preprogrammed fentanyl delivery system for management of acute postoperative pain.

Headlines: Breast Reconstruction With Brava-Assisted Fat Grafting
Teaser: Is this minimally invasive procedure a safe and viable alternative for breast reconstruction?

Headlines: Poisoning Deaths Involving Opioid Analgesics: NYS, 2003-2012
Teaser: This report examines the steady and alarming upward trend in poisoning deaths attributed to prescription opioids in New York State.

Headlines: Opioids Blamed for Spike in Withdrawal Cases in the NICU
Teaser: Increasing rates of neonatal abstinence syndrome are leading to increases in the use of pharmacotherapy and neonatal intensive care unit (NICU) resources, new research has shown.

Headlines: Targeted Therapies for NSCLCs With Aberrant EGF Receptors
Teaser: Find out about current molecular targets that have therapies available and other targets for which therapies will be available in the near future.

Headlines: Hope for 'Suicide Headache'
Teaser: A minimally invasive implantable device that facilitates on-demand patient treatment may help ease the crippling pain and psychosocial burden of so-called suicide headaches.

Source: International Journal for Quality in Health Care
Headlines: What Are Incident Reports Telling Us?
Teaser: This study indicates that only a small percentage of in-hospital prescribing errors are being reported. Are they failing to be detected--or being detected, but not reported?

Headlines: Transversus Abdominis Plane Blocks Curb Hernia Repair Pain
Teaser: The FDA has approved the Senza spinal cord stimulation system, the first such system to relieve pain without paresthesia.

Headlines: HRS Sessions Celebrate Innovation in the 'Athens of America'
Teaser: At the party: a tip of the hat to the ICD on its FDA-approval pearl anniversary and 2 days of late-breaking trials with poisoned epicardial fat pads,     wireless CRT electrodes, and other fascinations.

Headlines: Acetaminophen-Linked Liver Failure Varies Widely in Europe
Teaser: A case-population study in seven European countries found a 50-fold difference in rates of liver failure linked to paracetamol overdose.

Headlines: Cannabis Smoking Common, Affects Cognition in MS
Teaser: Cannabis smoking is common among patients with MS, who use it to control pain and spasticity, but the downside is that it may have lasting effects on memory and other cognitive functions.

Headlines: New Sodium Channel Blocker Dampens Radiculopathy Pain
Teaser: A phase 2 trial shows that a new sodium channel blocker is safe and effective for neuropathic pain from lumbosacral radiculopathy.

Headlines: Feldenkrais Method Exercise Promising for Parkinson's
Teaser: A new study shows that the Feldenkrais Method of somatic education can improve the mood and quality of life among people with Parkinson's disease.

Headlines: Acupuncture Causes Brain Changes in Patients With Hand Pain
Teaser: Acupuncture appears to increase cortical thickness while alleviating pain in idiopathic hand pain, providing evidence that this condition is distinct from carpal tunnel syndrome.

Teaser: Patients with tension-type headache have weaker neck extension muscles and a lower extension/flexion ratio than healthy controls, a case-control study shows.

Headlines: Migraine Linked to Carpal Tunnel Syndrome
Teaser: Regional anesthesia of the transversus abdominis plane (TAP) curbs pain in patients undergoing laparoscopic ventral hernia repair (LVHR), according to New York-based researchers.

Headlines: Experimental Nitinol IUD May Cause Less Pain
Teaser: A study for the first time shows an association between migraine and carpal tunnel syndrome, but experts urge caution in interpreting the results.

Headlines: Drug-Resistant ‘Superbug’ Strain of Typhoid Spreads Worldwide
Teaser: A new nitinol intrauterine device causes less discomfort during insertion than a copper device, and women are more likely to continue using it, a new study has shown.

Headlines: House Passes Abortion Ban at 20 Weeks
Teaser: Antibiotic-resistant typhoid fever has spread globally, driven by a single strain of Salmonella Typhi called H58, according to a large international study.

Headlines: What's Hot: Your Guide to APA 2015 Annual Meeting Highlights
Teaser: The bill bans abortions at 20 weeks of gestation based on the premise that fetuses that young can experience pain — a premise that the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists calls untrue.

Headlines: Abuse Risk Evaluation Changes Opioid Prescribing
Teaser: Psychiatrists from around the world will head to the Great White North (aka Canada) this weekend to attend the American Psychiatric Association's annual meeting in Toronto.

Headlines: FDA Okays Sumatriptan/Naproxen (Treximet) for Migraine in Teens
Teaser: A new study shows that a system for identifying which patients are most likely to abuse opioids could affect how physicians prescribe these drugs.

Headlines: SGLT2 Inhibitor Diabetes Drugs May Cause Ketoacidosis: FDA
Teaser: The drug is the first combination prescription treatment to be approved for migraine in children 12 years of age and older.

Headlines: Anesthesia Comes With No Charge in Screening Colonoscopies, Feds Say
Teaser: Reports of ketoacidosis requiring hospitalization in patients with type 2 diabetes taking sodium-glucose cotransporter-2 inhibitors prompts FDA drug safety communication.

Headlines: CVS Pays $22 Mln to Resolve Florida Painkiller Probe
Teaser: Earlier this week the federal government clarified that insurers can’t charge people for anesthesia administered during a free colonoscopy to screen for colorectal cancer.

Headlines: Metoclopramide and Diphenhydramine Blunt Pregnancy Headaches
Teaser: CVS Health Corp, the second-largest U.S. drugstore operator, will pay $22 million to resolve a federal probe into whether two of its pharmacies in central Florida sold powerful, potentially addictive painkillers that were not prescribed for legitimate medical purposes.

Headlines: Drug Combo Targets Common Cystic Fibrosis Gene Abnormality
Teaser: The two-drug combination is more expensive than codeine for reducing headaches in pregnant women, but is more effective and worth the cost, say researchers.

Headlines: World's First Medical Cannabis Registry Launched
Teaser: Results from the phase 3 TRAFFIC and TRANSPORT trials suggest the oral combination of lumacaftor and ivacaftor improves lung function and curbs exacerbations.

Headlines: Minnesota Jury Convicts Final Exit Group of Assisting 2007 Suicide
