Headlines: Impact of Arthritis and Chronic Conditions on Life Domains
Teaser: How much of an impact does arthritis have on social life and work, compared with other chronic conditions?

Headlines: Cardiovascular Risk Management in Ankylosing Spondylitis
Teaser: Ankylosing spondylitis patients may be at an increased risk for cardiovascular disease. What can clinicians do to minimize the risk?

Headlines: Herpes Zoster in Older Adults
Teaser: Case studies illuminate nuances needed when working with older patients with herpes zoster, from prevention to acute care.

Headlines: The Top 100 Classic Papers in Lumbar Spine Surgery
Teaser: This review identifies the most important studies in lumbar spine surgery. How they have impacted advancements in the field?

Headlines: Significant Drug Interactions in HIV-Infected Patients
Teaser: Drug-drug interactions are common in HIV-infected patients, and could represent major health problems. Which patients are most at risk?

Headlines: Spontaneous Bacterial Peritonitis
Teaser: How serious is spontaneous bacterial peritonitis, who is at risk for it, how is it best diagnosed, and what can clinicians do to both prevent and treat it?

Headlines: Alcohol, Tobacco Use in Youth With and Without Chronic Pain
Teaser: Health risk behaviors including alcohol and tobacco use are often established during adolescence. Does having chronic pain contribute to the risk of alcohol or tobacco use in this age group?

Headlines: The Social Functioning of Siblings of Children With Cancer
Teaser: Does a serious childhood illness such as cancer adversely impact the social functioning and peer relationships of healthy siblings within the family?

Headlines: Doctors' Legal Risks With Medical Marijuana
Teaser: More than 20 states allow the use of medical marijuana, but there are things you need to know to avoid getting into trouble.

Headlines: Another PFO Closure Study Yields Mixed Migraine Results
Teaser: The latest trial to investigate patent foramen ovale closure as potential treatment for refractory migraine has again yielded overall negative results but suggests possible benefit for those with aura.

Headlines: Moderate Treatment Not Enough to Curb Moderate Arthritis
Teaser: Patients with rheumatoid arthritis need more than just standard DMARD therapy to decrease the risk for major joint surgery in the first 5 years after disease onset, researchers report.

Headlines: Anesthesiologist Loses Lawsuit for Mocking Sedated Patient
Teaser: The physician's disparaging comments came back to haunt her because while the patient was out - his cellphone was on.

Headlines: SPG Stimulation Alleviates Cluster Headache
Teaser: An implanted device on the market in some European countries and in clinical trials in the United States provided 2-year pain relief in two thirds of patients with refractory cluster headache.

Headlines: ACOG Expands Substance Abuse Guidelines
Teaser: Recommendations for universal screening now also apply to prescription drug abuse.

Headlines: ADA: Two Big Trials and Special 75th Anniversary Celebration
Teaser: Results from two major cardiovascular-outcomes trials will be presented at the 2015 American Diabetes Association Scientific Sessions, as speakers mark 75     years of progress and move the field forward.

Headlines: Kids With Migraine Not Receiving Optimal Treatment
Teaser: Two studies reveal that half of kids with migraine or probable migraine aren't receiving any treatment, very few are receiving evidence-based treatment, and one in six are given opioids.

Headlines: Medical Marijuana Laws Don't Encourage Teen Use
Teaser: A multiyear nationwide survey suggests that introducing state medical marijuana laws does not lead to an increase in marijuana use in adolescents, although those states have higher overall usage.

Headlines: Smartphone Overuse May Affect Hand Function
Teaser: A new study shows frequent smartphone users have an enlarged median nerve, as well as impaired hand function and pinch strength compared with those who use their phone less often.

Headlines: Migraine Patients Skip Triptans in 40% of Attacks
Teaser: A study has found that patients with migraine are not taking their prescribed triptans in a large proportion of attacks, but those who do take them at the first signs of migraine do best.

Headlines: Shingles Vaccination Helps Some Who Later Develop the Virus
Teaser: Adults who developed herpes zoster despite having received the herpes zoster vaccine had a reduced risk for painful complications compared with their unvaccinated counterparts.

Headlines: 'Silent' Celiac Disease Found in Kids at Rheumatology Clinic
Teaser: Celiac disease was twice as common in children presenting for rheumatology evaluation as in the general population, and musculoskeletal symptoms in those with the disease resolved with a gluten-free diet.

Headlines: Medicare Favors Generic Opioids Over Abuse-Deterrent Formulations
Teaser: The abuse of prescription painkillers is a growing problem for seniors, as it is for other age groups.

Headlines: Adult Dental Coverage Expanding Slowly in Medicaid
Teaser: Federal law requires state Medicaid programs to include dental care for children, and the Affordable Care Act extended that requirement to private insurers.

Headlines: NSAIDs Dramatically Reduce Ovulation With Consistent Use
Teaser: When taken during the luteal phase of the menstrual cycle, NSAIDs can inhibit ovulation and could significantly impair fertility in women trying to get pregnant.

Headlines: Car Seat Screening Finds 5% Failure Rate in LBW Babies
Teaser: Nearly 5% of full-term low-birth-weight babies failed a car seat tolerance screen, and the biggest risk factor was the presence of opiates in the mother's urine at the time of hospital admission.

Headlines: Stimulant Medication Misuse 'Starts Earlier Than Thought'
Teaser: Surveys of more than 250,000 adolescents show the peak age of initiating misuse of stimulant medications is earlier than expected, with higher rates in females.

Headlines: Colorado High Court Upholds Firing of Workers for Medical Pot Use
Teaser: Medical marijuana patients in Colorado could lose their jobs for using cannabis because the drug remains illegal under federal law, the state's highest court ruled on Monday, upholding the firing of a quadriplegic who tested positive for pot.

Headlines: Drug Overdose Now Leading Cause of Injury-Related Deaths
Teaser: Drug overdose deaths continue to increase in the US and are now the leading cause of injury deaths in the US, a new report shows.

Headlines: Migraine: Zolmitriptan Nasal Spray Cleared for Kids 12 and Up
Teaser: Zomig is the first nasal-delivered prescription medicine approved for the treatment of acute migraine attacks in pediatric patients.

Headlines: Arthroscopic Knee Surgery Shows No Long-term Benefit
Teaser: After arthroscopic knee surgery, small pain relief effects lasted less than 2 years, and patients reported no functional improvement; harms included deep vein thrombosis, infection, and death.

Headlines: Physician Got $439K in Kickbacks for $5K 'Investment'
Teaser: Spinal surgeon Aria Sabit, MD, pleaded guilty to receiving kickbacks for using implant hardware from a company he co-owned, a conflict of interest the government has warned about for years.

Headlines: Does Appendicitis Have to Be Treated With Surgery?
Teaser: A new study has questioned the previously unquestionable and revealed that antibiotics without surgery may be an effective treatment option for patients with uncomplicated appendicitis.

Headlines: First Success With CAR T-Cells in a Solid Tumor
Teaser: Dramatic results with chimeric-antigen receptor (CAR) T-cells have been seen in hematologic malignancies, and now the first proof-of-concept success is reported for pancreatic cancer.

Headlines: Too Many Patients With Migraine Receiving Opioids, Barbiturates
Teaser: A new survey reveals that half of patients with migraine are receiving medications that are not recommended as first-line and that may lead to overdose, addiction, and more frequent headaches.

Headlines: UK Reform Empowers PCPs to Improve Cancer Diagnoses
Teaser: Guidance on symptom-led cancer diagnosis in primary care and early referral could help curb the thousands of excess cancer deaths in the UK every year, claims health watchdog.

Headlines: Essure Adverse Events Ballooned Since Late 2013, FDA Says
Teaser: However, the agency said that one postapproval study of the permanent contraceptive device did not reveal any new safety problems since it was approved in 2002.

Headlines: Plugging the Tear Ducts Helps Some With Dry Eyes
Teaser: Tiny plugs inserted into the tear duct may safely curb the annoying and damaging effects of dry eyes, according to a new analysis of previous research.

Headlines: Half of Athletes at Top of Game After Repeat Knee Surgery
Teaser: Many athletes can continue to play sports after multiple surgeries to fix a damaged knee ligament, but only about half of them perform as well as they did before their injury, an analysis of previous research suggests.

Headlines: Widespread Borrelia miyamotoi Tick-borne Fever Found in US
Teaser: A new, and potentially more severe, infection transmitted by the same ticks that carry Lyme disease was much more common in the United States in 2013 than expected, especially in the Northeast.

Headlines: Polypharmacy and Hypoglycemia: Which Drug Is Causing It?
Teaser: An elderly man becomes confused when his blood sugar becomes dramatically low. He's taking a handful of drugs -- which one is causing hypoglycemia? Take this case challenge.

Headlines: 'Bio-Artificial' Intestine: New Hope for Bowel Diseases
Teaser: What if people with seriously diseased or damaged intestines could use their own stem cells to grow new 'bio-artificial' intestinal tissue?

Headlines: Marijuana and Your Job: What You Need to Know
Teaser: As states explore the ramifications of legalized marijuana, healthcare providers can get caught in the crossfire. What can get you fired?

Headlines: Pediatric Primary Headache From A to Z
Teaser: A special symposium at this year's PAS addressed pediatric headache and migraine, emphasizing the need to approach them as functional problems.

Headlines: Day of Week That TJA Is Scheduled Affects Length of Stay
Teaser: Patients who undergo total joint arthroplasty later in the week spend significantly more time in the hospital--and cost the hospital significantly more--than those operated on earlier in the week.

Headlines: Arthritis Magnifies Effect of Other Chronic Conditions
Teaser: Social life and work ability were more negatively affected by arthritis than other chronic health problems; in combination with one or more other health issues, it worsened the effect of all of them.

Headlines: Analgesics Linked to Increased Homicide Risk
Teaser: Psychotropic drugs, particularly opiate and nonopiate analgesics, are associated with a significantly increased risk for homicide.

Headlines: New NINDS Director Named
Teaser: Dr Walter Koroshetz's 'deep grounding in clinical neurology and basic neuroscience research makes him the ideal candidate to lead NINDS into the future': Francis Collins, MD, director, NIH.

Headlines: Synthetic Marijuana an Urgent Public Health Threat
Teaser: Calls to poison control centers related to synthetic marijuana jumped 229% in the first 5 months of 2015, prompting calls to get the products off the market.

Headlines: Improved Survival in Sarcoma for First Time With Eribulin
Teaser: Survival benefit was 2 months, but there was no reduction in tumor burden, and there was significant toxicity and cost. The results contrasted with those for trabectedin.

Headlines: Seniors Need Multicomponent Prevention of Postop Delirium
Teaser: The new American Geriatrics Society clinical practice guideline for postoperative delirium in older adults emphasizes preventive and nonpharmacologic strategies.

Headlines: After DKA Warning, Avoid SGLT2-Inhibitor Use in Type 1 Diabetes
Teaser: A case series finds 13 episodes of euglycemic diabetic ketoacidosis associated with SGLT2-inhibitor use in both types of diabetes; the authors advise avoiding     these agents in those with type 1 diabetes.

Headlines: Higher Fees Could Offset Care Benefits of Physician Mergers
Teaser: A study has found that arthroplasty fees rose by 7% per procedure in the most concentrated orthopedic markets.

Headlines: Anesthesia Before Age 4 May Affect IQ, Language Comprehension
Teaser: Early exposure to general anesthesia has been associated with lower IQ and language comprehension scores, although test scores remained within population norms.

Headlines: Low Vitamin D Levels Common in Painful Diabetic Neuropathy
Teaser: Results from a study of 45 people suggest that low vitamin D levels may play a role in the pathogenesis of painful diabetic peripheral neuropathy and that     vitamin D supplementation could lead to improvement.

Headlines: Bringing Doctors to Patients Who Need Them Most
Teaser: Jennifer Vargas’ path toward becoming a doctor took her from UCLA to Guadalajara before it ultimately led back home, to California’s vast Inland Empire east of Los Angeles.

Headlines: How Many Patients With MS Are Using Marijuana?
Teaser: A survey of more than 5000 patients with MS shows 16% are current marijuana users. Having progressive forms of the disease, more disability, and spasticity increases the likelihood of using the drug.

Headlines: Unprecedented Responses With Daratumumab in Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: The novel anti-CD38 agent produced 'unprecedented overall responses' in heavily pretreated multiple myeloma patients.

Headlines: Calming Dementia Patients Without Powerful Drugs
Teaser: Being attentive to the cues people give and trying to understand what is bothering them even if they can’t communicate it directly may be the alternative to sedatives for dementia patients.

Headlines: Sumatriptan Less Effective in Migraine With Aura
Teaser: A large-database analysis reveals reduced efficacy for sumatriptan in migraines with aura, but the drug still works for some.

Headlines: Novel, Powerful Tool Pinpoints Veterans at Suicide Risk
Teaser: A predictive model developed from hundreds of suicide risk factors accurately identified at-risk veterans, with findings that could point to novel suicide prevention strategies.

Headlines: Consensus Criteria for Refractory Chronic Cluster Headache
Teaser: The European Headache Federation has developed a consensus statement on what constitutes refractory chronic cluster headache.

Headlines: Many Psoriasis Patients Have Undiagnosed Arthritis
Teaser: Up to 15% of people with psoriasis have undiagnosed arthritis that's related to the skin condition, according to a new review.

Headlines: New Data on CGRP Monoclonal Antibodies for Migraine Prevention
Teaser: Phase 2 data on calcitonin gene-related peptide monoclonal antibodies show efficacy and safety as potential novel migraine preventives, but experts say larger and longer studies are needed.

Headlines: Tonsillectomy Guidelines Improve Processes but Not Outcomes
Teaser: After publication of tonsillectomy guidelines, dexamethasone use increased and antibiotic use fell among children, in line with the guidelines, but revisits within 30 days increased because of pain.

Headlines: Cannabis Harms Brain, Imaging Shows
Teaser: Heavy chronic cannabis use is associated with lower dopamine release in the associative striatum and the sensory motor striatum, according to an imaging study using a highly specific radiotracer.

Headlines: Europe Approves Nivolumab for Advanced Melanoma in First Line
Teaser: The PD-1 immune checkpoint inhibitor is also indicated for patients with previously treated advanced melanoma.

Headlines: FDA Approves ReShape Dual Balloon Device to Treat Obesity
Teaser: The pair of balloons are temporarily implanted in the stomach endoscopically and then filled with saline solution to induce satiety and aid weight loss.

Headlines: CHMP Says Yes to Ferric Citrate for CKD
Teaser: The EMA committee recommended approval of ferric citrate (Fexeric) for hyperphosphatemia in adults with chronic kidney disease on or off dialysis.

Headlines: Medical Marijuana: Where's the Evidence?
Teaser: Two new reviews highlight the lack of evidence to support the use of medical marijuana for most indications, leading to questions about the legal implications for doctors prescribing such products.

Headlines: Unicompartmental Knee Arthroplasty: A Current Review
Teaser: Get up to date on the latest developments and recent advancements in unicompartmental knee arthroplasty.

Headlines: APA, AMA Join Forces to Combat Opioid Abuse Crisis
Teaser: The American Psychiatric Association has joined forces with the American Medical Association and more than two dozen other medical organizations to address the growing epidemic of opioid abuse.

Headlines: Lidocaine Eases Pain, Improves Sex in Breast Cancer Patients
Teaser: Topical lidocaine makes intercourse more comfortable in postmenopausal breast cancer patients with severe dyspareunia.

Headlines: First US Guideline for Vertebral Osteomyelitis Released
Teaser: Persistent severe back pain may indicate vertebral osteomyelitis, a rare spine infection that must be diagnosed and treated correctly to prevent serious complications, states a new IDSA guideline.

Headlines: Ankle Injury: Simple Rule Reduces X-ray Use, Costs in Kids
Teaser: Following the Low Risk Ankle Rule in emergency departments saved almost $40 Canadian per case and reduced radiography use by 22.9%.

Headlines: Novel Drug 'Remarkable' in Tenosynovial Giant Cell Tumor
Teaser: A novel drug shows promise in the treatment of a rare tumor that attacks joints and leaves patients disabled and in pain, and is usually treated with surgery.

Headlines: ICD-10: Exact Symptom Location Becomes a Huge Deal
Teaser: One of the many challenges in ICD-10 is the intense scrutiny over very precise descriptions of symptom location. Here's what you need to be aware of.

Headlines: Early Mobilization May Be Replacing Plaster for Elbow Dislocations
Teaser: Early mobilization should be the standard of care for simple elbow dislocations, according to a multicenter team in the Netherlands.

Headlines: Pregnancy Outcome Following Prenatal Exposure to Triptans
Teaser: Are triptans safe to use in pregnant women with migraine?

Headlines: Adverse Health Effects Related to Synthetic Cannabinoid Use
Teaser: Calls to poison control centers concerning synthetic cannabinoids, which are usually sprayed onto tobacco or herbal cigarettes, showed a significant increase in early 2015. How dangerous are they?

Headlines: Utility of a Biomarker Panel for Eosinophilic Esophagitis
Teaser: How useful is a panel of serum biomarkers for the diagnosis and management of eosinophilic esophagitis?

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: Racial Differences in Opiate Administration for Pain Relief
Teaser: Does patient race influence the likelihood of receiving pain relief in the ED? This study explores the potential racial disparity in opiate administration.

Headlines: Catheter-Directed Thrombolysis for Risk Pulmonary Embolism
Teaser: Find out about a local thrombolysis regimen for the treatment of pulmonary embolism.

Headlines: The Impact of Gout Guidelines
Teaser: Primary care providers struggle with the appropriate management of gout. Are management guidelines helping?

Headlines: Current Treatment Approaches for Osteoporosis
Teaser: This new article evaluates the best treatment strategy for premenopausal women with osteoporosis.

Headlines: IOM Report on Noninvasive Neuromodulation: State of the Art
Teaser: The Institute of Medicine has released a report on a workshop focusing on regulatory, ethical, safety, and other issues surrounding the growing use of noninvasive neuromodulation devices.

Headlines: FDA Approves Sonidegib (Odomzo) for Basal Cell Carcinoma
Teaser: The drug is indicated for use in locally advanced disease

Headlines: Sufentanil Hybrid Receives CHMP Nod for Post-Op Pain
Teaser: The new product, Zalviso, is similar to another sufentanil-containing anesthetic-analgesic that has been available in the Netherlands for decades.

Headlines: Calmangafodipir May Reduce Chemo-Induced Neuropathy
Teaser: In colorectal cancer patients treated with the FOLFOX regimen, calmangafodipir reduced the incidence of chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy.

Headlines: Inhaled Cannabis Promising for Painful Diabetic Neuropathy
Teaser: A new study has shown that inhaled cannabis can blunt the pain of diabetic neuropathy without impairing cognitive function.

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: Maternal Chemical, Drug Intolerance: Risks for Autism, ADHD?
Teaser: Are chemically intolerant women at greater risk for having a child with autism spectrum disorders or ADHD?

Headlines: Treatment of Genital Lesions With Diode Laser Vaporization
Teaser: A new study examines the use of diode laser vaporization therapy as a treatment alternative for genital lesions. Is it an effective option?

Headlines: Morning Stiffness in Arthralgia and Early Arthritis
Teaser: Is morning stiffness in arthralgia and early arthritis associated with progression to arthritis and RA?

Headlines: Hepatic Tuberculosis With HIV Co-Infection
Teaser: This systematic review is examines the existing data on the epidemiology, pathophysiology, clinical features, diagnosis, and treatment of hepatic TB.

Headlines: Breast Cancer Survivors, Aromatase Inhibitors, and Joint Pain
Teaser: Can an evidence-based walking program developed for arthritis sufferers help breast cancer patients who experience joint symptoms as a side effect of aromatase inhibitor therapy?

Headlines: Sevoflurane Concentration During Intubation With Rocuronium
Teaser: What is the optimal sevoflurane concentration during intubation with rocuronium in infants?

Headlines: Expectant Management of Tubal Ectopic Pregnancies
Teaser: Can women with a tubal ectopic pregnancy be safely managed expectantly? This new study investigates.

Headlines: Demographic and Substance Use Trends Among Heroin Users
Teaser: Heroin use and overdose are on the rise in the US. This report looks at demographic and substance use, abuse, and dependence trends among heroin users over a ten year period.

Headlines: Intraoperative Management and Recovery From Anesthesia
Teaser: This anesthetic protocol may reduce adverse effects of anesthetics and reduce post-anesthesia recovery time.

Headlines: Dietary Fiber and FODMAP-Restricted Diet in IBS
Teaser: Is there sufficient evidence to recommend dietary interventions with fiber in chronic constipation and IBS, and a FODMAP-restricted diet in IBS?

Headlines: Risk Factors for Readmissions After Spine Surgery
Teaser: What are the main reasons for unplanned hospital readmissions after instrumented spine surgery?

Headlines: Productivity at Work and QoL in Patients With RA
Teaser: Which factors may influence at-work productivity and quality of life in those with rheumatoid arthritis?

Headlines: Evaluation of Cardiac Masses by RTPE
Teaser: Diagnosis of cardiac masses is still challenging by standard echocardiography. Can real-time perfusion echocardiography improve on cardiac mass characterization?

Headlines: Statin-Associated Muscle Symptoms: Impact on Statin Therapy
Teaser: Statin-associated muscle symptoms are one of the principal reasons for statin non-adherence. What's the plan when patients don't tolerate statins?

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: Epinephrine for Anaphylaxis: Underutilized and Unavailable
Teaser: Prompt epinephrine administration is vital for the treatment of anaphylactic reactions, so why aren't they more readily available in public locations?

Headlines: Ultrasound-Guided Catheterization of the Femoral Artery
Teaser: Does real-time 2D ultrasound guidance cut life-threatening vascular complications in femoral artery catheterization?

Headlines: Disparity in Patients' Medication Allergy Information
Teaser: Proper documentation of medication allergies plays a critical role in patient care; but is accurate information making it into the EHR?

Headlines: Delirium Predicts Morbidity and Mortality in Cardiac ICU Patients
Teaser: Just how taxing is delirium in cardiac intensive care?

Headlines: The Role of Fear of Pain in Headache
Teaser: Does fear of pain differ between migraine sufferers and those with tension headache? What role does it play in headache-related disability?

Headlines: Illicit Use of 'Bath Salts' in Teens Much Lower Than Expected
Teaser: A survey of high school seniors has found that just a small minority report using bath salts, but the researchers caution more might be using the psychoactive recreational drug without knowing it.

Headlines: Psychedelic Drugs Redux: Don't Leapfrog the Research
Teaser: Research trials of psychedelic drugs were truncated by the politics of the 1960s. Dr Lieberman explains why we need to begin studying them again, before public opinion gets ahead of what we know.

Headlines: Employment: Is Security Really Worth It?
Teaser: Employment brings many benefits but also many downsides. Do doctors think employment is worth it?

Headlines: Biologic Treatments for OA: A Sports Medicine Perspective
Teaser: Studies show that several biologic treatments can prevent degenerative arthritis or its progression and allow many seniors to remain active late in life. An expert reviews the state of the research.

Headlines: Opioid Use, Misuse, and Abuse in Chronic Pain
Teaser: Some physicians say, 'Opioids have an important role.' Others ask, 'How did we get into this mess?'

Headlines: Malcolm Gladwell on Fixing the US Healthcare Mess
Teaser: Eric Topol talks with New Yorker columnist and best-selling author Malcolm Gladwell on how best to tell the story of medicine.

Headlines: Benefits of New Shingles Vaccine May Extend to More Patients
Teaser: Phase 3 study results indicate that the HZ/su vaccine potentially offers more robust protection to the elderly and the immunocompromised than the existing vaccine.

Headlines: Is Medicine Driving Doctors to Drink?
Teaser: Why is it that the rate of substance abuse among physicians is no worse--but also no better--than it is among the general population? Your colleagues offer their theories.

Headlines: Are Foam Rollers for Muscle Massage Really Beneficial?
Teaser: Self-myofascial release, a type of self-administered massage, is said to soothe muscle soreness, increase range of motion, and improve athletic performance, but does it withstand scientific scrutiny?

Headlines: Beans, Greens, and the Best Foods for the Brain
Teaser: The latest research on how diet can influence mental health.

Headlines: Multinational Association of Supportive Care in Cancer (MASCC) Annual Meeting
Teaser: Read clinically focused news coverage of key developments from MASCC 2015.

Headlines: GI Practice Updates for Primary Care Providers
Teaser: Dr David Johnson makes a plea for primary care providers to team up with gastroenterologists in the prevention and management of common GI disorders.

Headlines: Whole-Body MRI in Psoriatic Arthritis and Spondyloarthritis
Teaser: Should whole body MRI be used to assess peripheral and axial joints in PsA and SpA?

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: Management of Marijuana Intoxication in the ED
Teaser: This case highlights the medical and psychiatric complications associated with the toxic ingestion of cannabis and the best ways to manage these patients in an ED setting.

Headlines: Takotsubo Cardiomyopathy: Healing a Broken Heart
Teaser: Not all medical problems are easy to diagnose, and it can be especially tricky when similar symptoms occur in different diseases.

Headlines: Enhanced Surveillance of Hepatitis B
Teaser: Have clinicians taken new and innovative approaches to hepatitis B surveillance in the last decade?

Headlines: Smoking a Cause of Psychosis?
Teaser: A meta-analysis shows high rates of smoking at first onset of psychosis and earlier onset among smokers, prompting authors to suggest a role of smoking that extends beyond the self-medication hypothesis.

Headlines: Migraine's Premonitory Phase: What Can We Learn From It?
Teaser: This study used functional neuroimaging to elucidate the mechanisms behind the premonitory symptoms of migraine, such as nausea, photophobia, and emotional changes.

Headlines: Rural Definition of Health: A Systematic Literature Review
Teaser: As providers increasingly focus on patient-centered care, it becomes crucial to understand how rural populations attitudes towards health and healthcare differ from their urban counterparts.

Headlines: Effectiveness of Intra-Articular SBCG Injections for Knee OA
Teaser: Is this intervention a safe and effective option for the treatment of knee osteoarthritis?

Headlines: Ketamine Use for Acute Agitation in the ED
Teaser: Is this anesthetic drug a safe and useful option for calming acutely agitated patients in an ED setting?

Headlines: Educating Nurses on Sexual Health in Breast Cancer
Teaser: Do you know how to address the common sexual side effects in patients with breast cancer?

Headlines: Deep Brain Stimulation for Psychiatric Disorders
Teaser: Read about the growing body of evidence demonstrating the value of deep brain stimulation for psychiatric disorders, including major depression, PTSD, eating disorders, OCD, and addiction.

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: Opioid Education and Nasal Naloxone Rescue Kits in the ED
Teaser: An ED-based overdose educational program could play a promising role in preventing opioid-related deaths.

Headlines: Obesity-Induced Osteoarthritis
Teaser: This review discusses the link between obesity and osteoarthritis.

Headlines: Phone-Based Aftercare Coordination in Mood Disorders
Teaser: Can case management-based coordination by phone bridge the gap between inpatient treatment and aftercare in recently discharged patients with depressive and anxiety disorders?

Headlines: Fecal Calprotectin vs FIT for Mucosal Healing
Teaser: Compare the predictive ability of these two fecal markers for mucosal healing in ulcerative colitis.

Headlines: Duty to Relieve Spiritual Suffering? What Do Physicians Think?
Teaser: Physicians are asked whether they believe they have a responsibility to relieve not only physical pain but spiritual or existential suffering as well.

Headlines: Irritable Bowel Syndrome in Children and Adolescents
Teaser: This overview of IBS highlights available pharmacological management strategies for children and adolescents. What role can the pharmacist play in educating families and providing resources?

Headlines: Women With MCI Decline Twice as Fast as Men
Teaser: Women with mild cognitive impairment decline twice as fast as men with MCI, and also have a much higher risk for cognitive problems after surgery and general anesthesia.

Headlines: Opioid Substitution Saves Lives of HIV-Positive Drug Users
Teaser: In British Columbia, opioid agonist therapy dramatically reduced both HIV- and drug-related mortality in HIV-positive injection drug users.

Headlines: New Syndrome Links Anxiety and Physical Disorders
Teaser: Anxiety disorder may be linked to a series of physical conditions that represent a novel syndrome that may have previously been missed.

Headlines: Hand-Foot Syndrome Prevention With Atorvastatin, Polyprenol
Teaser: Breast cancer patients receiving capecitabine had a lower incidence of hand-foot syndrome after prophylactic treatment with atorvastatin and polyprenol.

Headlines: Gaza Children ‘Emotionally Shattered’ One Year After Conflict
Teaser: The majority of children living in areas of Gaza hardest-hit during last year's conflict are showing signs of severe emotional distress and trauma, including frequent bed wetting and nightmares, a global children's charity said on Monday.

Headlines: Opioid Overdose Prevention: Providing Naloxone to Laypersons
Teaser: Many community-based programs have offered opioid overdose training and naloxone kits to laypersons who might witness an opioid overdose. How well are these programs working?

Headlines: Unnecessary Overuse of Medical Care Causes Waste and Harm
Teaser: Is 'more' always better? The old adage of 'might help, can't hurt,' is now understood not only to be wrong, but costly.

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: Reducing Pediatric Radiation With Point-of-Care Guidelines
Teaser: This study demonstrated how decision support, in the form of estimated radiation exposure coupled with imaging guidelines, could influence family physician selection of pediatric imaging.

Headlines: Effects of Parecoxib Following Open Prostatectomy
Teaser: Does parecoxib improve postoperative analgesia without increasing surgical blood loss following radical open prostatectomy?

Headlines: Treatment of Hip/knee Osteoarthritis in General Practice
Teaser: This Dutch study examined the treatment of hip and knee osteoarthritis in primary care as well as by physical therapists. Are current guidelines being followed?

Headlines: Hypercapnic Acidosis and Ventilation-Induced Lung Injury
Teaser: Hypercapnic acidosis may protect against ventilator-induced lung injury. How much CO2 is optimal?

Headlines: Honey: A Biologic Wound Dressing
Teaser: Find out more about the bioactivity of honey and it's uses for wound management.

Headlines: Perioperative Care and Phalloplasty in Female-to-Male Patients
Teaser: Phalloplasty, or creation of the penis, is one of the steps in gender confirming surgery for a female-to-male patient and for males with absence or malformation of the penis.

Headlines: Smartphone Applications for Melanoma Detection
Teaser: What smartphone apps are currently available to aid in the detection of melanoma by the general public and clinicians? How useful are they?

Headlines: Antimalarial Drugs Alone May Still Have a Role in RA
Teaser: Which rheumatoid arthritis patients might succeed on antimalarial treatment alone?

Headlines: Safety and Efficacy of Milk and Molasses Enemas in the ED
Teaser: A milk and molasses enema may be an efficient means of relieving constipation, but how safe is it?

Headlines: Fast-Track Esophagectomy Protocol for Esophageal Cancer
Teaser: Fast-track surgery protocols can be cost-effective while producing positive outcomes. How does this fast-track esophagectomy protocol measure up?

Headlines: Cyberbullying: A 21st Century Health Care Phenomenon
Teaser: Gain insight into the phenomena of traditional bullying and cyberbullying in adolescents.

Headlines: The Enterovirus D68 Outbreak: A Public Health Concern
Teaser: How much do you know about the recent outbreak of enterovirus D68? In this review, learn the important role of pharmacists in promoting opportunities to prevent and limit the spread of this infection.

Headlines: Stress Disorders in Survivors of Severe Sepsis
Teaser: Just how long does it take to shake off the stress of a critical illness?

Headlines: Patterns of Technology Use Among Older Adults
Teaser: The potential of the internet and mobile phones for health education, health monitoring, and support is well-established. But are older adults technologically proficient enough to use them?

Source: Journal of Hospice and Palliative Nursing
Headlines: Family Perceptions of Interventions During End-of-Life Care
Teaser: What kind of support do family members and friends think they need when a loved one is dying?

Headlines: The Increasing Burden and Complexity of Multimorbidity
Teaser: Just how prevalent is multimorbidity? This study estimated the population-based prevalence and trends of multimorbidity across all age groups in a Canadian province.

Headlines: Adult Kawasaki Disease in a European Patient
Teaser: While Kawasaki disease is usually diagnosed in Asian children, this case demonstrates it should be considered in cases of prolonged fever without response to antibiotics, even in non-Asian adults.

Headlines: NP Pioneers--Celebrating 50 Years of Role Development
Teaser: Read reflections of nurse practitioner pioneers who were intimately involved with developing the NP role.

Headlines: Spinal Cord Stimulation Benefit Ongoing in Diabetic Neuropathy
Teaser: Most patients treated with spinal cord stimulation (SCS) because of painful diabetic peripheral neuropathy maintain effective pain relief in the long term, according to Dutch researchers.

Headlines: One-Sport Focus Puts Young Athletes at Higher Risk for Injury
Teaser: Although some sports specialization may be required to develop elite skills, intense training in a single sport should usually be delayed until late adolescence to limit the risk for overuse injury.

Headlines: 'Alarming' New Stats on US Heroin Epidemic
Teaser: Heroin use has increased 63% across the US, with the biggest jump in groups with historically lower rates of use, prompting calls for a widespread societal response.

Headlines: Achievements (Some Dubious) in Medicine: The Past 20 Years
Teaser: To commemorate Medscape's anniversary, Dr Lundberg lists his picks for the top 15 happenings in medicine in the past 20 years.

Headlines: Oncologist Asks for Your Second Opinion
Teaser: Dr Kathy Miller asks what you would do in a second-opinion workup to determine whether a breast cancer patient needs a change in management, and to compare it with the workup she actually received.

Headlines: Medical Licensing: Piles of Paperwork and Much-Needed Reform
Teaser: Dr Andrew Wilner discusses the bureaucracy involved in medical credentialing and how -- hopefully -- paperwork reform lies ahead.

Headlines: HIV Guidelines: Working With the Active Substance User
Teaser: In light of an HIV outbreak among drug users in Indiana, the NYSDOH AIDS Institute HIV Clinical Guidelines Program provides guidelines and commentary on treating HIV-positive active substance users.

Headlines: Central Lumbar Spinal Stenosis: Do Epidural Steroids Help?
Teaser: The benefits of epidural steroids for patients with central lumbar spinal stenosis are small at best, an expert asserts. Yet their use in Medicare patients has grown nearly 300% over a 7-year period.

Headlines: Heroin: The Epidemic That Knows No Boundaries
Teaser: CDC director Tom Frieden reports that heroin is cheap, potent, and available, all of the prerequisites for a widespread epidemic of abuse.

Headlines: Tech-Assisted Pain Self-management: Which Modality Works Best?
Teaser: Three self-management modalities for chronic noncancer, nonheadache pain are compared. What's the verdict?

Headlines: Trauma Flagged as Trigger for Arthritis in Psoriasis Patients
Teaser: In patients with psoriasis, trauma, in particular bone and joint trauma, has been identified as a robust risk factor for the development of psoriatic arthritis.

Headlines: PCI Without Surgery On Site: Let Them Eat Cake
Teaser: Dr Melissa Walton-Shirley offers a sad reminiscence about a patient with MI who failed lytic therapy and, because of bad weather and state restrictions at that time, had no other options.

Headlines: Pinaverium Effectively Treats IBS Symptoms in RCT
Teaser: Patients with irritable bowel syndrome who took pinaverium had significant improvement in abdominal pain and stool consistency compared with patients who took placebo in the double-blind trial.

Headlines: Quiz: Diabetic Neuropathy
Teaser: Test your knowledge of this common complication of diabetes.

Headlines: A Better Bedside Manner Can and Should Be Taught
Teaser: Dr Vaishnava sees better interpersonal skills and humanism as the key to improving patient satisfaction.

Headlines: Rethinking the Cath-Lab Reflex in Patients With ACS
Teaser: Dr John Mandrola suggests that the 10-year results from RITA-3 should make cardiologists stop to think before rushing a patient to the cath lab and revascularization procedures.

Headlines: The Efficacy of Infliximab for Sarcoidosis
Teaser: In patients with severe sarcoidosis who do not respond to conventional therapies, could this anti-TNF agent provide symptom relief?

Headlines: The Optimal Nerve Block for Knee Replacement Surgery
Teaser: Dr Macario reviews the results of a study comparing adductor canal vs continuous femoral nerve blocks in patients undergoing knee arthroplasty.

Headlines: Learning the Craft: 'Medicine Is Not Just a Job'
Teaser: A young doctor reflects on his choice to go into medicine.

Headlines: When a Clinical Guideline Is Problematic
Teaser: Should an evidence-based guideline be considered the standard for patient care? It depends on the evidence quality. Consider the American Academy of Orthopaedic Surgeons' 2008 guideline for knee OA.

Headlines: Midurethral Sling Helpful for Stress Urinary Incontinence
Teaser: Midurethral sling operations for stress urinary incontinence in women have a good safety proﬁle and are highly effective in the short and medium term, with increasing evidence for long-term efficacy.

Headlines: Diet in Women With and Without Severe Headache or Migraine
Teaser: What role, if any, does diet play in migraine? This study examined dietary intake patterns and diet quality of migraine sufferers to better elucidate the relationship.

Headlines: FDA Reviewing Safety of Codeine for Cough in Kids Under 18
Teaser: The FDA is investigating the safety of using codeine-containing medicines to treat coughs and colds in children younger than 18 years because of the potential for serious adverse effects.

Headlines: How Work Restriction Letters Can Harm Pregnant Patients
Teaser: A poorly written or poorly timed note from a provider can jeopardize a patient's job and salary. Requesting a ban on lifting, for example, is likely not necessary and could introduce conflict.

Headlines: CBT Effective for Comorbid Insomnia
Teaser: New research provides further evidence supporting cognitive-behavior therapy for insomnia when difficulty sleeping occurs with another medical or psychiatric condition.

Headlines: Anti-NGF Therapy for Cancer Pain: More Research Needed
Teaser: Terminally ill cancer patients receiving fulranumab show a high responder rate and improved BPI-SF scores, despite the lack of significant improvement in pain.

Headlines: Stem Cells Show Promise as Type 2 Diabetes Treatment
Teaser: Mesenchymal precursor cells, which have anti-inflammatory properties, appeared safe and showed glucose-lowering efficacy in a small pilot study.

Headlines: California, Oregon to Allow OTC Hormonal Contraceptives
Teaser: California and Oregon will be the first states in the nation to allow women to get birth control pills and other hormonal contraceptives directly from their pharmacists – without a doctor’s prescription.

Headlines: FDA Approves First-of-Kind Leg Prosthesis
Teaser: This is the first prosthesis for above-the-knee amputations that does not rely on a conventional socket fitting over the stump of a patient's leg.

Headlines: Low-Level Laser Therapy Ameliorates Radiation Dermatitis
Teaser: Patients with breast cancer who develop radiation dermatitis after radiotherapy reported high ratings of patient satisfaction and stable skin toxicity following  low-level laser therapy.

Headlines: Antidepressant/NSAID Combo Linked to Brain Bleed Risk
Teaser: The GI bleeding risks associated with NSAIDS and antidepressants are well documented, but a new study is the first to show the drugs also increase the risk for intracranial hemorrhage.

Headlines: Guidelines Updated on Care for Women With Genital Mutilation
Teaser: Physicians treating women with FGM in the UK need to address both its physical and psychological effects, especially in pregnancy, and need to ensure they fully understand the law relating to FGM.

Headlines: Physician Who Gave Unneeded Chemo Gets 45 Years in Prison
Teaser: Farid Fata, MD, 'practiced greed and shut down whatever compassion he had,' said US District Judge Paul Borman, who called the oncologist's crimes 'horrific.'

Headlines: Communication Lacking in Chronic Migraine Encounters
Teaser: A study of recorded neurologist-patient conversations suggests that questions aren't being asked in a way to elicit responses that would lead to accurate diagnosis and appropriate treatment.

Headlines: FDA Strengthens NSAID Warning for Heart, Stroke Risks
Teaser: The stronger warning follows a comprehensive review of new safety information by the FDA.

Headlines: Topical NSAIDs Show No Visual Benefit After Cataract Surgery
Teaser: Topical NSAIDS plus or minus concomitant corticosteroid drops do not affect long-term visual outcomes after cataract surgery; the decision to use these drops should be discussed with the patient.

Headlines: Safety Profile of HPV Vaccines Under Review in Europe
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency is reviewing the safety profile of human papilloma virus vaccines but says there should be no change in their use at this time.

Headlines: Hydroxychloroquine Not Effective in Hand Osteoarthritis
Teaser: For patients with symptomatic osteoarthritis of the hand, pain and functional outcomes were no different whether they were treated with hydroxychloroquine or placebo for 24 weeks.

Headlines: Questions Surround Death of Controversial Autism Physician
Teaser: Dr Jeff Bradstreet was labeled a saviour by some and a risk to others for his fringe beliefs and treatments.

Headlines: ICD Recruited for Paddle-Free AF Cardioversion in Small Study
Teaser: "This method is less time-consuming and does not necessitate deep anesthesia compared with external   cardioversion," says the lead author. But advantages     over the standard method remain hypothetical.

Headlines: Denosumab-Related Osseous Sclerosis in Metastatic SCLC
Teaser: This case highlights the need for radiologists to be aware of a potential adverse effect of denosumab, a novel osteoclast inhibitor increasingly being used in patients with metastatic cancers.

Headlines: Morbidity and Mortality After Vertebral Fractures
Teaser: How do the risks of morbidity and mortality compare in vertebral compression fracture patients who received surgical treatment versus those who have been nonsurgically managed?

Headlines: Incomplete Mucosal Recovery in Celiac Disease
Teaser: Is biopsy the most effective way for clinicians to determine mucosal recovery in celiac disease, and does timing matter?

Headlines: Triptans in the Acute Treatment of Migraine
Teaser: This meta-analysis examined the evidence for the efficacy, effectiveness, and safety of various triptans for acute treatment of migraines. How did they compare with other migraine-relief options?

Source: Medicine and Science in Sports and Exercise
Headlines: Injected Placebo Effects on Endurance Running Performance
Teaser: How does an injected placebo compare with the athletic performance enhancer r-HuEpo in terms of endurance performance? This study examines the placebo effects in endurance trained runners.

Headlines: Fatigue Severity and Depression in Older Patients With Cancer
Teaser: What clues does fatigue provide in older adults with cancer?

Source: Current Opinion in Allergy and Clinical Immunology
Headlines: A 'Difficult' Insect Allergy Patient
Teaser: Patients with a history of allergic reaction to stinging insects yet negative venom testing can present a diagnostic challenge.

Headlines: Hand Dermatitis: Clinical Features, Prevention and Treatment
Teaser: Hand dermatitis is a common problem, especially prevalent in occupations such as hairdressers, cleaners, healthcare workers, and others. Read about its etiology and current therapies in this review.

Headlines: Signs and Symptoms Associated With Primary Tooth Eruption
Teaser: Does teething have a direct relationship to systemic symptoms? And what non-pharmacological approaches are effective in relieving teething symptoms?

Headlines: Adverse Reaction to Benzylpenicillin Due to Soy Allergy
Teaser: While a penicillin allergy was initially suspected in this young child with an itching papular rash at the site of an injection, the cause turned out to be a common, but often hidden ingredient.

Headlines: More US Babies Born With Drug Withdrawal Symptoms
Teaser: Along with recent increases in prescription opioid abuse has come a significant increase in U.S. babies born with neonatal abstinence syndrome, according to a new study.

Headlines: Current Considerations in the Treatment of Glaucoma
Teaser: Review the current options for treatment of glaucoma, and when each is most appropriate, in this comprehensive overview.

Headlines: Transcutaneous Stimulation Helps Paralyzed Men Move Legs

Headlines: Dismissing the Noncompliant: Is This What We've Come To?
Teaser: When noncompliant patients become a liability to individual providers is it acceptable to dismiss them?

Headlines: Web-Based Self-Management for Intermittent Catheter Users
Teaser: A new Web-based self-management intervention was developed for persons with spinal cord injury who use intermittent urinary catheters.

Headlines: Aflibercept in Wet AMD Beyond the First Year of Treatment
Teaser: Get up-to-date with the most recent expert recommendations for aflibercept therapy in wet AMD after one year.

Headlines: Cost-Effectiveness of Abatacept, Rituximab, and TNFi in RA
Teaser: When TNFi therapy is failing, which biologic agent is most effective and cost-effective for rheumatoid arthritis patients?

Headlines: Prolonged Use of Piperacillin-Tazobactam in Children
Teaser: Is it safe to treat children with a prolonged course of piperacillin-tazobactam?

Headlines: Antidepressants and the Risk of Stroke Recurrence
Teaser: Antidepressants are often used to treat depression following stroke, but they may significantly increase stroke recurrence--especially in specific subgroups.

Headlines: A Proposed New Paradigm for Managing Crohn's Disease
Teaser: What is the "treat to target" therapeutic strategy in Crohn's disease, and how could it contribute to an improvement in long-term outcomes in patients with the disease?

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: LVADs: A Rapidly Evolving Alternative to Transplant
Teaser: Left ventricular assist devices are becoming an increasingly prevalent therapy for patients with Stage D heart failure with reduced ejection fraction.

Headlines: The Effects of PPIs on Patient-reported Severity of Dyspepsia
Teaser: Do proton pump inhibitors reduce gastrointestinal clinical events in patients with dyspepsia?

Headlines: Herpes Zoster-Associated Mortality in Europe
Teaser: Is herpes zoster infection significantly associated with mortality in the elderly?

Headlines: Calciphylaxis: Risk Factors, Diagnosis, and Treatment
Teaser: High-quality evidence for the diagnosis and management of calciphylaxis is lacking. How should a multidisciplinary team go about treating patients with this disease?

Headlines: Surgical Wound Closure in Orthopaedic Surgery
Teaser: This article discusses various wound closure strategies to optimize wound healing after orthopaedic surgical procedures.

Headlines: Schizotypy and Etiology of Schizophrenia Spectrum Disorders
Teaser: How does the construct of schizotypy inform our understanding of schizophrenia? This review examines commonality and differences of causal factors for schizotypy and schizophrenia spectrum disorders.

Headlines: Symptoms Before Sudden Arrhythmic Death Syndrome

Teaser: Can the oral substrate reduction agent miglustat be used successfully as maintenance therapy for Gaucher disease type 1 after initial enzyme replacement therapy?

Headlines: Adolescent Smoker's Sources of Smoking Cessation Support
Teaser: There are numerous support measures available for smoking cessation, but are young smokers taking advantage of them?

Headlines: Clinical Response to Low FODMAP Diet in Children With IBS
Teaser: Can a low FODMAP diet work as well for children with IBS as it does for adults?

Headlines: Epidural/General Anesthesia During Major Abdominal Surgery
Teaser: Is the combination of general and epidural anesthesia safe and effective in patients with increased intracranial pressure undergoing elective abdominal surgery?

Headlines: Red Flags in Pregnant Women With Headache
Teaser: A new study points to clues indicating underlying diagnoses in pregnant women presenting with severe headache.

Headlines: e-Prescribing Controlled Substances Now Legal Nationwide
Teaser: Vermont is the last state to allow clinicians to electronically send scripts for all controlled substances, including common painkillers, to the pharmacy.

Headlines: DPP-4 Inhibitors Can Cause Severe Joint Pain, FDA Says
Teaser: However, the pain associated with dipeptidyl peptidase-4 inhibitors for type 2 diabetes goes away once patients stop taking the medicine, according to the agency.

Headlines: Reduced Access to Meds After Crackdown on Illegal Rx Drug Trade
Teaser: An unintended side effect of a crackdown on prescription drug abuse affects chronic pain patients’ access to medication.

Teaser: Clinicians should consider human plague in any patient with compatible symptoms and risk factors, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

Headlines: Ibandronate Similar to Radiation for Prostate Cancer Bone Pain
Teaser: Customers reported discovering a black particle that caused superficial eye injury, pain, swelling, and blurred vision.

Headlines: Allergan Recalls Contaminated Eye Ointments
Teaser: Intensive physical and behavioral therapy for up to 6 hours a day, much more than in other pain programs, was key to treating fibromyalgia in teenaged children.

Headlines: Juvenile Fibromyalgia: Intensive Therapy Relieves Pain
Teaser: Awareness of radiation exposure and advances in modalities such as MRI and ultrasound may be behind the shift. Change may affect children's lifetime cancer risk.

Headlines: Fewer CTs, More MRI and Ultrasounds for Kids
Teaser: One third of contact lens wearers in a national survey sought care for preventable eye problems.

Headlines: Contact Lens Wearers Engage in Risky Eye Care Behavior
Teaser: Florida's legislative efforts to reduce abuse and diversion of prescription opioids have led to modest declines in opioid prescribing and use, a new study finds.

Headlines: Drug Monitoring, 'Pill Mill' Laws Reduce Opioid Scrips
Teaser: The new drug is approved for patients with locally advanced basal cell carcinoma who are not amenable to curative therapy or radiation.

Headlines: Sonidegib (Odomzo) Approved for Basal Cell Carcinoma in EU
Teaser: As hospitals chase better patient ratings and health outcomes, an increasing number are rethinking how they function at night — in some cases reducing nighttime check-ins or trying to better coordinate medicines — so that more patients can sleep relatively uninterrupted.

Headlines: Marijuana and the Brain: More Research, More Questions
Teaser: New research finds no marked effect of cannabis use on brain volume, but turns up structural differences in young men at high genetic risk for schizophrenia who use the drug.

Headlines: Thousands of Ebola Survivors Face Pain, Possible Blindness

Headlines: Blood Pressure Drug May Help Prevent Opioid Relapse
Teaser: A drug used to treat hypertension appears to be an effective adjunctive therapy in reducing relapse in opioid-dependent patients.

Headlines: Cincinnati Hospitals Test Mothers, Newborns for Drugs
Teaser: Bubbly and athletic, Heather Padgett, raised in a loving family in the Cincinnati suburbs, would not fit the stereotype of a heroin addict.

Headlines: Chemotherapeutic Treatment of Colorectal Cancer in Pregnancy
Teaser: While colon cancer during pregnancy presents many challenges, this case demonstrates that chemotherapy be successfully used without harm to the fetus.

Headlines: A Seemingly Healthy Girl With a Vesicular Rash
Teaser: An emergency department clinician diagnosed poison ivy. What do you think has caused this rash?

Headlines: New Post-op Pain Management Technique Cuts Need for Opioids
Teaser: Patients undergoing orthopedic procedures often have a lot of pain, but a new technique for managing postoperative pain can greatly reduce narcotic consumption, with greater patient satisfaction.

Headlines: Whose End of Life Is It, Anyway?

Headlines: Palliative Care: A Primer for Oncologists
Teaser: 'You cannot be an oncologist and not do primary palliative care,' says Dr Jennifer Temel, who advises clinicians on delivering tough messages and when to seek help from palliative care specialists.

Headlines: Is Topical OTC Capsaicin Effective for Osteoarthritis?
Teaser: What is the evidence for using OTC capsaicin for osteoarthritis pain?

Headlines: Treating Co-occurring Substance Abuse and Mood Disorders
Teaser: Stephen Strakowski discusses the common co-occurrence of mood and substance use disorders, emphasizing the need to recognize the links in assessment, treatment, and follow-up.

Headlines: Symptoms Linger, Palliative Care Is Rare After HF Discharge
Teaser: Clinicians may be ill-prepared to treat pain, anxiety, and depression in their patients with heart failure, whose recovery "continues well after hospital discharge," researchers say.

Headlines: Sex for Opioids: A Hidden Epidemic
Teaser: 'Alarming' survey results show opioid users are often victims of sexual violence.

Headlines: Music Improves Some Postoperative Outcomes
Teaser: Listening to music before, during, or immediately after surgery was linked to reduced pain, anxiety, and analgesia needs in a UK study.

Headlines: Irritable Bowel Syndrome: Little Evidence for FODMAP Diet
Teaser: A review has found evidence to be lacking for a diet low in fermentable oligosaccharides, disaccharides, monosaccharides and polyols (FODMAPs) for irritable bowel syndrome.

Headlines: FDA Okays OxyContin for Some Pediatric Patients

Headlines: Knee Replacement May 'Turn Back the Clock' for Arthritis Pain

Headlines: FDA Endorses Flow Restrictors on Kids' Liquid Acetaminophen
Teaser: In a "guidance to industry" document, the FDA encourages adoption of safety devices on pediatric liquid acetaminophen to reduce dosing errors that may lead to liver damage.

Headlines: Pain a Common Problem in America
Teaser: Over 25 million Americans experience daily pain, a new survey has found.

Headlines: Fitness Experts Warn of the Pitfalls of Going to Exercise Extremes
Teaser: With challenging workouts from ultra-marathons to endurance events on obstacle courses all the rage, fitness experts say more and more weekend warriors are leaping into extreme activities before looking into the perils of overdoing it.

Headlines: Botulinum Toxin Helpful in Painful Cutaneous Leiomyomas
Teaser: Botulinum toxin A may improve skin-related quality of life in patients with cutaneous leiomyomas, according to Maryland-based researchers.

Headlines: Teen Marijuana Use Not Harmful?
Teaser: In stark contrast to previous research, a new study suggests teen marijuana use is not associated with later development of physical or mental health issues.

Headlines: Ankylosing Spondylitis Linked to Cardiovascular Mortality
Teaser: Patients with ankylosing spondylitis had a 60% higher risk for cerebrovascular mortality and a 35% higher risk for cardiovascular mortality than non-AS comparators.

Headlines: Adherence to Hunger Training Using Blood Glucose Monitoring
Teaser: Hunger training' shows promise as an effective strategy for weight loss, but are participants able to stick to this rigorous method?

Headlines: Small Lymphocytic Lymphoma With Perniosis-like Features
Teaser: This case study presents an unusual dermatological manifestation of a low-grade B-cell lymphoma.

Headlines: Surgeon Experience and Complications in Scoliosis Surgery
Teaser: A new study examines whether a surgeon's experience level impacts the rate of complications in adult spinal deformity surgery.

Headlines: Spinal Ependymomas. Part 1: Intramedullary Ependymomas
Teaser: This study presents an analysis of risk factors for surgical morbidity and data on long-term results for intramedullary ependymomas.

Headlines: Aspirin for Prevention of Recurrent Atherosclerotic CVD
Teaser: The effectiveness of aspirin therapy in reducing risk of future events among persons with preexisting atherosclerotic CVD is well established. What's the prevalence of aspirin usage in this group?

Headlines: Socio-economic Status and Chronic Kidney Disease Prevalence
Teaser: What factors account for variation in chronic kidney disease prevalence in primary care?

Headlines: Disagreement on Illnesses Between Older Patients and GPs
Teaser: Do what extent do physicians and their patients agree regarding the patients' illnesses? This study analyzed barriers to successful communication between multimorbid, older patients and their GPs.

Headlines: Detectable Symptomatology and Risk of Pancreatic Cancer
Teaser: Can a statistical model incorporating both risk factors and prediagnosis symptomatology improve prediction of pancreatic cancer enough to provide practical estimates of risk?

Headlines: Treating Cancer Patients: 'Letting It Hurt the Proper Amount'
Teaser: A hematology-oncology fellow reflects on the difficulty of finding the right amount of empathy when treating cancer patients.

Headlines: Overdiagnosis in Thyroid Cancer: The Case for Observation
Teaser: Thyroid cancer expert R. Michael Tuttle, MD, describes the problem of overdiagnosis in thyroid cancer and the trend toward observing small thyroid nodules.

Headlines: Sex After Cancer: The Unaddressed Issue
Teaser: Sex is not a regular topic between oncologist and patient. But Dr Don Dizon says it should be, given that a large majority of cancer patients and survivors have issues of sexual function.

Headlines: The HIV/HCV Outbreak in Indiana
Teaser: An Indiana outbreak of HIV/HCV coinfection serves as a cautionary tale to other regions of the United States.

Headlines: Opioids in Pregnancy: What Raises Risk for Neonatal Abstinence?
Teaser: Pregnancy and opioids don't mix--the result is neonatal abstinence. But does anything elevate the risk even more?

Headlines: Age-Related Macular Degeneration
Teaser: Learn about the different forms of age-related macular degeneration, preventive strategies, and lastest therapeutic options in this overview.

Headlines: Unruly Teenagers Deserve Organ Transplants Too
Teaser: Bioethicist Art Caplan argues that doctors shouldn't try to separate the saints from the sinners on transplant waiting lists.

Headlines: A 6-Year-Old Girl's Eye Is Partially Swollen Shut
Teaser: A patient reports with orbital edema, ecchymosis, and pain when moving her eye, but limited secondary symptoms. Will CT analysis provide the answer to her diagnosis?

Headlines: Practice Changers: Updates in Family Medicine: 2015
Teaser: Family physician Frank J. Domino presents a whirlwind tour of family medicine news gleaned from recent medical literature.

Headlines: ICD-10: Three New Coding Challenges
Teaser: When it takes effect in October, ICD-10 may make it more complicated to code for injuries, with new 'seventh character extender' codes on the way, among other changes.

Headlines: A Proximal Ascending Colon Lesion of a Crohn Disease Patient
Teaser: A 42-year-old patient loses his insurance and access to medication. When he returns 3 years later with worsening symptoms, a colonoscopy uncovers a lesion, but the diagnosis isn't so clear.

Headlines: 50 Shades of Malpractice
Teaser: Malpractice cases range from crazy to shocking to sad to frustrating. Here are some of the most notorious cases from each of our 50 states.

Headlines: Bamboozled by Insurance Companies: Are Patients at Risk?
Teaser: An insurance company policy that may prevent patients from getting appropriate care.

Headlines: Zolpidem and Sleep in Pediatric Burn Patients With ADD/HD
Teaser: Find out if zolpidem is an effective drug for managing sleep in pediatric burn patients with and without ADHD?

Headlines: Docetaxel in Prostate Cancer -- The Pendulum Swings Back
Teaser: Upfront use of docetaxel for prostate cancer has waxed and waned over the years, but recent studies have brought the agent back to the forefront.

Headlines: How Common Is CIDP Misdiagnosis?
Teaser: Dr Barclay reviews the results of a study exploring the diagnostic pitfalls of chronic inflammatory demyelinating polyneuropathy.

Headlines: Do Physician Health Programs Increase Physician Suicides?
Teaser: Physician stress, depression, and suicide: Are physician health programs part of the problem or a solution?

Headlines: What's Causing a Boy's Fever, Pain and Rash?
Teaser: A boy returns from a Cub Scout outing with a fever, pain, and a rash. What’s the most likely diagnosis?

Headlines: Sedative Hypnotic Use and the Risk of Motor Vehicle Crash
Teaser: Sedative hypnotic medications, commonly prescribed for treatment of insomnia, have been implicated as a contributing factor in motor vehicle accidents. How great is the risk?

Headlines: OTC Analgesia: It Matters Now More Than Ever
Teaser: Over-the-counter analgesics are incredibly popular but can also promote significant harm when used improperly.

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Elder Abuse: Systematic Review and Implications for Practice
Teaser: This review highlights the epidemiology of elder abuse in terms of its prevalence, risk factors, and consequences. What are the implications for researchers, health professionals, and policy-makers?

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: Clinical Decisions Made Before and After Choosing Wisely
Teaser: Are primary care physicians adhering to the Choosing Wisely campaign's recommendations?

Headlines: Why So Many Doctors Lack Self-confidence, and How to Get It Back
Teaser: A family physician who holds physician retreats explains why many doctors lose confidence and what steps they can take to feel better about their abilities.

Headlines: Spinal Deformity Patients Recall Less Than Half of the Risks
Teaser: Of adult patients undergoing spinal deformity surgery, less than half were able to recall preoperative discussion of outcomes and potential complications.

Teaser: Can fish oil supplementation improve the antioxidant status of women undergoing chemotherapy for breast cancer, potentially ameliorating some side effects?

Headlines: The PCP and the Cancer Patient: Managing Sexual Health
Teaser: Primary care physicians can play an important role in addressing treatment-related sexual problems for cancer survivors.

Headlines: Knowledge and Attitudes Regarding Antibiotic Use
Teaser: Do Hispanic consumers differ from non-Hispanic consumers in their knowledge and attitudes regarding antibiotic use?

Source: Journal of Hospice and Palliative Nursing
Headlines: Symptom Management in the Adult Outpatient Setting
Teaser: Find out what symptoms plague veterans the most and learn strategies for improving their health care.

Headlines: The Patient's Journey With Chronic Hepatitis C
Teaser: How do interferon and ribavirin impact health-related quality of life during treatment for chronic hepatitis C, and are patients better off with different drug therapies?
