Headlines: Maternal Supervision and Low-Income Children's Injury Risk
Teaser: How important is the role of maternal supervision in preventing unintentional injuries among low-income, at-risk children?

Headlines: Which Quality Measures Should You Report?
Teaser: What factors should you consider when selecting and reporting quality measures, and how might each affect your score? Read this primer to maximize your success under MIPS.

Headlines: Risk Behaviors for Contact Lens-Related Eye Infections
Teaser: The latest data indicates that the majority of contact lens users in the US engage in behaviors that put them at risk for serious eye infections.

Headlines: Vertebral Fractures Frequently Underreported by Radiologists
Teaser: Vertebral fractures are largely underreported by radiologists, missing an opportunity for patients to be treated for osteoporosis and prevent further fracture.

Headlines: First Comprehensive Guidelines for Chronic Pain in HIV
Teaser: The IDSA issued the first comprehensive guidelines for treating chronic pain in HIV, recommending screening for all people living with HIV and multidisciplinary treatment focused on nondrug therapy.

Headlines: Trends in Deaths Involving Heroin and Synthetic Opioids
Teaser: What do we currently know about the regional rates of drug overdose deaths involving opioids and heroin?

Headlines: Testing Potential Uses for Light Therapy
Teaser: Green and red light therapies explored to treat migraines and skin conditions.

Headlines: FDA Clears First Mobile App for Substance Use Disorders
Teaser: The prescription-only reSET application is intended for use along with outpatient therapy to treat substance use disorders involving alcohol, cocaine, marijuana, and stimulants.

Headlines: Detecting Pressure Injury Using an Alternate Light Source
Teaser: An alternate light source traditionally used in forensic science may also be a clinically useful tool in the early detection of tissue trauma.

Headlines: The Opioid Crisis and Need for Compassion in Pain Management
Teaser: In this commentary, the author expresses concern that the response to the public health crisis of opioid addiction is creating a growing crisis of inadequate pain management.

Headlines: Waiting to Pounce: When Varicella Returns
Teaser: NYU Langone Medical Center experts discuss the complex nature of herpes zoster. Often considered straightforward, the diagnosis of herpes zoster may be overlooked and can lead to devastating sequelae.

Headlines: Updated Advice on Managing Liver Disease During Pregnancy
Teaser: Dr Rowen Zetterman reviews the new American College of Gastroenterology guidelines on caring for pregnant patients with diseases ranging from liver masses to viral infections.

Headlines: Painless Aortic Dissection in the Emergency Department
Teaser: Real-life AAD may not resemble the textbook description, so always consider AAD in sick patients even in the absence of chest pain, says Dr Mattu.

Headlines: FDA Clears New Spinal Stimulation Device for Intractable Pain
Teaser: The FDA has approve the Intellis spinal cord stimulation platform for the management of chronic intractable pain of the trunk and/or limbs associated with a variety of conditions.

Headlines: New Directions in Dry Eye: TFOS DEWS II Report
Teaser: The Tear Film & Ocular Surface Society International Dry Eye Workshop II updates our understanding of dry eye disease. Medscape spoke with the chair of this report about its clinical implications.

Headlines: Trigeminal Nerve Stimulation Relieves Migraine Pain
Teaser: One hour of external trigeminal nerve stimulation relieved the pain of episodic or chronic migraine at 1 hour and 24 hours and was well tolerated, a study shows.

Headlines: More Children Entering EDs Are Addicted to Opioids
Teaser: Emergency departments in the United States are seeing a sharp rise in the number of children testing positive for opioid dependence.

Headlines: Physicians Get Too Much Blame for Opioid Crisis, Some Say
Teaser: A resolution at the AAFP delegates meeting proposes a nationwide public relations campaign, as well as more education for all factions. Some delegates were put off by the estimated price and intent.

Headlines: FDA Panel Mulls New Data for Pain Patch in Kids
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee weighed results of new study of Butrans transdermal opioid in pediatric patients and whether label changes should be made.

Headlines: CHMP Backs Two Drugs for Opioid Abuse
Teaser: The EMA committee recommends naloxone nasal spray (Nyxoid) for treatment of opioid overdose and buprenorphine plus naloxone sublingual tablets (Zubsolv) for treatment of opioid dependence.

Headlines: Calcific Tendonitis: An Unusual Presentation of Neck Pain
Teaser: The case of a 44-year-old woman with new-onset neck pain and sound sensitivity.

Headlines: Sexual Health and Well Being in Older Adulthood
Teaser: This review provides insight into the complex relationship of mental health, marital characteristics, and a variety psychosocial and cultural factors to sexual health in older adults.

Headlines: Fasting Before Anesthesia: An Unsettled Dilemma
Teaser: While preoperative fasting for surgical patients remains a standard practice, controversy still remains. A new trial regarding gastric residual volume provides further insights.

Headlines: Barriers Rural Physicians Face Prescribing Buprenorphine
Teaser: What are the barriers rural physicians with DEA waivers face in providing buprenorphine maintenance treatment?

Headlines: Clinical Tests to Avoid Post-op Residual Neuromuscular Block
Teaser: In this study, the authors developed and validated an algorithm of clinical muscle function tests to identify residual paralysis in awake patients after anesthesia.

Headlines: The Effect of a Self-Management Program for Chronic Pain
Teaser: Is this new lay-led, self-management program an effective intervention for patients suffering from chronic pain?

Headlines: Continuous Clinical Response in Ulcerative Colitis
Teaser: Continuous clinical response has emerged as a useful target in the management of ulcerative colitis. Can it be feasibly integrated into clinical practice as a patient-reported outcome?

Headlines: The Use of Buzzy Affects Phlebotomy Pain and Satisfaction
Teaser: A new device that combines cold and vibration may help reduce pain experienced during phlebotomy procedures.

Headlines: Magnetic Resonance Imaging in Psoriatic Arthritis
Teaser: A new study explores the important role axial and peripheral MRI scans can play in the evaluation and management of patients with psoriatic arthritis.

Headlines: Youths' Perceptions of Provider Roles in Addressing Bullying
Teaser: Health care providers can play a critical role in screening for and addressing childhood bullying, but adolescent patients may feel otherwise.

Source: Seminars in Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine
Headlines: Current Medical Therapy for Sarcoidosis
Teaser: What do we currently know about the indications for treatment and the efficacy of therapeutic options for sarcoidosis?

Headlines: Consensus Bundle on Hypertension in Pregnancy
Teaser: The National Partnership for Maternal Safety recently published a safety bundle on severe hypertension in pregnancy. What are the key considerations for the anesthesiologist?

Headlines: Situational Awareness Errors and Brain Damage, Death
Teaser: Research finds that situational awareness errors may have contributed to catastrophic outcomes in most recent anesthesia malpractice claims.

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: Prescription Opioid Use in Mental Health Disorders
Teaser: At what rate do adults with mental health conditions receive prescription opioids?

Source: Journal of the American Academy of Orthopaedic Surgeons
Headlines: Marfan Syndrome: A Clinical Update
Teaser: This article provides an update to our understanding of Marfan syndrome and examines the role of orthopaedic surgeons in managing the skeletal manifestations of this disorder.

Headlines: Office-Based Andrology and Male Infertility Procedures
Teaser: Performing certain procedures in an office setting may be a safe and cost-effective option for men seeking infertility or andrologic treatment.

Headlines: Spine Surgeon Demographics and Spinal Fusion Rates
Teaser: This study examines the question of whether certain surgeon demographics are associated with greater rates of spinal fusions.

Headlines: Associations Between LBP and Muscle-Strengthening Activity
Teaser: Could engaging in muscle-strengthening activity help reduce the risk of lower back pain?

Headlines: Postop Sore Throat: Glidescope vs. Macintosh Laryngoscope
Teaser: This study compared the incidence and severity of postoperative sore throat resulting from two commonly used endotracheal intubation methods.

Headlines: Ketamine vs Ketamine and Propofol for Procedural Sedation
Teaser: Might the co-administration of ketamine and propofol for pediatric procedural sedation offer additional benefits over ketamine alone?

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: Patient-Entered Wellness Data Increases Preventive Care
Teaser: A new tool collects patient-entered data and provides personalized preventive care recommendations in several wellness areas.

Headlines: Smudging of the Motor Cortex and Low Back Pain Severity
Teaser: A new study explores the relationship between motor cortical reorganization and the severity and location of low back pain.

Headlines: Prophylactic Ureteric Stents in Renal Transplant Recipients
Teaser: Prophylactic ureteric stenting can help reduce the rate of urologic complications after renal transplantation, but what is the optimal duration of these stents?

Headlines: Validity of Two Hot Flash-related Daily Interference Scales
Teaser: This study assessed the validity of a condensed version of a 10-item psychometric self-report questionnaire for assessing the impact of hot flashes on a woman's quality of life.

Source: Journal of the American Academy of Orthopaedic Surgeons
Headlines: The Role of Therapeutic Modalities in Orthopaedic Injuries
Teaser: What does the current evidence tell us about various therapeutic modalities for the rehabilitation of patients with orthopaedic injuries?

Headlines: Exposures to General Anesthesia and Behavioral Outcomes
Teaser: Do multiple exposures to general anesthesia impact learning and attention in children younger than 3 years?

Headlines: The Bedside Nurse's Role at End of Life
Teaser: A woman with young children is dying from cystic fibrosis. How does the nurse best offer comfort and closure?

Headlines: 'Massive' Suffering: Pain Relief in Less Affluent Countries
Teaser: In much of the world, patients suffering from serious illness and injury have little to no access to palliative care and adequate pain relief.

Headlines: Opioids for C diff Pain Connected to Worse Outcomes
Teaser: Researchers have already linked opioid use to longer hospital stays and higher white blood cell counts, and now the same investigators take a deeper dive, looking at C diff severity and mortality.

Headlines: Trump's Pick for Drug Czar Pulls Out After Investigation
Teaser: The decision follows a report by the Washington Post and 60 Minutes that showed Rep. Tom Marino spearheaded legislation that made it harder for the government to police the pharmaceutical industry.

Headlines: Opioids Top List of Malpractice Claims Linked to Medications
Teaser: One problem is that some physicians cave into the requests of persuasive, pill-seeking patients against their better judgement, the medical liability insurer Coverys says in a new study.

Headlines: Misdiagnosis of Intramuscular Manifestation of Sarcoidosis
Teaser: This case demonstrates that while rare, sarcoidosis involving only the muscles, without pulmonary involvement, should be considered in a differential diagnosis of diffuse myositis.

Headlines: An Oral PAMORA Effective for Constipation in Cancer
Teaser: For the first time, there are phase 3 clinical trial data on a peripherally acting mu-opioid receptor antagonist (PAMORA) for opioid-induced constipation in cancer patients.

Headlines: Imaging Innovations: New Techniques to Aid Clinicians
Teaser: Drs Potter and Nwawka from the Hospital for Special Surgery share their thoughts on the latest in ultrasound, MRI, and CT.

Headlines: Treating Rhabdomyolysis: What Clinicians Should Know
Teaser: With the rise of extreme sports and intense workouts, here are the telltale signs of exertional muscle damage that warrants immediate medical attention.

Headlines: A Delicate Balance: Pain Management and Opioid Use Disorder
Teaser: An understanding of opioid use disorder is essential for effective and appropriate pain management.

Headlines: With Sudden Death, Don't Automatically Blame the Heart
Teaser: Drs Gayatri Acharya, Michael Ackerman, and Peter Noseworthy discuss the importance of investigating sudden deaths in light of new research showing that many presumed sudden cardiac deaths are not cardiac in origin.

Headlines: Controversy Lingers Regarding Pediatric HM Subspecialty
Teaser: Hospitalists question whether board certification will make it more difficult to attract candidates to the field.

Headlines: A 72-Year-Old Man With a Sudden, Severe Headache
Teaser: A 72-year-old man presents with a severe headache that began suddenly a few hours ago. Associated symptoms include nausea, vomiting, and neck pain. What's the diagnosis?

Headlines: From Folk to Pharma: Natural Remedies That Became Medications
Teaser: Many a folk remedy has turned pharmaceutical. Here are some of the greatest examples, and a reminder that the next big breakthrough might come from ancient wisdom.

Headlines: FDA Urges Clinicians to Help Limit Opioid Prescriptions
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration is asking clinicians to help the agency's efforts to limit both the number of opioid prescriptions and their duration.

Headlines: Spinal Anesthesia for Spine Surgery Improves Outcomes, Cost
Teaser: Use of spinal anesthesia instead of general anesthesia for spine surgery improved patient recovery and reduced costs by nearly 10%, according to the results of a single-institution study.

Headlines: Unique Drug Combo Promising for Severe, Intractable Pain
Teaser: Low doses of the hormone oxytocin in combination with the anesthetic ketamine may provide a unique and effective therapeutic approach to some patients with severe, intractable pain.

Headlines: Trial Probes Flu Shots in the Immunocompromised
Teaser: A highly anticipated clinical trial to be presented at the upcoming American College of Rheumatology meeting will help clinicians make decisions about vaccinating patients with immune disorders.

Headlines: Trump Opioid Declaration Unsatisfactory, Say US Governors
Teaser: President Trump's declaration of the opioid crisis as a public health emergency is an important first step, but the states need funding for it to have an impact, the National Governors Association says.

Headlines: Drug Use in Parents: Why We're Gonna Need a Bigger Boat
Teaser: A pediatrician is galvanized by a poignant interview with the children of drug-addicted parents.

Headlines: A 64-Year-Old Man With Acute Crushing Chest Pain
Teaser: A 64-year-old man presents to the emergency department due to a 2-hour history of acute crushing pain over his left anterior chest. What imaging findings are most likely?

Headlines: Misplaced Ecstasy? Questioning the Role of Psychedelics as Therapy
Teaser: Dr Jeffrey Lieberman scrutinizes the current trend of repurposing 'feel good' drugs for serious mental conditions.

Headlines: Rules of Thumb for Incorporating Alternative Therapies
Teaser: Traditional Chinese medicine and other alternative therapies have a lot to offer patients with cancer, says Dr Kerr. Just follow three simple 'rules' when choosing.

Headlines: Abraham Verghese: 'Revolution' Starts at Bedside
Teaser: Restoring the physical nature of the physician-patient relationship could benefit both patients and their 'healers,' says author Dr Abraham Verghese.

Headlines: American College of Emergency Physicians (ACEP) 2017 Scientific Assembly
Teaser: Read clinically focused news coverage of key developments from Anesthesiology 2017

Headlines: Anesthesiology 2017 from the American Society of Anesthesiologists
Teaser: Read clinically focused news coverage of key developments from AIPM 2017

Headlines: Academy of Integrative Pain Management (AIPM) 28th Annual Meeting
Teaser: Palliative care is not synonymous with hospice and differences between the two are commonly misunderstood. Dr Cassoobhoy discusses the nuances of palliative care medicine with experts in the field.

Headlines: Palliative Care Is About the Life That's Left, Not the End of Life
Teaser: If the anesthesia provider gives the order, can the nurse change the infusion rate or administer a bolus through an epidural catheter?

Headlines: Why Shouldn't Nurses Manage Epidural Infusions?
Teaser: A review of the latest in assessing and treating diseases of the spine.

Headlines: One in 10 Opioid Users Treated With Naloxone Die
Teaser: These people are at extremely high risk, but a lack of accessible detox and rehabilitation facilities hampers efforts to help them.

Headlines: Use of Migraine Drug as First-Line ED Therapy 'Inappropriate'
Teaser: New findings cast doubt on the use of hydromorphone as first-line therapy for acute migraine in the ED setting.

Headlines: CDC Considers Expanding Hepatitis C Testing
Teaser: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is contemplating lowering the age recommendation for hepatitis C screening, and amplifying the criteria to include those with risk factors.

Headlines: Patients Overestimate Postoperative Pain, Study Finds
Teaser: Patients regularly overestimate the amount postoperative pain they will experience after surgery; the overestimate is particularly apparent with regional anesthesia.

Headlines: Novel Injectable Tissue-Regeneration Facial Procedure
Teaser: A discussion with Dr Steven Cohen, who is behind this potential breakthrough antiaging treatment.

Headlines: An 85-Year-Old Woman With a Red, Painful Rash

Headlines: Should Labor and Delivery Nurses Perform Moderate Sedation?
Teaser: A hospital wants its L&D nurses to learn moderate sedation in the rare event that an emergency C-section is performed under local anesthesia.

Headlines: Shingles: The Pain That Remains
Teaser: In patients with herpes zoster, residual pain can be chronic, severe, and disabling. NYU Langone experts are findings ways to prevent and effectively treat it.

Headlines: Controversial Physicians Seeking Medical Breakthroughs
Teaser: The path to medical discovery is paved with brilliant minds, novel experiments, and -- at times -- controversy. We review leading researchers whose questionable choices cloud their iconic status.

Headlines: Missed Vertebral Fracture; Lost Chance to Treat Osteoporosis
Teaser: Dr Arefa Cassoobhoy highlights one of the week's important news stories for primary care.

Headlines: Oral Morphine Plus Ibuprofen Inadequate for Pain in Kids in ED

Teaser: Study suggests ibuprofen has fewer adverse effects and may be better than oral morphine for pain relief in children after minor orthopaedic surgery; neither drug provided adequate pain relief.

Headlines: Is Pelvic Drain Needed After Robot-assisted Radical Prostatectomy?
Teaser: Some patients undergoing robot-assisted radical prostatectomy do not need a pelvic drain, new research suggests.

Headlines: US Ketamine Clinics Continue to Mushroom With No Regulation
Teaser: Patients could end up the losers if some questionable practices aren't kept in check, say clinicians and medical organizations.

Headlines: Opioid Substitute Tracks Brainwaves, Serves Dancing Potatoes
Teaser: A tablet system that distracts users with individually selected content can help patients in pain feel more comfortable.

Headlines: Gabapentin Plus Opioids a Deadly Combination?
Teaser: The risk for opioid-related death was 49% higher in patients recently exposed to gabapentin and opioids compared to those exposed to opioids alone.

Headlines: Detroit-Area Physician Pleads Guilty to Medicare Fraud
Teaser: Like some other recent federal cases, this one involves inappropriate prescribing of controlled substances.

Headlines: Acupuncture for Chronic Pain: Unprecedented Advances
Teaser: The opioid epidemic and the growing elderly population underscore the need for effective alternative therapies to treat chronic pain

Headlines: Medical Marijuana Reduces CINV, Seizures in Children
Teaser: Medical marijuana helped reduce seizures and chemotherapy-related nausea and vomiting in children and adolescents, a study found.

Teaser: President Trump has stopped short of declaring America's opioid crisis a national emergency as his own special commission urged in July.

Headlines: Pain Experts Push for Coverage of Alternative Therapies
Teaser: Clinicians, health insurers, and other stakeholders are meeting to discuss the possibility of extending health coverage to include complementary and alternative therapies for pain management.

Headlines: Maternal Use of Acetaminophen Linked to ADHD in Kids
Teaser: The risk is related to duration of use, but the causal relationship is still questionable, authors caution.

Headlines: Medical Food May Help Control Inflammatory Pain
Teaser: When used as part of the clinical management of chronic inflammatory pain, a medical food appears to reduce pain without the need to increase opioid dosing.

Headlines: Mindfulness Reduces Anxiety Among Medical Students
Teaser: Practicing mindfulness, which can include activities such as yoga, meditation, and breathing exercises, reduces anxiety levels among medical students, new research shows.

Headlines: Opioid Use Down Over 10 Years for Hip and Knee Surgery
Teaser: In-hospital opioid use for hip and knee replacement decreased by one third between 2006 and 2014, researchers reported.

Headlines: e-Prescribing Bill for Controlled Substances May Soon Be Law
Teaser: Sponsors of a bill that will require electronic prescribing of controlled substances for Medicare beneficiaries are confident it will soon become law.

Headlines: Top-Selling, Top-Prescribed Drugs for 2016
Teaser: A report by QuintilesIMS found slower growth in spending for medications in 2016 compared with 2015 and predicts spending will moderate for the next 5 years as more generics and biosimilars become available.

Headlines: Quarter of Cancer Patients Use Cannabis, Mainly for Pain
Teaser: In a state where cannabis is legal, a sizable proportion of older cancer patients seeking medical care are using it, predominantly to alleviate pain.

Headlines: Heroin Use in the US Soars
Teaser: New US data show hospital discharges related to prescription opioids are down slightly, while discharges related to heroin have soared.

Headlines: Better Outcomes With Quick Interruption of Sedation in Surgical ICU
Teaser: Critically ill postoperative patients fare better when sedation is interrupted as soon as possible after admission to the ICU, compared with usual sedation care, according to results from the SOS-Ventilation trial.

Headlines: Heart Rate Variability Biofeedback Promising in Chronic Pain
Teaser: Biofeedback is a portable and relatively inexpensive treatment approach that may reduce opioid use among patients with chronic pain.

Headlines: A Behind-the-Counter Look at the Opioid Crisis
Teaser: A pharmacist shares his thoughts on what it's like being a link between legal prescriptions and the national opioid epidemic.

Headlines: Four Bloody Noses: Current Concepts in Epistaxis
Teaser: Is it just a bloody nose? These scenarios demonstrate the latest thinking about the prevention, diagnosis, and management of epistaxis.

Headlines: Appendicitis Overview Video
Teaser: This video covers the basics of appendicitis, including the pathophysiology of common causes, important signs and symptoms, complications, and treatment.

Headlines: How Safe Is Laparoscopic Surgery for Adhesive SBO?
Teaser: Dr Lowenfels comments on a study that cautions surgeons using a laparoscopic approach for treating a bowel obstruction.

Headlines: Multimodal Analgesia May Be Key in Reducing Opioid Abuse
Teaser: Drs Beckman and Soffin from Hospital for Special Surgery explain safe and synergistic methods of controlling pain.

Headlines: How Hospitals Can Fight the Opioid Epidemic
Teaser: Representatives of the Hospital for Special Surgery describe their successful three-part approach to helping patients and providers.

Headlines: Test Your Knowledge: Treating Patients After TKA
Teaser: Answer these 5 questions on treating patients after TKA for an indication of how you would do on an orthopedics board certification or maintenance of certification exam if you had to take one today.

Headlines: Does Rushing Kids to the OR Prevent Complicated Appendicitis?
Teaser: A large study seeks to answer the question: Does time to appendectomy influence the development of complicated appendicitis? Dr William Basco comments.

Headlines: The Lowdown on the Lower GI Tract --More From WCOG at ACG 2017
Teaser: Dr David Johnson continues to provide his takeaways from this meeting. In part 2, study highlights from the biliary tract and pancreas to the small intestine and colon are covered.

Headlines: Shingles: Trouble in the Trigeminal Nerve
Teaser: Herpes zoster ophthalmicus can lead to permanent vision loss, yet barriers still hinder people from receiving a vaccine for this potentially devastating event.

Headlines: Top News From ACR 2017: Slideshow
Teaser: A highly anticipated trial probing the benefit of stopping methotrexate for 2 weeks after flu vaccination to boost immune response in RA patients is among the meeting highlights.

Headlines: Acupuncture for Chronic Pain: The Latest Research
Teaser: The data support a trial of acupuncture for some common pain conditions.

Headlines: Optimizing Treatment for Castration-Resistant Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Individualizing castration-resistant prostate cancer therapy depends not only on drug profiles but also on patient-related factors. Experts offer a way through the data to reach a clinical decision.

Source: Journal of the American Academy of Orthopaedic Surgeons
Headlines: Revision TKA for the Management of Periprosthetic Fractures
Teaser: Which patient and surgical factors should be considered in revision TKA for periprosthetic fracture?

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Low-Dose Aspirin Use and Cognitive Function in Older Age
Teaser: Might low-dose aspirin, with its anti-inflammatory properties, have a favorable effect on cognition in the elderly?

Headlines: Nurses' Knowledge and Attitudes About Pain
Teaser: How might nurses' knowledge and attitudes regarding pain assessment and management impact patient satisfaction?

Headlines: FDA Clears First Device to Help Curb Opioid Cravings
Teaser: Placed behind the patient's ear, the NSS-2 Bridge stimulates branches of certain cranial nerves, which may provide relief from opioid withdrawal symptoms, the FDA said.

Headlines: Long- and Short-Acting Opioid Addiction Meds Equally Effective
Teaser: Extended-release naltrexone and buprenorphine/naloxone are similarly efficacious in preventing relapse for patients with opioid use disorder, although naltrexone was more difficult to initiate.

Headlines: Ring Block Improves Analgesia for Newborn Circumcision
Teaser: Ring block, EMLA cream, and sucrose were most effective compared with other analgesic combinations at relieving circumcision pain in neonates.

Headlines: Nerve Block and Risk of Postop Chronic Use Opioid After TKA
Teaser: Might decreasing opioid use in the immediate postoperative period by use of peripheral or neuraxial nerve blockade reduce the risk of chronic opioid use after total knee arthroplasty?

Headlines: Ready to Join Organized Marijuana Medicine?
Teaser: Physicians who treat patients with marijuana have three societies to choose from, all of them eschewing bikini-clad saleswomen.

Headlines: 'Staggering' Number of Drug, Alcohol, Suicide Deaths Projected
Teaser: More than 1.6 million deaths due to drugs, alcohol, and suicide in the United States are projected during next decade, a 60% increase compared to the previous decade.

Headlines: Doctor's Rx for a Stiff Knee:  90 Percocet Pills
Teaser: As public health officials grapple with how to slow the growing opioid epidemic, the over-prescription of narcotics after even minor surgery is coming under new scrutiny.

Headlines: CBT for Chronic Pain May Help Fight the Opioid Epidemic
Teaser: Cognitive-behavioral therapy appears to be an effective alternative to opioids for chronic nonmalignant pain, either as a stand-alone treatment or in combination with nonopioid medications.

Headlines: Cell Therapy Shows 'Hope' for Duchenne Cardiomyopathy
Teaser: In HOPE-Duchenne, patients with Duchenne cardiomyopathy who received an infusion of cardiosphere-derived cells plus usual care had a 7% reduction in myocardial scars 1 year later.

Headlines: Feds Get Tougher on Illicit Opioids
Teaser: The US Department of Justice and the DEA are taking steps to keep prescription and illicit opioids off the streets and more effectively prosecute those who distribute these agents illegally.

Headlines: Dyspnea in Advanced Cancer: 'Dying Long Before Death'
Teaser: Despite few treatment options and no consensus on standard of care, devastating symptoms of chronic refractory dyspnea can be safely reduced, even at the end of life.

Headlines: When PSA Is 4-10, phi Test Helps With Biopsy Decision
Teaser: For men whose PSA level is 4-10 ng/mL, the decision to perform a biopsy is tough, because most will not reveal a cancer. The Prostate Health Index (phi) test may help clinicians with the process.

Headlines: Eliminating Opioids for Chronic Pain Unwise?
Teaser: Solid evidence supports the long-term use of opioids in some patients as long as the benefits outweigh the risks, one expert says.

Headlines: FDA Panel Backs New Drug for Opioid Use Disorder
Teaser: RBP-6000 (Indivior Plc) is a once-monthly injectable formulation of buprenorphine that demonstrated significantly higher abstinence rates vs placebo in phase 3 testing.

Headlines: FDA Cracks Down on Marijuana Cancer Cure Claims
Teaser: Cannabidiol, which is a component of the marijuana plant, may someday have use in the treatment of cancer. But right now, products are being sold online with claims that are not supported by evidence.

Headlines: Federal Panel Urges Incentives to Prescribe Opioid Alternatives
Teaser: In its final report, the President's Commission on Combating Drug Addiction and the Opioid Crisis is calling for new federal policies including incentivizing prescribers to prescribe nonopioid and nonpharmacologic alternatives.

Headlines: Opioid Epidemic Alters Prescriber, Pharmacist Habits
Teaser: Many respondents to a Medscape poll also said that they had increasing concern about opioid-related liability.

Headlines: 10% of Cancer Patients: Persistent Opioid Use After Surgery
Teaser: Some 10% of patients with cancer who are prescribed opioids after they undergo curative-intent surgery are still filling prescriptions for the painkillers up to a year afterward.

Headlines: Navigating Methadone Treatment for Opioid Use Disorder
Teaser: Methadone can save the lives of patients with opioid use disorder, but it can also destroy those lives, so how do prescribers determine the proper candidates?

Headlines: Disease Control Prolongs QoL in Advanced Breast Cancer
Teaser: A new analysis of data from the PALOMA-2 trial in advanced breast cancer shows that quality of life (QoL) was better for a longer period in patients who had increased progression-free survival.

Headlines: Time to Have the Talk! Sex and the Cancer Patient
Teaser: Sexuality is not a topic that gets a lot of attention among cancer patients, especially in the palliative care setting.

Headlines: Baricitinib Eases Rheumatoid Arthritis Pain
Teaser: The JAK inhibitor reduced pain in rheumatoid arthritis patients refractory to methotrexate more than a TNF inhibitor, a new analysis of RA-BEAM data shows.

Headlines: OTC Painkillers Offer Similar Pain Relief as Opioids in ED
Teaser: A combination of ibuprofen and acetaminophen was as effective as opioid-acetaminophen combinations in patients presenting to the emergency department with acute extremity pain in a randomized trial.

Headlines: Opioid Crisis Inflaming Hep C, HIV in Hard-Hit Communities
Teaser: The opioid epidemic is having an effect on hepatitis C and HIV transmissions, new state-by-state data show, but funding shortcomings are translating into treatment gaps that have some experts worried.

Headlines: When Dying Becomes Unaffordable
Teaser: Physician-assisted dying is a highly controversial issue, but patients wishing to end their lives have not been immune to inflated drug costs.

Headlines: Librarians See New Patron Need: Naloxone
Teaser: Quiet places where community members congregate are the latest casualties in the opioid epidemic that is gripping neighborhoods and inspiring some unconventional interventions.

Headlines: Physician Office Visits for Opioids Drop After Steady Rise
Teaser: Until last year, there was a steady increase in the number of visits to physicians' offices that involve a prescription for opioids, national trend data show.

Headlines: FDA Issues Kratom Warning, Cites 36 Deaths
Teaser: On the basis of concerns that it is addictive and potentially life threatening, the FDA has said it will stop kratom, a botanical substance containing opioids, from entering the United States.

Headlines: Liquid Gold: Screening Urine for Drugs
Teaser: The cups of urine travel by express mail to the Comprehensive Pain Specialists lab in an industrial park in Brentwood, Tenn., not far from Nashville. Most days bring more than 700 of the little sealed cups from clinics across 10 states.

Headlines: Sarcopenia Decreases Chemo Response and Worsens With Chemo
Teaser: Sarcopenia affects all aspects of cancer treatment and response. Which strategies are known to help?

Headlines: Unilateral Sacroiliitis Following Dengue Virus Infection
Teaser: Might dengue virus be linked with the development of arthritis in the same manner as other arthritogenic viruses?

Headlines: New Therapies in IBS: What Works and When
Teaser: This review examines the evidence supporting both traditional and recently developed therapies for irritable bowel syndrome. What should be first-line therapy?

Headlines: Interventions for Depression and Anxiety in Persons With RA
Teaser: How are depression and anxiety treated in patients with rheumatoid arthritis, and how effective are the interventions?

Headlines: The Use of Silver-Coated Orthopaedic Implants
Teaser: Find out what there is to know about the different types of silver used in orthopedic practice.

Source: Cancer Control: Journal of the Moffitt Cancer Center
Headlines: Management of Leukemic and Lymphomatous Meningitis
Teaser: Early identification and treatment can, in some cases, prevent meningitis associated with hematologic malignancies.

Headlines: Biological Therapies and Improvements in QoL in Psoriasis
Teaser: This study compared the effectiveness of adalimumab, etanercept and ustekinumab on improvements in HRQoL in patients with psoriasis. What factors are associated with these improvements?

Headlines: Factors Predictive of Patients' Satisfaction of Pain Control
Teaser: Find out how these factors may impact the perception of pain control among hospitalized patients.

Headlines: Management of Symptomatic Lumbar Disk Herniation
Teaser: An international survey of spine surgeons finds practice pattern variations in the management of lumbar disk herniation.

Headlines: The Increasing Use of Cannabis Among Older Americans
Teaser: Might cannabis substitution be a viable policy alternative in the fight against the misuse of opioids as well as the under-treatment of pain at the end of life?

Headlines: Endocrinologist Allegedly Ran Pill Mill, Murdered His Wife
Teaser: An endocrinologist has been charged with the murder of his wife almost 6 years after she was shot dead. Prosecutors say he was embroiled in a scheme with a motorcycle gang to illegally prescribe opiates.

Headlines: No Opioid Cough Meds in Children Under 18, FDA Says
Teaser: Prescription cough and cold medicines containing codeine or hydrocodone are no longer indicated in any pediatric population and will be labeled for use only in adults aged 18 years and older, the FDA says.

Headlines: Can Crystals Heal? Separating Facets from Facts
Teaser: Do alternative therapies really work?

Headlines: Immune-Related Adverse Events of Checkpoint Inhibitors
Teaser: Monoclonal antibodies targeting CTLA-4 and PD-1 have immune-related adverse events that are quite different with regards to drug class and tumor type.

Headlines: Stop Selling Illegal Opioid Addiction Treatments, Feds Warn
Teaser: Two federal agencies are warning makers of a dozen unapproved opioid addiction treatments that their products are being illegally marketed and sold.

Headlines: APA Mulls Proposed Changes to DSM-5
Teaser: The American Psychiatric Association (APA) is considering five revisions to the DSM-5 following the first use of a new process that allows any physician to suggest evidence-based changes to the manual.

Headlines: Bariatric Surgery May Reduce Central Pain Sensitization
Teaser: Pain reduction in obese patients after bariatric surgery may be a result of reduced central pain sensitization as well as reduced mechanical load, and IL-10 might play a role.

Headlines: Plecanatide Gets FDA Nod for IBS With Constipation in Adults
Teaser: Plecanatide, already approved for chronic idiopathic constipation in adults, gets FDA approval for treatment of irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) with constipation in adults.

Headlines: Four Treatments for Mastectomy Pain, but 'No Magic Drug'
Teaser: Postmastectomy pain syndrome is common after the surgery. There are treatments, but they all come with caveats. In the end, some patients feel the pain is a 'lost cause.'

Headlines: Hospitals Hone New Message in Wake of Opioid Epidemic: Expect Pain
Teaser: “We really do have a lot of responsibility and culpability,” says one hospital official who is part of a working group trying to address the opioid epidemic. Patients have to expect more pain after surgery and understand the risk of addiction, says another doctor.

Headlines: Endocrinologist Accused of Wife's Murder, Pill Mill, Found Dead in Jail
Teaser: New Jersey endocrinologist James Kauffman, who earlier this month was charged with his former wife's murder and running an illegal opioid prescription drugs racket, has killed himself in jail.

Headlines: FDA Clears Vagus Nerve Stimulator for Migraine Pain
Teaser: The FDA has expanded the label for the gammaCore vagus nerve stimulator to include treatment of acute pain from migraine in addition to the previously cleared treatment of episodic cluster headache.

Headlines: DEA Expands Access to Opioid Addiction Treatment via NPs, PAs
Teaser: Nurse practitioners (NPs) and physician assistants (PAs) are now permitted to prescribe and dispense FDA-approved opioid treatment medications, the DEA rules.

Headlines: CHMP Backs Shingles Vaccine Shingrix for Adults 50 and Older
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency's CHMP voted to grant marketing authorization for the Shingrix vaccine to prevent herpes zoster and postherpetic neuralgia.

Headlines: FDA Acts to Stem Misuse, Abuse of Antidiarrheal Loperamide
Teaser: The FDA moves to limit the number of loperamide doses per package amid ongoing reports of serious cardiac problems and deaths with misuse and abuse of the antidiarrhea medication.

Source: Plastic Reconstructive Surgery-Global Open (PRS Global Open)
Headlines: Perspectives on Postmastectomy Breast Reconstruction
Teaser: How can clinicians better engage their patients to improve decision-making in postmastectomy breast reconstruction?

Headlines: Uncle's Overdose Spurs Medicaid Official to Change Course
Teaser: Almost 2 years after his uncle's death, Andrey Ostrovsky was Medicaid's chief medical officer, grappling with an opioid crisis that kills about 115 Americans each day, learned his uncle had died of a drug overdose.

Headlines: A Nudge May Be Enough to Change Healthcare Behavior
Teaser: The nation's first research unit devoted to healthcare nudges has created methods to reduce opioid numbers and encourage use of generics. Experts are finding other uses and unintended consequences.

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: Predicting Risk for Opioid Misuse in Chronic Pain
Teaser: Might something as simple as a single question assessing pain catastrophizing be useful for predicting risk of opioid misuse in chronic pain sufferers?

Headlines: Heated Intraperitoneal Chemo for Ovarian Cancer Ups Survival
Teaser: A single administration of hyperthermic intraperitoneal chemotherapy at the end of cytoreductive surgery improves overall survival in women with advanced ovarian cancer.

Headlines: Tamper-Resistant Opioids No Panacea for Opioid Crisis
Teaser: Tamper-resistant oxycodone pills are misused less often by injection drug users but have had little effect at a population level on opioid use or harm, a study from Australia finds.

Headlines: Anesthesia Medication Handling Needs a New Vision
Teaser: In this commentary, the author underscores the need for increased vigilance and standardization regarding administration of IV anesthetic agents--which currently gets short shrift in safety efforts.

Source: Journal of the American Academy of Orthopaedic Surgeons
Headlines: Comprehensive Review of Skiing and Snowboarding Injuries
Teaser: A new review provides insight into the patterns and mechanisms of musculoskeletal injuries associated with skiing and snowboarding.

Headlines: Hysteroscopic Sterilization Has Higher Risks in First 3 Years
Teaser: For women who had their first sterilization, hysteroscopic sterilization had significantly higher risk for gynecological complications during the first 3 years than laparoscopic sterilization.

Headlines: Gabapentin and Postop Delirium in Older Surgical Patients
Teaser: What impact does the perioperative administration of gabapentin have on reduction of postoperative pain, opioid use, and delirium in surgical patients over 65?

Headlines: Nurse Calls Cops After New Mom Seeks Help for Depression
Teaser: A package of mental health bills in California aims to ensure that all new moms are screened for postpartum depression and that more support is available for those who struggle with the malady.

Headlines: Trump Signs Budget Deal, Cuts Medicare Fee in 2019
Teaser: The package also extends many health programs that had expired, repeals the Independent Payment Advisory Board, and adds $6 billion to address the opioid epidemic.

Headlines: PRAC Wants Flupirtine Off the Market in Europe
Teaser: Despite restrictions put in place in 2013, serious liver problems related to flupirtine-containing medicines continue to be reported.

Headlines: Prescription Opioids Increase Risk for Serious Infections
Teaser: Use of prescription opioids, particularly long-acting formulations or high doses, appears to substantially increase the risk of developing invasive pneumococcal disease.

Headlines: Kratom Now an Opioid, FDA Says
Teaser: A new analysis by FDA scientists provides strong evidence that compounds in kratom act like prescription-strength opioids.

Headlines: Rectal Acetaminophen With IV Opioid Post-Open Heart Repair
Teaser: Is rectal acetaminophen used as an adjunct to IV opioids an effective means of pain control for infants who have undergone open heart repair?

Headlines: Marijuana May Raise, Not Reduce, Risk for Opioid Use Disorder
Teaser: A new study calls into question the assumption that broader public use of marijuana may lead to a reduction in prescription opioid abuse.

Headlines: Scoliosis Screening: Do We Need to Change?
Teaser: In light of nonsurgical options to manage children with scoliosis, should screening practices change to identify children earlier? Medscape spoke with Jennifer Winell, MD, from CHOP to find out.

Headlines: NSAID Overdose: Are Your Patients Taking Too Much?
Teaser: Dr Arefa Cassoobhoy comments on a study showing that people often take excessive doses of ibuprofen and other NSAIDs for the relief of pain.

Headlines: Suicide Among Cancer Survivors -- Highest Risk in HNC
Teaser: Metabolomics study identifies 'unexpected effects of a commonly used drug, acetaminophen, on hormone metabolism. Closer scrutiny of this commonly used medication is warranted.'

Headlines: Benzodiazepine Harms Overlooked, Especially in Older Adults
Teaser: Compared to all other cancer types, with one exception, the risk for suicide is significantly higher among survivors of head and neck cancer (HNC).

Headlines: Anthem Calls on Eye Surgeons to Monitor Anesthesia During Cataract Surgery
Teaser: International survey shows modest reductions among people aged 65 years or older, but rates of use in this population are still too high, authors say.

Headlines: 10 ERs Tried to Curtail Opioids and Did Better Than Expected
Teaser: The insurer says it is not usually medically necessary to have an anesthesiologist or nurse anesthetist on hand during the common surgery.

Headlines: Misuse of Opioids, Biologics Emphasized at AAOS 2018
Teaser: The collaboration known as ALTO, Alternatives to Opioids, set out to reduce opioid doses in the emergency room by 15 percent. It managed a 36 percent reduction instead.

Headlines: Harassment From Patients Prevalent, Poll Shows
Teaser: Harassment is more frequent against nurses than doctors, but doctors get more inappropriate communication from patients. Almost all male nurses say they have been threatened with physical violence.

Headlines: FDA Takes New Steps to Mitigate Opioid Overprescribing
Teaser: The the US Food and Drug Administration has released a revised blueprint containing core content for training that drug manufacturers are required to make available to opioid prescribers.

Headlines: Sports Medicine Can Do Without Opioids
Teaser: Dr Bert Mandelbaum on how to avoid opioids in postsurgical pain management.

Headlines: Overprescribing Opioids After Surgery for Cancer
Teaser: Oncologists need to counsel patients more actively about postoperative pain and work collaboratively in multidisciplinary teams to avoid overprescribing opioids, argues Dr Lidia Schapira.

Headlines: Your Legal Risks When Patients Don't Speak English Well
Teaser: When patients don't speak English well -- or at all -- the physician should get a translator, or incur clinical and legal risks. Here's how to comply most efficiently.

Headlines: Community Paramedics: Redefining EMS
Teaser: For sure, paramedics make house calls. Now they are beginning to provide community care to prevent unnecessary visits to the emergency department.

Headlines: A 27-Year-Old Woman With Facial Rash: USMLE Question
Teaser: A 27-year-old woman presents with fatigue, joint pain, and facial rash. What study or investigation is the best next step?

Headlines: The Future of Medicine, From a Leader in Venture Capital
Teaser: The founder of Sun Microsystems predicted that artificial intelligence will replace 80% of physicians, but he says the profession could fortify itself by changing its focus.

Headlines: Neonatal Abstinence Syndrome: How Can Pharmacists Help?
Teaser: What role can pharmacists play in preventing and treating neonatal abstinence syndrome?

Headlines: Shingrix: Is the Hype Justified?
Teaser: Dr Paul Offit compares Shingrix with Zostavax® and lays out the recommendations for the new vaccine.

Headlines: To Hug or Not: Physicians Differ on What's the Right Behavior
Teaser: Some physicians want to offer patients support; others say hugs have no business in the medical office. In today's environment, do doctors think hugs are appropriate?

Headlines: Asleep Deep Brain Stimulation as Effective as Awake
Teaser: Medscape speaks with the authors of a recent study in Parkinson disease, whose results may lead more patients to seek out this effective but underused therapy.

Source: Seminars in Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine
Headlines: Preventing Vasospasm in Aneurysmal Subarachnoid Hemorrhage
Teaser: Which strategies may help prevent cerebral vasospasm among ICU patients with aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage?

Headlines: CMS Pushing 7-Day Limit on Initial Opioid Scripts
Teaser: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services is proposing that starting in 2019, initial opioid prescriptions for acute pain be limited to 7 days.

Headlines: Long-term Effectiveness of the Live Zoster Vaccine
Teaser: A live attenuated zoster vaccine for the prevention of shingles has been licensed for older adults in the US since 2006. How effective has it been over the long-term, and does efficacy differ by age?

Headlines: Magnetic Surgery: First Prospective Clinical Trial Results
Teaser: Find out about the exciting new role a novel magnetic surgical system could have in laparoscopic cholecystectomy.

Headlines: Cerebral Oxygenation During Infant and Neonatal Anesthesia
Teaser: This study aimed to determine the incidence of low cerebral oxygenation during general anesthesia in infants. Might cerebral desaturation be a potential cause of later cognitive impairment?

Headlines: First Report of Parkinsonism Associated With Indoximod
Teaser: Learn about a case of Parkinsonism likely associated with indoximod, an indoleamine 2,3-dioxygenase inhibitor.

Headlines: Environmental Factors and Quality of Life in Older Adults
Teaser: What role do environmental factors such as housing and neighborhood characteristics, noise, and traffic play in the quality of life of community-dwelling older people?

Headlines: Recommendations of the ACIP for Use of Herpes Zoster Vaccines
Teaser: This report updates recommendations for herpes zoster vaccine in light of the newly approved recombinant Zoster Vaccine, Shingrix.

Headlines: Estradiol Therapy Mitigates Effects of Stress on Memory
Teaser: A new study examines how postmenopausal estradiol therapy may impact the effects of stress on cognition.

Headlines: McGrath MAC Laryngoscope for Routine Nasotracheal Intubation
Teaser: How does the McGrath MAC video laryngoscope compare with the Airway Scope and Macintosh laryngoscope for routine nasotracheal intubation?

Headlines: Adult Paget's Disease of Bone: A Review
Teaser: A better understanding of the pathogenesis of Paget's disease of bone in adults will lead to improved diagnostic and treatment strategies for this metabolic bone disorder.

Headlines: Newly Emerging Drugs of Abuse and Their Detection Methods
Teaser: The emergence of new illicit drugs poses a challenge for the toxicology lab. Review current methods for detection and identification of these recreational drugs in this article.

Headlines: The Use of Medical-Grade Honey on Oral Mucositis
Teaser: A medical-grade honey paste may be an effective alternative to standard mouth rinses for the treatment of oral mucositis among pediatric oncology patients.

Headlines: Trump Budget Ups Funds to Fight Opioids, Cuts HHS
Teaser: The budget takes a four-pronged approach, according to the new HHS secretary, with the fight against opioid abuse gaining some funding, while other departments may take some hits for 2019.

Headlines: Jury Still Out on CES for Depression, Anxiety, Pain, Insomnia
Teaser: There is sparse evidence supporting the efficacy of cranial electric stimulation (CES) for the treatment of chronic pain, depression, anxiety, and insomnia, new research shows.

Headlines: Orthopedic Issue in Kids? Skip These Tests, Experts Say
Teaser: The American Academy of Pediatrics and the Pediatric Orthopaedic Society of North America identified five procedures that may not be necessary in evaluating young patients with orthopedic conditions.

Headlines: Cold Water Plunge a Natural Remedy for Postop Pain?
Teaser: A patient with constant postoperative intercostal neuralgia finds immediate, complete, and sustained relief after an open-water swim in cold water.

Headlines: FDA Advisory Committee Nixes Novel Pain Drug
Teaser: Committee members expressed concern about insufficient study data on older patients and lack of clarity on plans for an abuse-deterrent program.

Headlines: American Pain Society Slams McCaskill Report on Opioids
Teaser: The APS says the report's conclusions are 'simplistic, misleading and insulting' and damage their reputation for scientific integrity and advocacy on behalf of pain management doctors and patients.

Headlines: FDA Panel Gives Exparel Thumbs Down as Regional Nerve Block
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee voted 6 to 4 against recommending bupivacaine liposomal injectable suspension as a nerve block for regional, postsurgical analgesia.

Headlines: Pain Hits After Surgery When a Patient Faces $17K Urine Test
Teaser: Elizabeth Moreno got hit with a $17,850 bill from a Texas lab after leaving a urine sample at her doctor’s office.

Headlines: Preoperative Depression, Lumbar Fusion, and Opioid Use
Teaser: This study investigated whether patients with preexisting depression have poorer outcomes following lumbar fusion. Does preoperative depression increase the use of postoperative opioids?

Headlines: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy in the Treatment of Insomnia
Teaser: How effective is cognitive behavior therapy in improving insomnia compared with medications? How long do the effects of CBT last? This review examines the current evidence.

Headlines: Laser vs. Topical Estriol for Postmenopausal Vaginal Atrophy
Teaser: Fractional CO2 laser treatment has emerged as an alternative treatment option for the management of vulvovaginal symptoms in postmenopausal women. How does it compare with topical estrogen therapy?

Headlines: Impact of Bracing After Posterior Spinal Instrumented Fusion
Teaser: Could bracing after posterior spinal instrumented fusion help improve pain relief and quality of life?

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: Antidepressants and Incident Hypertension in Primary Care
Teaser: Might commonly prescribed antidepressants increase the risk of incident hypertension?

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Opiate Prescribing in Hospitalized Older Adults
Teaser: How widespread is opiate prescribing for hospitalized patients? This study examined opiate prescribing patterns and associated outcomes in older adults hospitalized for reasons other than surgery.

Headlines: Subcrestal Iliac-Screw
Teaser: The authors describe a modified iliac-screw insertion technique to improve surgical ease and cost while reducing potential complications.

Source: Journal of the American Academy of Orthopaedic Surgeons
Headlines: Biologics, Osteotomy, and Cartilage Restoration in the Knee
Teaser: What are the best knee joint preservation strategies for young and athletic patients with complex knee pathology?

Headlines: Movement Disorders With Neuronal Antibodies
Teaser: This review describes the wide variety of autoantibody-related movement disorders, their pathophysiology, and current therapeutic options. Might they be targets for antigen-specific immunotherapies?

Headlines: Sleep and Pain Are Definitely Coupled--but How Tightly?
Teaser: Does insufficient sleep increase vulnerability to chronic pain? In this commentary, the author ponders how to structure studies which can advance our understanding of the pain/sleep relationship.

Headlines: Benefit-Risk Assessment of Crataegus Extract WS 1442
Teaser: Crataegus--commonly known as hawthorn--has long been used in the treatment of heart failure. Might it be a safe and effective adjunct in current clinical practice?

Source: Journal of the American Academy of Orthopaedic Surgeons
Headlines: Blood-Loss Management in Spine Surgery
Teaser: Which strategies may help minimize the incidence of perioperative blood loss during spine surgical procedures?

Headlines: On Unsafe Ground
Teaser: Violence against nurses remains an important issue. What strategies may help address this serious problem?

Headlines: Perioperative Duloxetine + Etoricoxib for Lumbar Laminectomy
Teaser: This study evaluated the combination of a selective COX-2 inhibitor and an SSRI for reduction of postoperative pain after spine surgery.

Headlines: Reflections on the 'Moral Monsters' Dominating the News
Teaser: Dr Robert Berezin on the lessons that high-profile cases of abuse have for parents and psychiatry.

Headlines: Electronic AKI Alerts With Automated Nephrology Consultation
Teaser: How did the launch of this electronic alert system impact the outcomes and prognosis of patients with acute kidney injury?

Source: Plastic Reconstructive Surgery-Global Open (PRS Global Open)
Headlines: Late Inflammatory Response to Hyaluronic Acid Dermal Fillers
Teaser: Are you aware of this rare complication associated with the use of injectable hyaluronic acid-based fillers? Find out what there is to know.

Headlines: The Effects of Furocoumarins Leading to Phytophotodermatitis
Teaser: Contact with citrus fruit containing furocoumarins followed by exposure to sunshine can lead to phototoxic reaction and skin injuries, as highlighted in this case.

Headlines: Long-duration GA Influences the Intelligence of Children
Teaser: This study assessed the short- and long-term impact of general anesthesia of various durations on intellectual development and cognitive performance in school age children.

Headlines: Acute Illnesses and Injuries Related to Total Release Foggers
Teaser: Total release foggers, or "bug bombs," pose a risk for acute illness when used incorrectly. Has improved labeling, introduced in 2012, reduced the incidence of adverse events?

Headlines: Malignant Hyperthermia in the Post-Genomics Era
Teaser: This review summarizes the latest evidence on the genetics of malignant hyperthermia susceptibility, guidelines for genetic diagnosis, and the limitations of current genetic screening.

Headlines: Statins Affect Skeletal Muscle Performance
Teaser: Find out how muscle function and exercise performance are impacted among patients receiving statin treatment.

Headlines: Postoperative Spinal Infections and Patient Mortality
Teaser: Find out more about the impact of postoperative surgical site infection on mortality among patients who underwent spine surgery.

Headlines: Potentially Unsafe Prescribing Common in Patients With CKD
Teaser: Early studies offer insights on correlations between certain brain wave patterns and responses to various types of nonpharmacologic treatments for chronic pain.

Headlines: DPP-4 Inhibitors May Increase Risk for IBD in Diabetes Patients
Teaser: The oral, incretin-based hypoglycemic agent was associated with a 75% increased risk for inflammatory bowel disease in adults with type 2 diabetes in a population-based study.

Headlines: Parental Behavior Significantly Influences Kids' Pain Outcomes
Teaser: Parental behavior has a major impact on a child's experience of chronic pain and associated mental health outcomes. New research shows catastrophizing and exhibiting negative emotions, such as anxiety and guilt, affect kids' response to chronic pain.

Headlines: Trump Vows to Seek Death Penalty for Opioid Dealers
Teaser: President Donald J. Trump's latest plan to stem the US opioid crisis includes stricter law enforcement, interruption of the drug supply, and seeking the death penalty for dealers.

Headlines: MRI Before Biopsy Better Than TRUS in Prostate Cancer
Teaser: PRECISION shows that MRI before biopsy in men suspected of having prostate cancer picks up more significant cancer, and less insignificant cancer, with fewer biopsy cores than standard TRUS biopsy.

Headlines: Abortion Care Varies Highly Across the US, New Report Says
Teaser: An updated report from the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine found the quality of abortion care in the United States varies greatly depending on where a woman lives.

Headlines: Tai Chi Beats Aerobic Exercise for Fibromyalgia
Teaser: Compared with aerobic exercise, the traditional martial art of tai chi is as good as, or better than, aerobic exercise for improving the overall severity of fibromyalgia symptoms, new research shows.

Headlines: Kratom-Related Salmonella Outbreak Spreads to 35 States
Teaser: Government agencies reported that 87 people have been sickened.

Headlines: Q&A: What Are We Doing About the Opioid Crisis?
Teaser: Francis Collins, MD, director of the NIH talked about the roots of this epidemic, promising research into both addiction and the treatment of pain, and President Donald Trump's budget proposal for 2019.

Headlines: Opioid Maker Funds Efforts to Fight Addiction
Teaser: Purdue Pharma, whose signature product helped fuel the opioid epidemic, now wants to help treat it — or at least salvage its own reputation.

Headlines: For Cancer, Cannabis Has Many Virtues, Says Large Study
Teaser: It's an observational study and cannot demonstrate causality, but new data from Israel indicate that cannabis may improve a range of common symptoms among cancer patients.

Headlines: Trump Signs 2018 Budget, With Some Big Wins for Healthcare
Teaser: Many programs and agencies got boosts this year, despite earlier calls for some cuts. The legislation provided no new funding for the Affordable Care Act, though.

Headlines: Shingrix Approved in Europe and Japan for Prevention of Shingles
Teaser: In clinical testing, Shingrix demonstrated over 90% efficacy against herpes zoster in adults aged 50 years or older, with efficacy sustained during the 4-year follow-up period.

Headlines: Embolization Procedure Reduces Osteoarthritis Knee Pain
Teaser: Embolization of capillaries in the knee through use of microspheres reduces pain, inflammation in patients with osteoarthritis of the knee, a small study found.

Headlines: US Opioid Overdose Epidemic Getting Worse
Teaser: Opioids were not superior to nonopioids in alleviating chronic back pain or hip or knee pain from arthritis in a randomized controlled trial.

Headlines: More Data Confirm Opioids No Better for Chronic Back, Arthritis Pain
Teaser: Avoiding gluten may not only stop disease progression but also reduce pain in patients with neuropathy due to gluten sensitivity.

Headlines: Gluten-Free Diet Curbs Pain in Gluten Neuropathy
Teaser: Opioid-related pediatric and PICU admissions climbed dramatically, highlighting the far-ranging impact of the opioid crisis; expert asks pediatricians to help fight the epidemic.

Headlines: Pediatric Opioid ICU Admissions Nearly Doubled in 10 Years
Teaser: Rhabdomyolysis is a syndrome involving muscle breakdown and damage. When muscles are injured, they release their contents, including a muscle enzyme, into the bloodstream. The disorder is dangerous but rare. In one study, 22 people out of 100,000 were known to have it.

Headlines: Exercising to Death: The Rare Risk of Rhabdo
Teaser: President Donald Trump, First Lady Melania Trump, administration cabinet leaders, and persons affected by the opioid epidemic shared their stories, struggles, and solutions at the White House summit.

Headlines: White House Opioids Summit Highlights Plans to Fight Crisis
Teaser: Previous research suggests medical marijuana may raise risks for recreational use in adolescents but may lower risks for opioid-related deaths. A study challenges these hypotheses.

Headlines: Brain Activity May Predict Treatment Response in Chronic Pain
Teaser: Surgeons are questioning how necessary opioids are after certain procedures, and are making a case for pain relief with acetaminophen, ibuprofen, and compassion as alternatives.

Headlines: Legalized Marijuana: Fewer Risks, Fewer Benefits
Teaser: A novel genetic variant has a 'robust' association with opioid dependence and may be a target for the development of novel therapies to treat the disorder.

Headlines: Medical Cannabis for Pain May Reduce Need for Opioids
Teaser: Appropriate dosing and following of key treatment recommendations for medical cannabis may lead to 'remarkable' improvements in pain and a reduced need for opioids, experts say.

Headlines: Much Can Be Done to Ease 'Chronic Fatigue Syndrome' Symptoms
Teaser: In a 2-day summit, clinician experts met to share best practices and to begin developing assessment and treatment guidance for primary care providers and specialists.

Headlines: Tips From Sports Medicine May Boost Teen Fibromyalgia Treatment
Teaser: An innovative program that combines CBT with neuromuscular training tips from sports medicine is more effective in reducing disability in teens with fibromyalgia than CBT alone, says new research.

Headlines: Individual Docs Underestimate Their Opioid Prescribing Habits
Teaser: Many emergency department clinicians underestimated the number of opioid prescriptions they wrote, but prescribed fewer once they had the information, a new study showed.

Headlines: How Many Opioid Overdoses Are Suicides?
Teaser: Opioid overdoses and related deaths are still climbing, U.S. statistics show. Teasing out which overdoses are intentional can be hard, but is important for treatment, doctors say.

Headlines: FDA Panel Backs Approval of Lofexidine for Opioid Withdrawal
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee has recommended approval of lofexidine hydrochloride, a nonopioid, for the mitigation of symptoms in the setting of abrupt opioid withdrawal.

Headlines: New Gene Variant Robustly Linked to Opioid Addiction
Teaser: The surgeon's role in the opioid crisis and the use and abuse of biologics will be accentuated at the upcoming American Academy of Orthopaedic Surgeons (AAOS) meeting.

Headlines: Opioids Unnecessary After Surgery in Some Cases
Teaser: The latest data from US emergency departments are a 'wake-up' call on the fast-moving epidemic of opioid overdoses, the CDC says.

Headlines: Targeted Genotyping for Chronic Postsurgical Pain
Teaser: Are there specific genetic factors that might identify patients at greater risk of chronic postsurgical pain?

Headlines: Lidocaine Patches for Somatic Back Pain
Teaser: Is there evidence demonstrating that lidocaine 5% patches are effective for relief of somatic back pain?

Headlines: Reoperation Rates Following Instrumented Lumbar Spine Fusion
Teaser: What are the most common factors leading to reoperation after lumbar spine fusions?

Headlines: Hijacking the Endogenous Opioid System to Treat Pain
Teaser: Learn how our understanding of the endogenous opioid system has evolved, and find out what it means to the field of pain management.

Source: Journal of Hospice and Palliative Nursing
Headlines: Nursing's Role in Providing Pain and Symptom Management
Teaser: Nurses play an important role in providing safe and efficient pain and symptom treatment to patients in palliative care.

Headlines: Treatment of Severe Skin and Soft Tissue Infections
Teaser: What are the latest management and treatment options for severe skin and soft tissue infections?

Headlines: Failed Arthritis Drug May Help Treat Opioid Addiction
Teaser: A cannabinoid type 2 receptor agonist may help prevent opioid tolerance and dependence when used in combination with opioid-based pain medications.

Headlines: Migraine and Yawning
Teaser: How common is repetitive yawning during migraine attacks? Is there an association between yawning and other migraine symptoms?

Headlines: Postburn Itch: A Review of the Literature
Teaser: The itch associated with burn injuries can be overwhelming and distressing for patients. What are the available assessment and treatment options for this problem?

Headlines: Time to Redefine Endometriosis to Include Fibrotic Nature
Teaser: Some think redefining endometriosis could limit false negative diagnoses and offer new treatment targets.

Headlines: Palliative Care Symptom Management in the ED
Teaser: When it comes to providing efficient palliative care, what do emergency physicians need to know?

Headlines: Some Body Imagers Are More Equal Than Others
Teaser: Is it true that "any radiologist can read body imaging"? In this commentary, the author argues that body imaging is just as much a specialized field as breast imaging or interventional radiology.

Headlines: Opioids, Benzodiazepines, Chronic Pain, and PTSD
Teaser: The author comments on the dangerous trend of treating traumatized patients with chronic pain and PTSD with a combination of benzodiazepines and opioids.

Source: Journal of the American Academy of Orthopaedic Surgeons
Headlines: Septic Arthritis of the Wrist
Teaser: Learn how to accurately diagnose when wrist joint infection is suspected.

Headlines: Urodynamics: Focus on the Geriatric Patient
Teaser: What are the indications for urodynamic testing in elderly patients?

Headlines: Quality of Life in Primary Aldosteronism
Teaser: How does quality of life compare between surgical treatment and medical treatment for primary aldosteronism?

Headlines: An Educational Intervention Decreases Opioid Prescribing
Teaser: Find out how an educational intervention helped decrease the number of postoperative opioids prescribed by more than half.

Headlines: Pain Assessment and Management for Older Dementia Patients
Teaser: When it comes to appropriately assessing and treating pain in older people with dementia, what do nurses need to know?

Headlines: Variant of LILRB5 Is Associated With Statin Intolerance
Teaser: The authors identify a novel immunogenetic factor associated with statin intolerance, potentially opening the door for pre-treatment pharmacogenetic testing or diagnosis of statin-induced myopathy.

Teaser: Dr Frank A. Cordasco reviews highlights from the American Academy of Orthopaedic Surgeons 2018 Annual Meeting.
